loans.name: Khov

texts.en:
Khov is a resident who has been living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is married to Yim. They have five children, four of whom are already married and live separately and independently around the province. Khov is a local farmer who has been managing farming business for over 30 years. She plants and sells various kinds of crops such as rice, beans, potatoes, maize and vegetables according to each season. 

Khov would like to improve her farm so as to earn more from it. She would like to ensure that she has healthier crops but has inadequate funds now to do so. Therefore she is asking for a loan through HKL to pay for operating expenses of planting her bean crops. Some day, with consistent effort, determination and patience, Khov will achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to pay for operating expenses of planting her bean crops.

loans.name: Dior

texts.fr: Dior est une femme mariée.Elle a une fille qui est mariée et qui lui a donné une jolie petite fille.Elle vit aussi avec sa petite soeur et une bonne partie de la famille. Dior exerce depuis plusieurs années, un commerce de tissus et de produits cosmétiques; en même temps, elle élève des moutons qu'elle revend de bons prix dés qu'ils arrivent à maturation.Ces  activités lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins mais aussi de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de la famille. Afin de renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des tissus et trois moutons.
texts.en:
Dior is a married woman. She has a daughter who is married and who has given her a granddaughter. She also lives with her younger sister and a good part of her family. Dior has been doing commerce in fabrics and cosmetic products for several years; at the same time, she raises sheep, which she resells at good prices as soon as they reach maturity. These businesses enable her to support herself and also to cover the costs of caring for her family. 

To bolster her business, Dior is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy some cloth and three head of sheep.

loans.use: to buy some cloth and three head of sheep

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en: Merlina is from Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Merlina is married and has four children. To make a living, Merlina plants & harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. She work for this for 12 years and earns 3,500 a month for these activities. In 2010, Merlina joined GDMPC. Merlina is requesting a loan of 5,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is 43 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than four years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $5 per day. One of her children is a chef who earns about $3 per day. In order to improve her family’s finance, Pov is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to resell for a profitable price. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to resell for a profitable price

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from Bliss Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Lilia is a widow and has 5 children. 

To make a living, Lilia is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community. Lilia has been in her business for 20 years and earns 8,981 a month for these activities.

Lilia is requesting a loan of 10,000 which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2006, Lilia joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en: Nelie is married with two children. She is 35 years old and lives in Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Nelie manages a plot of corn and coconut farm land for their living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns 4,000 each month. She requested a loan of 6,100 to purchase farm chemicals and seedlings. Nelie is a new member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC. In the future, Nelie plans to save her returns in order to buy another farm land.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals and seedlings

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en: Bienvinida, a 42-year-old mother of 7 children, is married and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Bienvinida used her last loan to purchase fertilizers. Her dream of expanding is merely coming, and she's taking a new loan to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping . In the future she hopes to be able to raise her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en: Freddie is 48 years old, married and has 1 child. He is from Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where his coconut wine retail business is located. He runs this business for 6 years and at the end of the month, Freddie gets 7,000. Freddie joined GDMPC in 2006. He has borrowed 41,500 to buy more coconut wine to sell. He hopes to expand and improve his business one day.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is from Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Jennifer is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Jennifer owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells a variety of different products such as canned goods, vegetables and soy sauce, in the local community. Jennifer has been in her business for 17 years and earns 10,000 a month from these activities. In 2004, Jennifer joined GDMPC. Jennifer is requesting a loan of 15,900 to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sikola

texts.en:
Sikola is a 36 year old married woman with 6 children. 
She has a small plantation and grows veggies to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Sikola has requested a loan to to expand her vegetable garden. 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Sikola hopes to save up for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers, seeds, cabbages

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 41 years old, married and lives in Tabid, Ozamis City with her 8 children. She manages a mango and coconut production, type of business 13 years ago that gives her a monthly income of 2,000. With the desire to improve it, she would like to borrow the amount of 3,850 from GDMPC in order to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Gemma has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In God’s time, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia, a 48-year-old married woman, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where she has owned and operated a banana plantation to make a living for 10 years now. This business gives Virgilia a monthly income of 5,000.
Having joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services, she has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Virgilia hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Ella

texts.en: Ella is married who has 6 children. Ella is 50 years old, and resides at Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Ella plants & harvests vegetables and cassava for sale to earn a living and she's been 21 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. In 2009, Ella joined GDMPC. In the future, Ellawants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is married with 3 children. Rosanna is 42 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Rosanna manage her own sari-sari store to earn a living and had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 5000 doing this type of work. She had requested a loan of 3000 to purchase more stock for her general store.
Rosanna has been a new member of PMPC . In the future, Rosanna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is 47 years old, married with three children, residing at Sebasi Clarin, Philippines. Jerry used his last loan to purchase more swine. His business is successful, and his taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is from Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, she raises vegetables and roots crops for sale. She has been in her work for 5 years and earns 3,000 a month for these activities. In 2010, Liza joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 which will be usedto purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen buys and sells fish for a living. She is married and has seven children living with her at Cabd-Anonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Helen is 54 years old. She's been in the fish selling business for 26 years and gets a revenue of PHP 3,000 per month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. Helen has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Helen wants to build a house and to put her children through school.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Yean is 31 years old and blessed with two grown-up children, all of whom are attending school with her income. She is a determined mother and works hard to be financially stable. She spends most of her time working outdoors at the rice field. She manages her rice farming business wisely, because she attended a course related to the agricultural sector and has had many years of experience in this type of business. Presently, she lives with her family in a small village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province.

Yean is experiencing difficulties due to the lack of having a personal use vehicle. She told us that she spends a lot of money on transportation services each month. In this matter, Yean would like to take out a loan to purchase a used motorcycle to satisfy the family’s needs. It will enable her to get more benefit from her time, her business, and reduce her daily expenses. Yean aspires to expand her farmland to increase her household income in the following years.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle to satisfy the family’s needs.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 40 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Merlie has a general store that sells consumable goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Merlie has been a member of PMPC for almost one year.  In the future, Merlie hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: La Estrella Celeste Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Estrella Celeste lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es  Rosa Esmeralda de 35 años de edad quien tiene una pulpería desde hace dos años la cual inicio con la venta de chiverías, gaseosas, refrescos…etc. además comercializa cosméticos. Ella invertirá el crédito en sus dos negocios pero priorizara los cosméticos para el día de las madres.
Las otras integrantes son Skarleth quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 3 años y Mercedes quien vende leña y frijoles desde hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The group "La Estrella Celeste" [The Heavenly Star] is made up of hardworking and entrepreneurial women. One of them is Rosa Esmeralda, 35, who has had a grocery store for two years which she started up with the sale of dairy products, soft drinks, refreshments etc. In addition she sells cosmetics. She will invest the loan in her two businesses, but will give priority to the cosmetics for Mother's Day. 

The other members are Skarleth who devotes herself to selling used clothing, which she has done for three years, and Mercedes who sells firewood and beans which she has done for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase grocery staples and cosmetics.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 51 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Gaudiosa has a business selling a variety of snacks and viands. She earns about PHP 3000 each month doing this type of work. Gaudiosa has requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks and viand business.

Gaudiosa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gaudiosa would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snacks and viand business

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Rafaela Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rafaela lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora es Ana Sofia de 21 años la cual se dedica la venta de calzado desde hace dos años con ayuda de su madre. Esta joven trabaja arduamente para lograr pagarse sus estudios superiores en Derecho y su meta es terminar su carrera.
Los otros integrantes son Melania de 60 años quien vende pollo desde hace 2 años y Lesther de 28 años quien vende leña desde hace 4 meses.
texts.en:
The group "Rafaela" is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial people. The coordinator is Ana Sofia, 21, who dedicates herself to selling footwear which she has done for two years with the help of her mother. This young woman works devotedly in order to be able to pay for her advanced studies in Law and her goal is to complete her studies in the field. 

The other members of the group are Melania, 60, who sells chickens which she has done for two years, and Lesther, 28, who sells firewood which he has done for four months.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, sandals, flip flops, etc.

loans.name: Thioro

texts.fr: Thioro est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de 4 enfants dont l'un fréquente l'université et l'autre tient un commerce.Elle exerce un commerce de chaussures, d'encens et d'autres produits divers. Elle s'approvisionne en gros dans la capitale oû les prix sont plus bas et revend au détail et à crédit à ses clients à travers sa localité.Depuis des années, ce commerce lui permet de prendre en charge le frais de scolarité de son fils qui est en phase de terminer aujourd'hui' hui ses études.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des chaussures et de l'encens.Son ambition est d'aider son fils commerçant à voyager à l'extérieur du pays.
texts.en:
Thioro is a married woman and the mother of four children, of whom one is a university student, and another has a business. Thioro has a business selling shoes, incense, and a variety of other products. She gets her supplies wholesale in the capital city, where prices are lower. Accepting credit, she sells retail to her customers throughout her town. 

For years, this business has enabled Thioro to cover the cost of schooling for her son now finishing his studies. 

To bolster her business capital, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy shoes and incense. Her ambition is to help her son with the business to travel abroad.

loans.use: to buy shoes and incense

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for doors and general maintenance costs for her vehicle.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol es una mujer trabajadoras y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de artesanía y cosméticos desde hace 9 años. Este negocio lo inicio cuando fue a visitar a su hermana en Costa Rica y vio que había un buen comercio ahí desde entonces inicio a llevar productos de Nicaragua a Costa Rica. 
Ella tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales solo el menor de 12 años depende de ella. Su meta es comprar otra casa  ya que la que tenia se la dio a su penultima hija de 20 años.
texts.en:
Ms. Marisol is a hardworking and entrepreneural woman who devotes herself to selling handcrafted items and cosmetics which she has done for nine years. This business got its start when she went to visit her sister in Costa Rica and saw there was good trade there. From that time on she began bringing Nicaraguan products to Costa Rica. 

She has four children of whom only the youngest, who is 12, depends on her. Her goal is to buy another house since she gave the one she used to have  to her next-to-youngest child, her 20-year-old daughter.

loans.use: to purchase handcrafted merchandise and cosmetics.

loans.name: Guiancarlo

texts.es:
Giancarlo   es un hombre que tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, sin hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con sus padres. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Gaincarlo vive en  el caserío Peña Viva del distrito de Tambogrande y departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Giancarlo es la crianza/venta de ganado ovinos, caprinos  y aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Giancarlo cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona.
Actualmente Giancarlo se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.800 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados  y arreglo de corrales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Giancarlo is a 20 year old man who is single and does not have children. He lives in his own house with his parents. He lives in a substance-level community where the majority of residents are independent workers who work in commerce or raising small animals and some also work in agriculture. Giancarlo lives in the village of Peña Viva in the district of Tambogrande and the department of Piura. Here he has only basic electrical supply and they get their water from an artesian well. All the families from here live under these conditions. 
Giancarlo works raising and selling sheep, goats, and poultry. He raises his animals in corrals outside his house. It is noteworthy that Giancarlo has 2 years of experience in this work and, as a result, he has loyal customers. He sells his animals to the wholesalers in the area.
Currently, Giancarlo is proposing to grow his inventory, or, in other words, to raise and sell more animals. This is because it is a very profitable activity in this area. It is for these reasons that he is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the sum of $325, which will be used to buy balanced animal feed and fix the corrals. In time, this will enable him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and fix the corrals.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.fr:
Madame Fatema, âgée de 45 ans fait du commerce depuis 6 ans. Elle fait de la vente de tissus, d’ensembles prêt à porter, d’encens. Elle est à son second crédit à l’IMCEC.  Elle vend aussi du savon et des produits cosmétiques. Elle demande un renouvellement de 300000Fcfa pour pouvoir  acheter  du parfum, des crèmes, du savon. Elle a un système de vente qui  consiste à donner la marchandise à crédit et à récupérer journalière ment l’argent. Elle réussi à rembourser normalement son crédit  et à diversifier ses produits et services.
Fatema est mariée et appui son époux dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. 
Dans l’avenir, elle aimerait agrandir son activité en  variant ses ventes.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatema, aged 45, has been working in commerce since the age of 6. She sells fabrics, ready-to-wear outfits, and incense. She also sells soap and cosmetics. She is asking for a renewal of 300,000 francs CFA to be able to buy perfume, lotions, and soap. 

Fatema has system for selling that consists of offering merchandise on credit and collecting the money daily. She has succeeded in paying back her loan normally and in diversifying her products and services. 

Fatema is married and supports her husband in managing day-to-day expenses.  

In the future, she would like to expand her business by varying her sales.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, cosmetic products, and ready-to-wear outfits to resell

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio   es un hombre que tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, con un hijo a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Rogelio vive en  el caserío Cólera del distrito de Tambogrande y departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad  a la que se dedica Rogelio es la agricultura pues tiene 2.0 ha. De terreno agrícola , en el cual tiene sembrado cultivo de limón  que presenta buen desarrollo vegetativo, donde cosecha semanalmente y luego lo comercializa en el mercado local de la zona, esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace 7 años que le ha permitido tener  de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo su cónyuge se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, venta de pollo fresco en casa y le apoya en las actividades que realiza, es decir existe una buena relación familiar.
Actualmente Rogelio se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la venta de su producción cosechado ,esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de fertilizantes, bioestimulantes, y compra de alimentos para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a 54 year old man who is not married and has a son in his care. He lives in his own house with his partner. He lives in a subsistence-level community. The majority of residents are independent workers who work in commerce or raising small animals and some also work in agriculture. Rogelio lives in the village of Cólera in the district of Tambogrande and the department of Piura. Here he has only basic electrical service and water from an artesian well. All the families from here live under the same conditions.
Rogelio is a farmer and he has 2 hectares of agricultural land in which he grows lemons, which grow well. He harvests weekly and later sells the goods in the local market. He has been doing this for 7 years, which has given him plenty of experience and enabled him to maintain loyal customers for his business. His partner works raising small animals and selling fresh chickens from home and he helps her with her work. That is to say, they have a good family relationship. 
Currently, Rogelio is proposing to grow his inventory, that is, increasing the harvested fruit that he sells. This is because this is a very profitable product in the area. For these reasons he is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa for $575 which he will use to buy fertilizers and food for his animals. In time, this will enable him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops and to buy food for his animals.

loans.name: Mano Amiga Group

texts.es:
El grupo mano amiga lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora del grupo es Mariela quien tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con algunos productos principalmente chiverías y refrescos. En el negocio vende aproximadamente 43,600 mensual. Ella está casada con Marvin quien trabaja en Costa Rica y con el que tiene tres hijos.
El crédito lo invertirá en granos básicos y refrescos entre otros productos.
Las otras integrantes son Amparo del Socorro quien vende ropa desde hace 30 años en San Rafael y Anielka vende ropa en Diría.
texts.en:
The Mano Amiga Group is composed of three entrepreneurial, hard-working women and Mariela is the coordinator of the group.  She has a small grocery store which began by selling just a few products, mainly snacks and soft drinks.  The business sells approximately 43,600 monthly.  Mariela is married to Marvin, he works in Costa Rica, and they have three children.

The loan will be invested in bulk grains, soft drinks, and other products.

The other members of the group include Amparo who has sold clothing for 30 years in San Rafael, and Anielka who sells clothing in Diria.

loans.use: to buy grains, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Palestina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Palestina lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es María Luisa quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita (tacos, tajadas con queso, enchiladas, maduro frito…etc.) el crédito lo invertirá en aceite, carne, tortilla, leña…etc. 
Ella está casada con Marlon quien es chofer y con quien tiene dos hijos.
Las otras integrantes son  Perla quien  tiene una pulpería desde hace 8 años y Suhey quien vende cosméticos y perfumes desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The Palestina loan group is comprised of 3 hardworking women, one of whom is María Luisa, who has a "fritanga", a popular type of restaurant that sells fried food (tacos, cheese tajadas, enchiladas, fried plantains, etc.) She will use the loan to buy oil, meat, tortilla, wood, etc.
She is married to Marlon, who is a driver, and they have 2 children.
The other members are Perla, who has had a grocery store for 8 years, and Suhey, who has been selling cosmetics and perfumes for 4 years.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, tortillas, wood, etc.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Lázaro  es un hombre que tiene 59 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con tres hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Lázaro vive en  el caserío Manco Inca del distrito de Tambogrande y departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad  a la que se dedica Lázaro es la agricultura pues tiene 6.0 ha. De terreno agrícola, en el cual tiene sembrado cultivo de limón y mango  que presenta buen desarrollo vegetativo, donde cosecha semanalmente y luego lo comercializa en el mercado local de la zona, esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace 15 años lo que le ha permitido tener  de experiencia; Así mismo su cónyuge se dedica a la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, aves de corral), y le apoya en las actividades que realiza, es decir existe una buena relación familiar.
Actualmente Lázaro se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la venta de su producción cosechado ,esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 4000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas, y compra de alimentos para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Lazaro is a 59-year-old man whose status is married, with three dependent children, and who lives in his own home with his spouse. The quality of life in the community where he lives is subsistence. The majority of inhabitants are independent workers who devote themselves to commerce and small animal husbandry. Some of them also cultivate crops. Lazaro lives in the Manco Inca hamlet in the district of Tambogrande and department of Piura. He has only basic services including electricity, and obtains water by means of a traditional well. All the families who are based there likewise live under these same circumstances. 

Lazaro devotes himself to agriculture as he has 6.0 hectares of farmland where he has planted lime and mango crops which are showing good vegetative development. He harvests his crops weekly and then sells them in the area's local market. He has been developing his farming activities for 15 years which has granted him experience. Likewise his spouse devotes herself to raising small animals (sheep and poultry) and supports him in his farming activities. Thus there are good family relations. 

Currently Lazaro has determined to expand his inventory with respect to the sale of his harvested products, since it is a very profitable activity in the area. Therefore he is seeking a new loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 4,000 Peruvian soles which is to be used for purchasing fertilizers, pesticides and feed for his animals. In time this will allow him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his crops and feed for his animals.

loans.name: Guadalupana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guadalupana lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Silvia Patricia quien desde hace dos años inicio su pequeño negocio de venta de  comida para animales, medicamento y champú en Niquinomo. El crédito lo invertirá en purina, pro-plan, dhog chow, pet pride, can pro, medicamentos y champús, jabones…etc.
Los otros integrantes son Rosa Esperanza quien vende hojas negocio que realiza junto a sus siete hijos y esposo, Bertha es comerciante de ropa y zapatos y Rodolfo tiene un billar donde vende gaseosa.
texts.en:
The group "Guadalupana" consists of four hardworking and enterprising individuals. One of them is Silvia Patricia, who started her small business two years ago. She sells pet food, medicines, and shampoos in Niquinomo. Her loan will be invested in brand name products such as Purina, Pro-Plan, Dog Chow, Pet Pride, Can Pro, as well as medicines, shampoos, soaps, and other items.

The other members are as follows: • Rosa Esperanza sells leaves, a business that she manages with her husband and seven children. • Bertha is a merchant who sells clothing and shoes. • Rodolfo manages a billiard hall where he also sells soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy pet food, medicines, and shampoo.

loans.name: Hagie

texts.en: Hagie is 33 years old, married with three kids living in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Hagie used her last loan to purchase fertilizer. She was able to develop her business well. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. She hopes to be able to nurture her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco, aged 77, is a widower with four children, residing in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Francisco used his last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. His business is successful, and he is taking out a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion is from Kinuman, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Visitacion is widowed and has four children. Visitacion plants and harvests corn for sale. She has been in her business for seven years and earns PHP 10,000 each month. In 2006, Visitacion joined GDMPC. Visitacion is requesting a loan of PHP 15,850, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her next crop. She plans to use her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her next crop

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a 52-year-old businessman. He is married to Florence, a business lady. They are blessed with four children. He has been running a hotel for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 10,500, which he uses to support his family members. 

He is applying for his third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Titus will use the loan to purchase stock of wheat flour, sugar, and rice for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, sugar, and rice for his business

loans.name: Nicolata

texts.en:
Nicolata is a 51-year-old business lady. She is married to Edward and they have three children. Nicolata has been selling secondhand clothes in wholesale for the past 10 years, with an approximate monthly income of KES 50,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Nicolata is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. The client will use the loan to buy more stock, like pullovers and trousers for selling. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will add more stock and educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own the biggest boutique in Embu Town and construct rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of pullovers and trousers for a new shop

loans.name: Adji Astou

texts.fr: Madame Adji  Astou est mariée et âgée  de 28 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal et s’active dans le secteur  du commerce. Elle pratique  la vente  de produits cosmétiques et  d’habits dans  son quartier d’habitation. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par  nécessité, afin de subvenir a ses propres  besoins. Les aspects qui l’intéressent  le plus dans son activité sont les moments de rencontre et d’échange  avec ses clients  mais aussi  la  réalisation des bénéfices qu’elle lui procure. Elle est membre de L’U-IMCEC depuis décembre 2011.  Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits cosmétiques et d’habits qui seront destinés à la vente. Ce financement pourra l’aider à développer son activité, augmenter ses  bénéfices et participer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie économique et sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Adji  Astou is married and 28 years old. She lives in Sénégal and is active in the commercial sector. She sells cosmetics and clothing in her residential district. This is a business she chose out of necessity to support herself.  What interests her the most in her business are the times she meets and interacts with her customers but also making a profit from it. 

Ms. Adji  Astou has been a member of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC since December 2011. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for buying cosmetics and clothing to be sold. This financing will help her to develop her business, increase her profits, and help improve her family's economic and social situation.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and clothing to resell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is 58 years old, married and has five children. To make a living, Touch is involved in a rice farming business to generate income. Also, she owns and operates a small store located in a local school, where her husband is a professional teacher. She sells snacks, sweets and beverages to students, earning a suitable income, which she spends on food and allowances for her children.

To improve her business, she is now asking for a loan to purchase snacks, sweets, biscuits and other merchandise to sell in her store. She hopes that the loan will enable her to make improvements to this business and make it aviable source of income. Touch would be glad if her requested loan amount was approved.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, sweets, biscuits and other merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cherlita

texts.en:
Cherlita is married with 3 children. She is 33 years old and resides in Kahayagan West, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Cherlita has been in business for 6 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, she joined GDMPC.

She request a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more rolls of string made from lagpakanay (a kind of plant). In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rolls of string made from lagpakanay (a kind of plant)

location.town: Kahayagan West, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Torre Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Torre lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Martha Ercilia de 46 años quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita, vende hielo y leña. Este negocio lo inicio con la venta de sopa los lunes, sábados y domingo luego empezó a realizar tacos, tajadas, enchiladas…etc. Además tiene una barbería la cual administra su hijo.
Ella invertirá el crédito en mejoras al negocio principalmente cambiar el techo del negocio, comprar un cocina y productos para la barbería. 
Martha tiene 5 hijos de los cuales tres son menores de 19, 16 y 3 años los cuales estudian.
Los otros integrantes son María de 54 años quien tiene una dulcería donde produce los típicos postres nicaragüense las cajetas, pillo quinto, atol, buñuelos….etc. y Candido quien es buhonero de golosinas desde hace 20 años.
texts.en:
The Las Torres (The Towers) group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. 

One of them is Martha Ercilia, age 46.  She has a “fritanga”, a popular fried food restaurant.  She also sells ice and firewood.  She started  this business by selling soup on Mondays, Saturdays, and Sundays.  Then she started to make tacos, sliced plantains, and enchildadas, etc.  In addition to that she has a barber shop that her son runs.

She will use the loan to make improvements to her business.  She will mainly change the roof on her business, buy a stove, and buy products for the barber shop.

Martha has five children.  Three of them are minors, ages 19, 16, and 3, and they go to school.  

Her fellow group members are María, age 54,who sells typical Nicaraguan sweets and Cándido, who has been peddling sweets for 20 years.

loans.use: to change the roof on her business, buy a stove, and buy products for the barber shop.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
This is Jesus, 66, resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. He is married to Cristeta the mother to their four children – all of them have already had their own families. Jesus, manages his household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jesus operates a room/apartment rental business. He is currently managing nine units that local students and employees rented on a monthly basis. He earns a minimum of 6000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 37,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for the repair and maintenance of his rental units. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Jesus hopes to be able to do his renovation soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of his rental units

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 52-year-old farmer with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Before venturing in to the agricultural sector, he used to sell secondhand shoes, where he accumulated his start-up capital for his current projects. He has a personal dream of educating his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. His business is affected by seasonal changes and price fluctuations and his goal is to become one of the role model farmers. Patrick wants a loan to buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings for planting

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en: Concordia is married with 8 children. Concordia is 55 years of age and she lives in Pulang Yuta, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Concordia manages a retail store; she sells a variety of products and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. Concordia has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year. In the future, Concordia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Wanjiru

texts.en:
Wanjiru is a 55-year-old horticultural and livestock farmer. She is married to John, who is a carpenter, and they have three children aged 25, 15, and 13 years of age. She has been in operating the business for the past five years with an average income of KES 40,000 monthly, which she uses to support her family.

She intends to use the loan to add more cows for milk production and lease new land for horticulture. The anticipated profits from the expanded business will be used to educate her son in college and buy new land for farming. 

Her future dreams are to own a large track of land for farming and ensure that her child gets a high-quality education.

loans.use: to add more cows for milk production and lease new land for horticulture

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en: Ignacia buys and sells fish for a living. She is married and has three children living with her in Cabd-Anonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Ignacia is 51 years old. She's been in the fish selling business for 25 years and receives an income of PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to repair her fishing boat. Ignacia has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Ignacia wants to build a house and put her children through school.

loans.use: To repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Maria Nia

texts.en:
This is Maria Nia, 40, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Jessiemar, her business partner, and is mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria Nia is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria Nia dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of fish needed in her business

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana Erina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien vende truchas y granos básicos desde hace 12 años la cual inicio con muchas limitaciones y poco a poco fue amentándola con lo cual logro sacar adelante a su familia. Ella está casada y tiene tres hijos ya mayores de edad.
Su sueño es poder trabajar sola sin más préstamos.
texts.en:
Emiliana Erina is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman that has sold trout and dry grains for 12 years.  Her business began with lots of challenges and little by little things improved, which helped her family get ahead.  She is married and has three adult children.

Her dream is to be able to work alone without asking for more loans.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains and trout

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
This is Amelita, 56, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a driver, and father to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Amelita operates a peanut butter making business. What she basically does is buy raw peanuts and other ingredients needed in making her product from the market, process it then repacked them and sell them per piece to individual, general store owners and local community. Peanut butter is repacked in 250 and 500 gram plastic bottles. She also sells accessories for additional income. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of raw ingredients used in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Amelita dreams to be able to give her all her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ya son mayores, vive en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula Cortes.
Maribel hace 5 años tiene un negocio de venta de Ropa de segunda mano. Inicio este negocio con la necesidad de generar un ingreso extra que le permitiera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos diarios del hogar. Ella acondiciono un lugar en una parte de su casa en donde manifiesta le ha ido muy bien ofreciendo a sus clientes ropa de Damas, caballeros y niños, este negocio le genera buenos ingresos y esta muy contenta trabajando en el.
 Es su primer préstamo con ODEF de 10,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para surtir su negocio. 
Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio, poder comprar un carro para también vender su mercadería de manera ambulante y poder aumentar más sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Maribel is 46 years old, married, and has three grown children. She lives in the city of San Pedro Sula Cortes.

Maribel has been in the business of selling secondhand clothing for five years. She started this business out of necessity so that she could generate extra income to help her husband with the daily household expenses. Maribel remodeled a space in her house where she could set up her business. She has done very well since she offers her customers clothes for women, men, and children. This business generates a good income and she is very pleased to be working in it.

This is her first loan with ODEF. The amount of 10,000 HNL will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise to restock her business. Her goal is to grow her business so that she can buy a car. She also sells her merchandise as a traveling merchant so that she can increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is married with one child. She is 52 years of age and lives in Lapinig, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte. Marilyn used her last loan to purchase goods to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 58, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her four children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rebecca maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rebecca dreams to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdou est commerçant depuis 12 ans maintenant. Un commerce qui consiste à vendre des batteries de véhicules .Il possède un atelier  ou il a investi les deux crédits pris à l’IMCEC. Actuellement, il désire un prêt de 450000FCFA pour acheter 20 batteries et  120 bouteilles d’acide ; parce que en dehors du commerce, il fait aussi de la prestation de services.
C’est avec les revenus de son activité qu’il réussi à gérer au quotidien la dépense de son foyer et à être  au petit soin de ses enfants.
Il a comme souhait d’avoir un fond de roulement consistant afin de proposer d’autres services à sa clientèle ; et cela il compte énormément sur l’appui des préteurs.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou has been a merchant for twelve years now. It's a business that consists of selling vehicle batteries. He owns a store where he has invested the two loans gotten from the microfinance institution IMCEC. 

Currently, he would like a loan of 450,000 francs CFA to buy 20 batteries and 120 bottles of acid, since he also offers a range of services aside from his trade. 

With the revenues from his business, Mr. Abdou is successful in managing his day-to-day home expenses and in caring for his children attentively.

His wish is to have working capital substantial enough to offer more services to his customer base; and so he is counting on the support of his lenders enormously.

loans.use: to buy vehicle batteries for resale

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 41 years old and married with four school-aged children. She resides with her family in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Being a responsible mother, Sam tries hard and is patient in her business of planting crops. And she also devotes her time to manage household things and educate her children to follow a good path in life. Sam has been doing this type of business alongside her husband, a supportive man, for more than 20 years.

At this time, Sam would like to expand and make improvements to her business, so she is asking for a loan through HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to pay for the operating expenses of planting potatoes for future selling. This will be her second loan from HKL. She said that the previous loan helped her a lot in developing her business. She hopes to make a good income from this investment and save some more for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to pay for the operating expenses of planting potatoes for future selling

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 37-year-old businessman. He is married to Caroline and they are blessed with two children. Bernard runs a stationery shop, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000. He intends to start a retail shop as his secondary business.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. The client will use the loan to buy stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar for his new identified business opportunity of a retail shop. 

With the anticipated profits from his two businesses he plans to plough back into his businesses and educate his children. His future dream is to operate a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 55 years old and is a married woman with 6 children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Corazon runs a sari-sari (general) store business in her town. She sells canned goods, toiletries and other items. She also sells firewood and charcoal to her community. Corazon earns 3000 PHP per month with her business. She hopes to expand the variety of merchandise she sells. She plans to use her loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks and firewood.

In the future, Corazon hopes to earn more and to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks and firewood

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Doña Doris tiene un negocio de venta de comida, en donde ofrece a sus clientes la venta de baleadas, almuerzos y tortillas de maíz. Ella dice que la motivación de dedicarse a esta actividad fue para poder ayudar a su hijo menor con sus estudios. Y ha logrado superarse con la ayuda de los financiamientos que Odef le ha proporcionado.
Por el cual ahora esta solicitando otro préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para invertir en comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos y otra parte para poder pagar la construcción de un eco fogón que utilizara para cocinar los alimentos.
Su plan es poder obtener un local en un lugar céntrico y transitable de personas para poder crecer y formar un patrimonio económico para su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Doris, age 48, is married and has three children.  She lives in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Doris has a business selling food.  She sells her customers "baleadas" (flour tortillas with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat), lunches, and corn tortillas.  She says that her motivation for devoting herself to this business activity was to be able to help her minor son with his education.  She has managed to improve herself with the loans that ODEF has given her.

She is now requesting another loan for 15,000 lempiras to buy the supplies she needs to make the food.  She will use another part to be able to pay to build an “ECOFUGON” ( improved wood-burning cook stove that is more efficient in producing plant carbon of better quality) that she will use to cook the food.

Her plan is to be able to have a place in a central area that people frequent in order to be able to grow and form a financial heritage for her minor son.

loans.use: to buy the supplies she needs to make the food,and  to build an “ECOFUGON” ( improved wood-burning cook stove that is more efficient in producing plant carbon of better quality).

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe De Santa Clara Group

texts.es: Un grupo de mujeres y hombres que con entusiasmo y mucha dedicación sale adelante cada día. Así son los integrantes de la alcancía comunal Virgen de Guadalupe de Santa Clara conformado por 10 socios, llevan la ardua tarea de trabajar en sus negocios para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Tal es así el caso de la señora Vilmar de 58 años de edad, casada y madre de 3 hijos de los cuales todos son mayores de edad. La señora Vilmar cada día se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Todo comenzo ya que su hermana tiene el mismo negocio, le ayudo y enseñó, a como poner su propio negocio. Con los ingresos de su negocio a podido llevar adelante a su familia y pudo ayudar a su esposo en la construccion de su vivienda. Con el presente préstamo implementara  la mercadería para sus ventas de ropa. Como ella cada integrante tiene una historia en particular pero, si en algo coinciden es en el entusiasmo y las ganas de salir adelante para el bien y mejoría económica de sus negocios y familias.
texts.en: This is a group of men and women who have a lot of enthusiasm, and they are dedicated to getting ahead each day.  The members of the communal bank "Virgen de Guadalupe de Santa Clara" include 10 people who work arduously in their businesses so that they can improve the quality of life for their families.  Such is the case with Vilmar, 58, who is married and is the mother of 3 grown children.  Every day, Vilmar works selling clothing for men, women and children.  It all started because her sister has the same business, and she taught Vilmar and helped her to establish her own business.  She has been able to get ahead with her family with the income from her business, and has been able to help her husband in building their home.  With the current loan, she will stock up on more merchandise for her clothing business.  Like Vilmar, every member of this group has a particular story, but what they share in common is the enthusiasm and desire to get ahead so that they can improve their businesses and provide for the welfare of their families.

loans.use: to invest in her clothing business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda, 60, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Jose, her business partner. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luzviminda operates a peanut butter making business. What she basically does is buy raw peanuts and other ingredients needed in making her product from the market, process it then repacked them and sell them per piece to individuals, general store owners and the local community. Peanut butter is repacked in 250 and 500 gram plastic bottles. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of raw ingredients used in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Luzviminda dreams to be able to give her all her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a 40-year-old businessman. He is married to Benedetta and their marriage is blessed with children. He owns a metals workshop and supplies building metals to construction sites and schools. He earns an average monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD. Abraham will use the loan to add more stock of metals. He will use the proceeds from the business to educate his children and improve his family's living standards. 

His future hopes and dreams are to have a stable business, a happy family, and be a big supplier of construction metals in his hometown.

loans.use: to add more stock of metals

loans.name: Zoriada

texts.en: Zoriada, 42, is a married woman with six children. She resides in Sumalig, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Zoriada used her last loan to purchase additional fish to raise. Her business has grown and become successful. By now, she's taking a new loan to purchase additional fish to raise. She hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Yasmeen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen akhtar is 34 years old, a married woman, and by this relationship has four children: three sons and one daughter. Besides her youngest son, the others are getting their educations.
 
Yasmeen is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and manage the household works. She has a set routine to wake up early in the morning and prepare her kids for school and prepare breakfast for the family. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Yasmeen’s husband is a motor mechanic by profession and provides motorbikes repairing services to the customers. He is very efficient and experienced in his work and has been doing it for over many years.  

Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan by buying the latest repairing tools to provide better services to his customers and earn better profits. 

Yasmeen is very confident that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband’s business.

loans.use: to buy the latest repairing tools

loans.name: El Hadji Omar

texts.fr:
Monsieur El Hadji Omar habite dans un petit village situé  à environ 22 km de la ville principale ou il a installé un atelier  de vente de produits agricoles. Une activité qui marche dans cette zone car étant  propice à l’agriculture, et surtout à la culture maraichère. Il a une expérience de plus de 12 ans dans le domaine.
Il est à son 6ème prêt et veut acheter 300 sacs d’engrais  et le stocker dans son atelier. Grace aux revenus de l’activité, il peut épargner et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
El Hadji Omar est marié et père de famille. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer.
Il souhaite augmenter son capital avec l’appui des financiers comme IMCEC afin de pouvoir augmenter son pouvoir achat.
texts.en:
Mr. El Hadji Omar lives in a small village located about 22 km from the principal city where he set up a shop selling farm products. This is a business that works in this area, which is suitable for agriculture and especially market gardening. He has over twelve years of experience in this domain. 

Mr. El Hadji Omar is on his sixth loan and wants to buy 300 sacks of fertilizer and store it in his shop. Thanks to the revenues from his business, he can save money and improve his family's food situation.

Mr. El Hadji Omar is married and a father of a family. He takes care of the day-to-day expenses of his household. He would like to increase his capital with the support of financiers like IMCEC in order to be able to increase his buying power.

loans.use: to buy farm products for resale

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang is 50 years old and married to Nov, an operator of a horse-pulled trailer in a small village of Prey Chor district. The couple has six children, all of whom are able to earn income individually. Kang doesn’t want to ask for financial support from her children. She wants to earn income independently, because she still has the potential to operate her farming business, which is located in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Kang has been doing this business for more than 20 years. In the previous two months, Kang bought a house that fits to her family's size; however, she has not paid back for the house successfully due to the shortage of funds to afford it. 

In this regard, Kang is seeking a loan of KHR 3,500,000 to pay off her outstanding amount to the owner of the house. She is confident that she can pay her loan back to our lenders through her effort. She has been a client of HKL for many years, and this will be her sixth loan. Kang has already paid off her previous loans successfully.

loans.use: To pay off her outstanding amount to the owner of the house

loans.name: Pablina

texts.en: Pablina is a 61-year old resident of Silanga, Tangub City. She provides for her 2 children's needs from the small amount of PHP 4,000 she gains each month from her piggery business.  She has been in the business for 14 years, to supplement the income her husband earns. She joined GDMPC in 2009, and she has applied for a microfinance loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feeding supplies. Pablina wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward has taken his second loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase another quarry site.

He hopes to purchase a piece of land where he can build a better home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase another quarry site

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been a farmer in Olkalau for the last 12 years. She practices dairy farming, and also plants cash crops like maize, beans and cabbages.  Her farm has been very profitable. She is 44 years old and married to James, who is also a farmer.  The couple has four children.

This will be her first loan and she plans to buy fertilizer as well as maize, cabbage and bean seeds for planting during this planting season.

In the future, Grace hopes to improve her farming business and make more income, hence improving the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men is a diligent woman who has been operating a rice farming business for her income. She is 45 years old and is a single parent responsible for three children. Despite her hardship, Men aims to provide her children with comfortable living and good educations. She has been engaged in her business since she was a single woman living with her parents. 

Presently she lives with her three children in a small house in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Men would like to build a stronger ladder for her house because her old ladder has become decayed and is not safe enough for the family. So now she is asking for a loan of KHR 800,000 to build her ladder. She is very happy and appreciates the support from our lenders.

loans.use: to build a ladder to get up to her house

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 36 years old, married, and has three children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been engaged in the business for five years. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in financial management. This has helped her to budget.

Gladys hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to expand her business premises.

loans.use: To expand her business premises

loans.name: Zergile

texts.en:
Zergile is a 54-year-old woman, married with two children. She is on pension and her primarily business is breeding livestock. She breeds sheep and cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat to local butchers. Zergile has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to her father who taught her how best to look after cattle.

Zergile usually buys small cattle or lambs, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.   She sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. Milk- and meat-selling brings 150 AZN in income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered as very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

This is only one financial income. Zergile applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase one milk cow, one additional cow and five sheep.  This will be her third loan from AqroInvest, and Zergile has a good client history. She wishes to save money and build her own house one day.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow, one cow and five sheep

loans.name: Merziya

texts.en:
Merziya is a 46-year-old woman married with one son. She breeds sheep and cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Merziya has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to her father, who taught her the best way to look after cattle and who currently helps her to run the business.

Merziya usually buys small cattle and sheep, raises, and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them for more profitable prices in the local livestock bazaar. Meat-selling brings 200 AZN income per month. Beef and mutton are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Also, she sells sheep fur, which is useful for clothes and blankets.  
 
This is only one financial income. Merziya applied for 1,200 AZN to purchase two cows and two sheep. This will be her second loan from AqroInvest and Merziya has good client history.

loans.use: to buy two cows and two sheep

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 38 years old, married, and has three children. To earn a living, he has a tailoring business. He has grown his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya. He has also been trained in business management skills by Faulu Kenya. This has helped him to grow his business.
Silas desires to expand his business and employ people. He needs 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 43-year-old man living in his own semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He trades in local brew and has been in business for over ten years.With the proceeds, he has been able to educate his children and provide for their other basic needs. He dreams of building a permanent house for his family and expanding his business to other areas. Robert needs a loan to buy local brew for selling.

loans.use: to buy local brew for selling

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 27-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cosmetics for four years.  She started with 500,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings in working capital. Her hardships are customers not paying on time, seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase stock.

Her personal goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand her business into new markets. Juliet needs the loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Nazkhanim

texts.en:
Nazkhanim is 59 years old.  She is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She is married and has four children.  She has been engaged in poultry breeding for the last 10 years. Nazkhanim and her husband are on pensions and her business is only source of income in her family. Her son helps Nazkhanim to look after poultry.

Poultry meat is very popular among local people and many national dishes are made of chicken and turkey. People use different kind of poultry in different seasons. In autumn and winter, people use goose and turkey, in spring and summer, they use chicken. Nazkhanim's income per month is 280 AZN.

Now she would like to increase the number of poultry and for this purpose she applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. She is going to buy more chicken, sell them for a profitable price, and hence increase her profit. This will be her seventh loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more chicken

loans.name: Roladis

texts.es: Roladis de 19 años de edad es una universitaria que se dedica a la actividad comercial, en su pequeño negocio donde  vende refrescos, mecatos y productos de dulcería en un punto comercial ubicado en su lugar de vivienda, en la ciudad de Cartagena;  con sus ingresos consigue responder a sus gastos personales y tiene metas de crecimiento personal y empresarial asociadas a su negocio. Su principal clientela está ubicada alrededor de su negocio y vende de contado a una frecuencia diaria y de contado. Sus aspiraciones de crecer y lograr aumentar sus ingresos, no se detienen y se convierten en su gran desafío, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará gaseosas, y productos de dulcería principalmente. Ella planea aplicará capital de crédito a su negocio paulatinamente para conseguir su crecimiento, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará   al por mayor y de contado artículos de dulcería y refrescos,  aprovechando que para el día de las madres el volumen de ventas de su negocio se incrementa.
texts.en:
Roladis is a 19-year-old university student who also manages a small business where she sells soft drinks, packaged lunches, and candies. Her business is located in a retail space in the area where she lives in the city of Cartagena. With her earnings, Roladis is able to cover her personal expenses. Her goals are to grow personally and as an entrepreneur as she operates her business. Her main customers are from the areas surrounding her business. Her sales are cash-based and are generated on a frequent basis each day. Roladis has aspirations of growing and increasing her earnings. Her greatest challenge is to keep her business in operation. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can buy mainly sodas and candy.

She plans to utilize the capital from her loan a little bit at a time so that her business will continue growing. This Kiva loan is her first form of financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and it will enable her to buy candy and soft drinks in bulk and with cash. Rolandis plans to take advantage of Mother's Day, a time when the sales in her business increase.

loans.use: to buy candy and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cows to fatten and re-sell later at a higher price.

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en:
Khatira is a 51-year-old woman, married with three children. She is a professional baker who bakes bread and local pita with meat and greens. She has four years of experience and she does her work perfectly. She uses only organic products and bakes bread in a special oven that is fueled with natural wood. That’s why her bread is in high demand, and the scent of it carries far beyond her home when she bakes. 

The bakery is located inside the yard of her house, so she is able to work from home. Her son helps her to fire the furnace and prepare the dough.  These are hard processes that require a lot of strength. This is only one financial income in Khatira's family, because she is on a pension that is too low.

She has applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase more products for her oven and for the dough. This will be her third loan and she has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy more products for her oven and the dough

loans.name: Rauben

texts.en: Rauben is a 45-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been teaching for nine years and is passionate about his career.  His personal goal is to educate his children and to build a permanent house for residence.  Rauben wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 69 years old and a widow. She is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Julieta earns 5000 PHP per month doing this farming. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Julieta hopes that through her loan, her harvest will improve. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Angel Roberto

texts.es:
Angel es un joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, paprika entre otros, asimismo encontramos uno de los atractivos turísticos el cual es “La laguna de Huacachina” y también se encuentra en Templo del Señor de Luren cuya fiesta patronal es en el mes de Octubre. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería Mecánica.

Día a Día Angel sale a trabajar en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque trabaja con mucha dedicación todo el día y porque es amable con los clientes.
