Angel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá realizar los trámites para su licencia de conducir ya que está a punto de caducar; con esta mejora evitara tener algunas infracciones y para tener mayor seguridad cuando conduce, de esta manera podrá seguir trabajando para así realizar su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y un auto”.
texts.en:
Angel is a 21 year old young man. He lives in the city of Ica, a city that is characterized by a warm climate all year long, and is also known for the development of agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, asparagus, paprika and others. We also find the attractive tourist attraction, the Huacachina Lagoon and the Sanctuary of the Lord of Luren whose patron saint festival is in the month of October. Due to limited financial resources he only attended high school, but he would have liked to study Mechanical Engineering.

Every day Angel goes to work in his business as a motorcycle taxi driver. He works about ten hours a day and can serve up to thirty clients a day. He believes that his business it going well because he works with a lot of dedication every day and because he is friendly to his clients.

Angel is very happy with the Kiva loans and thanks to the help that they have provided he can complete the paperwork for his driver’s license which is on the point of expiring, and with this opportunity he will avoid some fines and will have greater peace of mind while driving, so he can continue working in order to achieve his greatest dream: “to have his own house and a car.”

loans.use: for official paperwork required for driver's license

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor José Alejandro es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien es contador público jubilado quien trabaja como asesor  desde hace 10 años. Él es casado y tiene cuatro hijos.
El crédito que solicita es crédito personal el cual lo invertirá en reparaciones de la vivienda y los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. José Alejandro is a hardworking and enterprising gentleman. He is a retired public accountant, but he has worked as a consultant for the past 10 years. José Alejandro is married and has four children.

He is requesting a personal loan that will be invested in home repairs and the education of his children.

loans.use: to pay for home repairs and his children's education.

loans.name: Safayat

texts.en:
Safayat is 57 years old, and she is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She is married and has four children.  She has been breeding poultry for the last 10 years. Her husband and she are on pensions, and her business is the only source of income in her family. Her husband helps Safayat to look after the poultry.

Poultry meat is very popular among local people, and many national dishes are made out of chicken and turkey. People use different kinds of poultry in different seasons. In the autumn and winter, people use goose and turkey, and in the spring and summer, people only use chicken. Safayat's income each month is 300 AZN.

She would like to increase her number of poultry to raise, and for this purpose, she applied for a 1500 AZN loan. She is going to buy more chicken and sell them at a profitable price, and hence, increase her profit. This will be her third loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: To buy more poultry to increase her income

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 32-year-old lady from Kisumu City and is married to Vincent, who is a businessman. The couple has three children aged nine, five, and three years old.

Milka sells tomatoes, a business she has been doing for the last six years. She makes a monthly income of KES 9,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of tomatoes. Her profits will be used to start another business.

Her dream is to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Hul

texts.en:
Hul is 58 years old and is married. She has been blessed with five children, three of whom are already married and living separately. With the help of her rice farming business, she can satisfy the family's daily necessities and sustenance. She has operated this business for more than 30 years. Despite this, she patiently works hard in her business, hoping that it will provide her with a better income.

With the eagerness to gain enough income, Hul is asking for a loan of USD 500 that will be used to rent a plot of farmland to increase her rice production in the coming harvesting season. She hopes that this will provide good results and let her earn a higher income.

loans.use: To rent a plot of farmland to increase her rice production

loans.name: Zarovsha

texts.en:
Zarovsha is a 49-year-old woman. She is married and has four children. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  She breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. She also raises sheep for meat purposes. Zarovsha has more than twenty years of experience in this field, thanks to her father who taught her the best way to look after cattle. Her husband works as builder and receives 80 AZN in salary, which is too low to support family.

Zarovsha usually buys small cattle, then raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  She sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings an income of 150 AZN per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and also are present in everyday life.   

This is only one financial income in her family and not enough to cover the basic needs of her beloved children. Zarovsha applied for a 1,200 AZN loan to purchase two calves and one dairy cow.  This will be her fifth loan and she has positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy two calves and one dairy cow.

loans.name: Artush

texts.en:
Artush and his wife have been engaged in pig breeding and gardening for about 17 years. They breed 3 pigs and 5 piglets and grow apples, pears, plums, etc., in Ijevan. Generally, Artush uses fruit for his family needs, but in productive years he sells fruit as well. Artush sells pork to butchers and also to his neighbors. Pig breeding allows Artush to provide the major part of his family’s needs.  
Artush has 3 children: 2 sons, who are pupils and a 20-year-old daughter, who is looking for a job now. Artush is 44 years old. Along with pig breeding and gardening he works as a taxi driver. Artush says that driving is not sufficiently profitable, so his agricultural business is the main source of income for his family. 
This is Artush’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to buy a sow and a large lot of fodder for his pigs. Artush has never been late with his repayment.

loans.use: to buy a sow and a large lot of fodder for his pigs.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 29-year-old lady. She is married to Peter and they have three children aged ten, seven, and nine months. The family comes from Kisumu City, West of Kenya.

Millicent operates a timber business, a business she has been doing for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stock of timber for sale. 


Her profits will be used to grow the business. Her dream is to expand the timber business.

loans.use: to buy more timber for sale..

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He also has three siblings. Hasan is doing the best he can to support his family and offer them a fair way of living. Hasan works to provide some help to his father who’s the family's main income provider. He has been working as a car painter since 2010 and has his own garage. Today, he’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to enlarge his garage and buy a minivan for his business.  In that way, he will be able to transport his tools easily. In the future, he plans to open a bigger garage where he can serve more clients.

loans.use: to enlarge his garage and buy a minivan for his business.

loans.name: Zarovsha

texts.en:
Zarovsha is a 60-year-old woman.  She is a widow and raises three children alone. She is an IDP and lives on a Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Zarovsha has been breeding cattle for more than 25 years. She receives 120 AZN in financial support from the government monthly, but this is too little to cover her family's needs.

Zarovsha usually buys calves, raises them, and fattens them for 5-6 months.  She then resells them for a more profitable price at the livestock bazaar. Her son helps her to look after the cattle and sell them at the bazaar.  Her monthly income is 100 AZN, and this business is the main source of income for her family. 

Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. 

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1300 AZN loan to purchase three cattle. This will be her second loan, and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: To buy three cattle

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
Ratha, age 27, is a garment worker. Her husband, Lat, is a construction worker. They just married in 2012 and have no children yet. 

Ratha lives with her uncle and grandmother in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She wants her own house, so she has decided to apply for her first Kiva loan in order to build her own place to stay.

loans.use: to build her own house.

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en: Bonny is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy firewood to sell to schools and reaped a lot of profits. His personal goal is to educate his children, and his business goal is to expand his firewood business as it has proved to be very lucrative. His main hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. Bonny needs a loan to buy trees for firewood.

loans.use: to buy trees for firewood.

loans.name: Kimsuo

texts.en: Kimsuo is 51 years old, a widow and the mother of one son and two daughters. One of her daughters is married and the other one works for a hotel in Phnom Penh. Her son is employed full time. Kimsuo lives with her parents in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  She earns a living by growing small trees. She is applying for her first loan, for $700, so that she can add it to some savings she has set aside to buy a motorbike for her son to use to drive to work. Because her son does not now have his own transportation, he currently commutes to and from work with a neighbor.

loans.use: to help buy a motorbike for her son to use to drive to work.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen used her previous loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fish. She made good sales, hence more profits. 


She has requested another loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy fish and renovate her business premises. She hopes to become more financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish and renovate her business premises.

loans.name: Purza

texts.en:
Purza is 47 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) who lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. She earns a living as a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has more than 10 years experience in this field, and very skilled at what she does. 

Purza usually sells her crops in the town's central bazaar. People in her area shop for fresh vegetables everyday because they believe they are crucial for staying healthy. They are also the basis of many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are also popular to have on the table and are used to make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 80 AZN, but raising crops takes a lot of strength and means lots of time spent working out of doors. That is why Purza relies on help from her son. She is requesting a loan for AZN 1,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer. This will allow her to improve quality of the food she grows and increase her income. This will be her second loan, and she has good client history with our organization.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 30-year-old businessman who is married and lives with his two children in Bundibugyo, Uganda, where he has earned a living for the last five years by running a retail shop. He opened this shop with money he saved while working as a motorcycle driver. The main challenge he faces is a shortage of funds to keep his store stocked with goods. His dreams are to build a permanent home for his family and to move his business to a more permanent location. He is requesting this loan to buy soap, salt and sugar to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt and sugar to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Ousama

texts.en:
Ousama is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings. One of them is working. 

After finding it hard to cover his family expenses, he decided to double his efforts and combine forces with his brother. Ousama started his own work as a painter in 2010 on a free-lance basis. He’s a reputable man, known for his good and well-organized work. Today, he is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional painting supplies for his business. This Kiva loan will improve his work and allow him to start his new project properly. 

In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional painting supplies for his business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 29-year-old farmer and she also runs a salon. She is married to Antony, a school teacher, and they have one son, aged five years. She has been in this business for the past two years with an average income of KES 50,000 per month used to support her family.  

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. The purpose of the loan is to add stock of cosmetics (braids, hand and body lotion, weaves etc). 

The proceeds from the expanded business will be used to open another salon and educate her son. Her future dream is to own a wholesale cosmetic shop in town that is of its own kind.

loans.use: to add stock of cosmetics (braids, hand and body lotion, weaves, etc.)

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is taking out another loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to expand her existing business. With the loan she will be able to buy a new printer. 

She is now managing to pay for her children’s school fees and she dreams of buying a plot of land to build a rental house in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new printer.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab is 43 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement, where she has earned a living for the last six years by breeding cattle. She was a housewife, but her husband is unemployment and she is now the family's sole means of support.  

Zeynab usually buys young cows, raises and fattens them for five or six months, and then resells for a profit at the local livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is AZN 300. Demand for her products is strong because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, where it is used in everyday dishes such as pilau and dolma. Zeynab also keeps additional cows for milking. Some of this milk is used by her family and some is sold to neighbors.  

Zeynab wants to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan for AZN 1,000 to buy one baby calf and one milk cow. This will be her second loan. She has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy one baby calf and one milk cow.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng (in the photo) is 42 years old and his wife is 41 years old. They have been married since 1988 and they have two sons and one daughter. Both sons are policemen and the daughter is attending university. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Cheng is a policeman, while his wife is a public primary school teacher. Cheng is asking for a loan in the amount of $800 to buy a motorbike for his wife to drive to her teaching job.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for his wife to drive to her teaching job.

loans.name: Somoye

texts.en:
Somoye, now a widow with four children, used the Kshs.15,000 she asked for previously to buy wheat flour, and doubled her sales. She also used part of it to purchase palm leaves for sale. Her living standards improved with the profit she obtained.

She is now asking for Kshs. 20,000 to buy additional stock of wheat flour and beans to expand her business. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She hopes someday to open a cafeteria.

loans.use: to buy additonal stock of wheat flour and beans for her business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a forty-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent house and educate his children. 

He has been operating a pub for the last ten years and his major hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming. Godfrey needs a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Retamas De Mallcamaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RETAMAS DE MALLCAMAYA” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Mercedes es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: crianza de animales y venta de los mismos, tejido de mantas a mano, venta de verduras, venta de leche, crianza de conejos.

La señora Mercedes, indica que  es la primera vez que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su suegra.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la aumentar su capital (compra de verduras)  mismo que comprará de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Retamas de Mallcamaya" is starting its first loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. This group consists of seven members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Mercedes as its president. The members engage in various businesses such as raising and selling animals, producing handwoven blankets, selling vegetables, selling milk, and raising rabbits.

Sra. Mercedes says that this is the first time she joined a Communal Bank with Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a promoter. She currently has a business selling vegetables that she has operated for many years. Mercedes learned this trade from her mother-in-law. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying vegetables. She buys her products at the fairs in the city of El Alto and then sells them from her vending post. This business helps her to support her family. Mercedes is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Mercedes said that she enjoys the savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: For the last seven years, Peter has earned a living by running a butcher shop in the town of Olkalau. He also works as a livestock trader, selling cows and goats to various farmers and other butchers in his area. He is 50 years old, married and the father of three children. He is requesting a loan for KES 15,000 to buy more meat to sell. In the future, Peter hopes to expand his business by selling more livestock to people in nearby towns. His goal is to increase his income so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Los Naranjos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Naranjos lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras el coordinador es el señor  Nino quien se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 8 años aproximadamente, él está casado y tiene dos hijos de 5 y 1 año respectivamente. El invertirá el crédito en pipián, quequisque, yuca…etc.
Los otros integrantes son Juana de 26 años quien vende productos Avon desde hace 1 año y Francisca de 63 años quien vende frutas principalmente naranjas y limones desde hace 12 años.
texts.en:
The group "Los Naranjos" (the Orange Trees) is comprised of three hardworking and enterprising people. Nino is the group coordinator. For the past eight years or so, he has made his living selling vegetables. He is married and has two children ages five and one. He will use the loan to purchase pipián (a type of squash), taro (a tropical root plant), yuca (cassava), etc.

The other group members are Juana, a twenty-six year old woman who has sold Avon products for the past year, and Francisca, a sixty-three year old woman who has sold fruits (mainly oranges and lemons) for the past twelve years.

loans.use: to purchase harvests of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Bora, pictured here, is 27 years old. His wife, Sreikun, is also 27 years old. The couple has one young daughter and they live in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Bora is a farmer. He has his own motorized hand tiller and he also plows farmland for other farmers in his village and gets paid with fees. 

Bora is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy a motorbike as there isn’t one for family use.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, in this photo, is 25 years old and is a widower with one son. She lives with her brother and parents in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Yon is a garment worker. 

Yon is requesting a 1,500 USD loan to buy a motorbike for her family to use. She will also use it to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal, 45 years old and a married man, has five children. 

Jamal opened a store selling mobile phones and accessories. He also got an agreement with different phone companies to sell prepaid calling credit cards. 

Jamal has applied for this loan to add more phone accessories and more types of mobile phones to increase his sales.

loans.use: to add more phone accessories

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 25 years old and a single guy, lives with his four brothers, two sister and his parents.

Being part of a big family, Ahmad felt that he need to do something to support himself and help his family too, so he opened a mini book and stationery shop. Starting from scratch and reaching what he has now, has given Ahmad the courage to continue and want more.

He has applied for this youth loan in order to bring in more products and add a new section for selling and wrapping gifts.

loans.use: to bring in more products and add a new section for selling and wrapping gifts

loans.name: Bahaa Aldeen

texts.en:
Bahaa Aldeen, 28 years old and a single guy, is the oldest among eight brothers and sisters.

Bahaa Aldeen started working on his own six years ago. At first he used to sell clothes in a stall in the street, but later he opened a small clothing shop in the market that is running smoothly. Now Bahaa Aldeen has started to distribute clothes to clothing stalls retailers to expand the business.

Bahaa Aldeen has applied for this youth loan in order to bring in a new summer collection of clothes to his store.

loans.use: to bring in a new summer collection of clothes

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 47 years old and a married man, has five children.

Ahmad owns a shop that prepares and sells different kinds of nuts. He also sells snacks and candy on the side. Ahmad has applied for this loan in order to bring in more types of nuts to make with different seasonings to have variety in what he sells.

loans.use: to bring in more types of nuts

loans.name: Marìa Lucia

texts.es:
María  es una mujer que tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con un  hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. María  vive en  el caserío Rinconazo del distrito de Tùman y departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María es la crianza/venta de ganado porcinos  y aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad María cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge también esta dedicado al transporte de pasajeros, es gasfitero  donde   le permite tener otro ingresos adicionales.
Actualmente María se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados, y arreglos de corrales para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María is thirty-two years old and married with two children in her care. She lives with her husband in a house that she owns. Quality of life in her community is at subsistence level. The majority of the town's inhabitants are independent workers who make their livings raising and selling smaller animals. Some also make their livings through agriculture. María lives in the small town of Rinconazo in the Túman district of the "departamento" of Lambayeque. They have only the basic service of electricity—they get their water from a handmade well. All the local families live under the same conditions.

María makes her living breeding and selling pigs and poultry. She raises these animals in the corrals outside her house. It should be noted that María has four years of experience in this business, which has enabled her to maintain the clientele that she has already established. She sells her animals to the major shopkeepers and traders in the area. Her husband makes his living transporting passengers. He is also a plumber, which gives them a little extra income.

At present, María has proposed to expand her inventory with regard to the raising and selling of animals, since it has proven to be a very profitable activity in the area. It is because of these circumstances that she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN. She will use this loan to buy balanced feed for the animals and make repairs to their corrals. This in time will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and repair her animals' corrals

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 50-year-old Lebanese widowed woman living on her own. She has her own life and she works really hard to live properly and as it should be. Souad opened her own clothing shop in 2001 after many years of experience selling clothes from her home. She always seeks to satisfy her customers and offer them good quality products. 

Souad is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to change her shop’s interior decoration. She notes that this will gives her a good mood and allow her attract added clients. In the future, she plans to open other branches as soon as she can.

loans.use: to change her shop’s interior decoration

loans.name: Faleeha

texts.en:
Faleeha is 39 years old and a married woman. Her husband works as a taxi driver since his retirement from the military. They have five children.

Faleeha started a small retail business at home selling children's clothes and blankets. She has applied for this loan in order to add more variety to the clothes she sells.

loans.use: to add more variety to the clothes she sells

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 28 years old and married to Priscila. The couple is blessed with three children. For the past year, Patrick has run a restaurant in Olkalau town. He was introduced to KADET LTD by existing clients and this will be his first loan. 

Patrick is requesting a loan to buy more stock of maize, baking flour, and cooking oil. He will also expand his premises to be able to serve more customers. In the future, Patrick hopes to expand his business by opening a bigger restaurant to increase his income to be able to provide a good education for his children and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy maize, baking flour, cooking oil and to expand his premises

loans.name: Antonieta's Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Jesús Divino Amor” en la ciudad del Cusco, este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de cueros, venta de golosinas, venta de golosinas y otros brindan servicios como por ejemplo de mantenimiento de carros y transportes. 

La socia Antonieta nació en la provincia de Quispicanchis en el distrito de Sicuani pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 45 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Antonieta  se dedica a la preparación de pasteles, ella tiene un  pequeño horno donde prepara sus ricos potajes, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, manteca, leche, mantequilla y otras cosas más.   

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Los socios que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron tarde a la reunión). 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank "Jesús Divino Amor" (Jesus Divine Love) in the city of Cuzco. This communal bank is comprised of people who, in every moment, seek opportunities to get ahead, and through their daily efforts to achieve a better future for their children. The economic activities of the members include, for example: the sale of food, clothes, leather goods, and sweets. Others provide services such as the maintenance of cars and other vehicles of transport.

One member, Antonieta, was born in the Quispicanchis province of the Sicuani district, but now lives in the city of Cuzco. She is forty-five years old and has a common-law marriage from which she has two children. Antonieta makes her living preparing cakes. She has a small oven where she makes delicious stews. At this moment, she needs the loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, lard, milk, butter, and various other things.

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and they promise to comply with the payment of their various debts within the established periods. (The members that appear in the lower part of the photograph arrived late to the meeting).

Cuzco is located in the district and province of Cuzco in the "departamento" of Cuzco in the heart of the ancient city of the Incas. It is characterized as a tourist attraction for its archeological centers, its historical district, its landscapes, its history, and for being an enchanting city of the southern region of the country. Cuzco is known for being a very commercial, tourist area, for its traditional celebration of Inti Raymi, and for being the location of one of the seven wonders of the world, "Machupichu."

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, lard, milk, butter, and other such things

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman. She has 2 children, ages 7 and 8. She describes herself to be social and talkative. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 3 staff members. Her business is located at a busy local area and her primary customers are a cooperative tea firm. 

In addition, she runs a grocery store where she sells fruit. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes of climate greatly affecting tea. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to pay for hiring a farm for growing tea for selling. Her business goal is to buy land within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a house and venture into another business of a boutique.

loans.use: to pay for hiring a farm for growing tea to sell.

loans.name: Elsa María

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al destace de cerdo y la producción de sus derivados (cerdo frito, moronga, chicharrón, nacatamales…etc.) además comercializa cosméticos. El crédito que solicita es de mujer, tengo derecho el cual es para su uso personal. 
Ella lo utilizara en chequeo médico y medicinas.
texts.en:
Sra. Elsa is a hardworking and enterprising woman who butchers pigs and makes related products (fried pork, blood sausage, fried pork rinds, Nicaraguan tamales, and other foods). She also sells cosmetics.

Elsa is requesting a loan because, as a woman, she has a right to use it for personal reasons. The money will be used for a medical checkup and medicines.

loans.use: to pay for a medical checkup and medicines.

loans.name: Shahida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Shahida Parveen is 39-year-old married woman, and by this relationship she has seven children: three boys and four daughters. Two of her daughters are involved in sewing and embroidery work and also contribute to the family financially, while others are free and don’t do anything. Shahida herself is also involved in sewing & embroidery work. Her work is home based. She gets orders from her neighboring customers and also from her relatives. Besides her sewing & embroidery work, she gives the required time to her household activities. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Her husband operates a mobile shop where he sells mobile phones and accessories to his customers and earns good profits. 

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing & embroidery business. With the loan investment, she will purchase a sewing machine for sewing dresses because her current machine is also used by her daughters which affects the deadlines. With the new sewing machine, she will be able to meet the orders on time and it will be a good addition to her business assets. She is confident about the positive financial results from her business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing & embroidery business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 42 years old, married, and has seven children.  To earn a living, she sells shoes.  She has been in the business for ten years and has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya, because she has managed to access financial resources easily.  She has improved her living standards because her business has grown. She hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested 20, 000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 62 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Juliana who is also a farmer. They are blessed with six children. He has been in a farming business for the past 20 years with the monthly income of approximately KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family members. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Robert will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his last two children since the others are all adults. His hopes and dreams are to own a pig farm and also raise poultry.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Cristina De Las Mercedes

texts.es: Cristina tiene 37 años, nació en Guayaquil y viven con su familia. Está casada con Washington quien es sastre, tienen 3 hijas en etapa escolar que asisten a la escuela fiscal. Cristina nos cuenta que desde hace varios años es costurera, en la actualidad realiza chalecos que vende a las compañías. El trabajo no lo realiza sola ya que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien también sabe del negocio. No tiene horario establecido porque según el pedido aumento la producción o la disminuyen. También nos cuenta que el problema que tiene actualmente son las calles que por la época están deterioradas y esto dificulta la entrega de la mercadería. Cristina también vende químicos o productos de limpieza lo que le generan un ingreso extra en su economía. Con el préstamo va a comprar químicos, telas e hilos con esto desea aumentar su producción para comprar un vehículo.
texts.en: Cristina is 37 years old.  She was born in Guayaquil and lives with her family.  She is married to Washington, who is a tailor.  They have three school age daughters who attend public school.  Cristina tells us that she has been a seamstress for many years.  Currently, she makes vests which she sells to companies.  She doesn't do the work alone since she counts on the help of her husband who also knows the business.  She doesn't have a fixed schedule because she increases or decreases her production according the orders (she receives).  She also tells us that the problem she has right now is the roads which are in disrepair and that makes the delivery of merchandise difficult.  Cristina also sells chemical cleaning products which generates extra income.  With the loan, she is going to buy chemicals, fabric and thread with the hope of increasing her production in order to purchase a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and chemicals.

loans.name: Remond

texts.en:
Remond is a 32-year-old Lebanese single man. With the cooperation of his brother, he is able to satisfy his parent’s needs to live a proper life. Since 2010, Remond has operated his own solar energy system shop. He also works as a salesman at a local company. 

Remond is requesting a loan from the Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his shop and change its interior decoration. This sounds like a great idea to him as it will attract added customers and increase his sales. In the future, Remond plans to open other branches in surrounding areas.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and change its interior decoration

loans.name: Esther Marcelina

texts.es:
Esther tiene 65 años de edad pero es una joven de 20 años en espíritu, hace algunos años quedo viuda, lo cual fue una pena muy grande ya que su esposo era su mano derecha y sobre todo porque lo quería mucho; tiene un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad y esta casado pero siempre está al pendiente de ella y la quiere muchísimo; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, paprika entre otros, asimismo encontramos uno de los atractivos turísticos el cual es “La laguna de Huacachina” y también se encuentra en Templo del Señor de Luren cuya fiesta patronal es en el mes de Octubre. A Esther le encanta mirar televisión cuando tiene un tiempito libre sobre todo sus novelas, ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado seguir una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo Esther se dedica a su trabajo como costurera, ella realiza reparación de prendas, confecciona vestidos, pantalones, entre otros; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 5 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 10 clientes el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy conocida, ya que lleva trabajando desde hace 20 años y su local se encuentra en una zona céntrica de la ciudad.

Esther está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar tela para elaborar buzos para los colegios de la ciudad, con esta mejora podrá confeccionar mayores prendas y mejorar sus ingresos y así ella seguirá trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Tener una buena calidad de vida y apoyar a sus nietos”.
texts.en:
Esther is 65 years old, but she has the spirit of a 20 year old young person.  She was widowed some years ago.  This was a great sorrow because her husband was her right hand, and, above all, she loved him very much.  She has a son who is an adult and is married.  However, he is always looking out for her, and he loves her very much. 

Her house is in a city that is known for having a warm climate year round.  There is a lot of agriculture in this city, especially cotton, asparagus, and paprika, among others.  This is where we find one of the tourist attractions, “La Laguna de Huacachina” (Haucachina Lagoon).  You will also find the Templo del Señor Luren, whose patron saint festivities are in October.

Esther really likes to watch television, especially her novelas (soap operas), when she has some free time.  She could only attend school until the fifth year of high school, but she would have liked to have continued with a university education.

Esther devotes herself very enthusiastically to her work as a seamstress.  She mends garments and makes dresses and pants, among other garments.  She devotes around five hours a day to her business.  She is able to take care of up to ten customers a day.  She believes that it is going well for her in her business because she is well-known.  This is because she has been working for 20 years, and her place is located in a central area of the city.

Esther is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help she will be able to buy material to make sweatshirts for the city schools.  With the loan she will be able to make more garments and improve her income.  This way she will continue working and struggling each day to make her biggest dream come true:  To have a good quality of life and to support her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy material to make sweatshirts.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 43-year-old Lebanese woman who lives with her husband and three children. All of her children are studying. Her husband works as a car painter and has his own garage. Her husband is the one responsible for covering their needs, even though they’re united and cooperative. 

Zeinab started to work as a tailor from her home in 2006 after many years of experience in this domain. Today, she’s requesting to borrow a loan from a kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, in order to purchase a new tailoring machine. This kiva loan will facilitate her work and allow her to attract additional customers. In the future, she plans to open her own evening dresses shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Juana Gricelda

texts.es: Juana tiene 51 años, vive en Guayaquil. Actualmente está separada y sus hijos son mayores de edad. Vive con sus hijos pero la casa es de ella. Nos cuenta que inicio el negocio de venta de abarrotes por iniciativa y apoyo de su hermana, no imagino que le gustara tanto sobre todo porque lo realiza en su casa lo cual le ha ayudado a permanecer junto a sus hijos. Su horario de trabajo es de 7 de la mañana a 9 de la noche, no tiene ayudante realiza la labor sola. Su mayor preocupación es las enfermedades. Con el préstamo va a comprar víveres, abarrotes y productos de yambal. Juana nos cuenta que su meta futura es seguir activa con el negocio.
texts.en: Juana is 51 years old and lives in Guayaquil.  She is currently separated and her children are all adults.  She lives with her children, but the house belongs to her.  She has a grocery business, which she started on her own initiative with help from her sister.  She likes her business more than she ever imagined, mostly because it allows her to work from home and stay with her children.  Juana works from 7 in the morning until 9 in the evening; she works alone, without any help from assistants.  Her biggest concern is illness.  She will use the loan to purchase supplies, groceries, and Yanbal-brand cosmetics.  Juana’s goal for the future is to stay active in her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is married and the mother of three children, two attend school and one is still a toddler. Her husband is a businessman. They live in a rented property that has neither access to electricity nor piped water. Their largest monthly expenditure is food.

Millicent is a tailor and has been operating this business for two years now. Millicent's business is their major source of income. She works at home and her customers are the surrounding neighbors. She faces the challenge of seasonality. 

Her dream is to expand into a large business in the future. She joined Yehu because of their affordable rates. Millicent will use the loan to buy more materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials.

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr: Monsieur Omar vit au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et gère une salle de jeu depuis 8 mois. Il a choisi cette occupation  dans le but de gagner des revenus et de  subvenir a ses besoins sociaux mais  aussi aider ses parents. Il est membre de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2008. Il sollicite un crédit de 120 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de deux postes téléviseurs destinés a l’aménagement  de sa salle de jeu qui est localisé a proximité  du quartier de  sa zone d’habitation. Ce financement pourra lui permettre d’attirer d’avantage la clientèle et d’accroitre ses revenus réguliers.
texts.en:
Omar lives in Senegal.  He is single and has been managing a game room for the past 8 months.  He has chosen this activity in order to have an income, to meet his social needs and also to help his parents.  

Omar has been a member of the UIMCEC since January 2008.  He is requesting a loan of 120,000 francs for the purchase of two television sets to be placed in his game room located in the neighborhood next to where he lives.   This loan will help him to attract a larger number of customers and to increase his regular income.

loans.use: to buy 2 television sets to be placed in his game room.

loans.name: Carola

texts.es: La Sra. Carola tiene 33 años y es madre soltera con un  hijo que tiene la edad de cinco años, ella se dedica a la venta  de comida, ella vive en la zona Cañada el Carmen,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Carola utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de una heladera para mantener frescas su verduras y frutas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de una heladera para conservar sus productos,  la Sra. Carola enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de utensilios falta de mesas y sillas y así  brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de variedad de utensilios para ir mejorando su negocio y así generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Carola is 33 years old and is a single mother with a five-year-old son.  She makes a living selling food.  She lives in the Cañada el Carmen neighborhood.  This is Carola’s first loan with the lending institution, and she will use it to purchase a refrigerator so she can keep her fruits and vegetables fresh.  She is asking for the loan because she currently doesn’t have a refrigerator for preserving perishables.  Carola’s other main challenge is a lack of utensils, tables, and chairs, all of which would make things more convenient for her customers.  Carola is therefore going to use her profits to purchase a variety of utensils, which will improve her business and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Félix Arnoldo

texts.es:
Félix tiene 23 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Él se ha dedico a la agricultura desde que era muy pequeño, fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron. 

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, tiene que adquirirlos en un lugar que esta a unos cinco kilómetros de su casa, este viaje le resulta bastante costoso, por que el transporte es caro.  

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar fertilizantes, semillas, gastos para preparar la tierra y cultivar 28,000 metros cuadrados de maíz; también comprara 100 pollos para engordarlos y venderlos cuando ya estén listos. Él desea realizar sus trabajos agrícolas aprovechando la época lluviosa. Manifiesta que al obtener buenos resultados con la cosecha asegurara el dinero para los próximos meses y maíz para su alimentación. Además, desearle brindarle a su hijo un futuro digno y construir o mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Félix is 23 years old. His is married and has a son. He has worked in agriculture since he was very young. It was his parents who taught him.

To buy his agricultural materials, he has to acquire them in a place that is five kilometers from his house. This trip costs a lot because transportation is expensive.  

He is asking for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay the costs of preparing the soil and plant 28,000 square meters of corn. He will also buy 100 chickens to raise and sell when they are ready. He wants to do his agricultural work to take advantage of the rainy season. He says that if he gets good results with the harvest he will have money for the coming months and corn for feed. In addition, he wants to offer his chlildren a good future and build a better house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for the costs of preparing the soil and planting 28,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Ubaldina Francisca

texts.es:
Ubaldina tiene 46 años, está separada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad. Vive en La Maná. Para que conozcan un poquito esta hermosa cuidad les comentamos que el vocablo La Maná, proviene de “LANG MANA ATTI”, que significa mina del Gran Rey, por existir en el subsuelo abundancia de oro y otros minerales, teoría que se fortalece con el hallazgo de objetos arqueológicos en especial en el sector de Estero Hondo. Según el vocablo colorado MANA significa “HERMOSO, GRANDE”, que se atribuye a la fertilidad y a la generosidad de su suelo, ya que es apto para todo tipo de cultivo. 
Retomando a nuestra entrevistada Ubaldina nos cuenta que anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa en la cual al dejar de laborar le dieron liquidación. Con ese dinero inicio sus cabinas telefónicas ya que por su sector no había. Fue un gran acierto porque al ser lugar turístico le va muy bien, su horario inicia a las 7 de la mañana y cierra a las 9 de la noche. También vende tarjetas, recargas telefónicas, snack, ropa, tiene mucho surtido y eso hace que tenga mucha clientela. Con el crédito piensa comprar más inventario e incluir a su venta sabanas, toallas y edredones. En un futuro desea adquirir una vitrina y copiadora para agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ubaldina is 46 years old, she is separated and has 3 adult children. She lives in La Maná. In order to know a little bit about this beautiful city, we will comment that the word La Maná comes from “LANG MANA ATTI,” which means Mine of the Great King, because there exists an underground abundance of gold and other minerals, a theory which is strengthened by the discovery of archaeological objects, especially in the area of Estero Hondo. Accordingly, the colorful term “MANA” means "beautiful, large" and refers to the generosity of the ground as it is suitable for all types of crops.

Going back to our interviewee, Ubaldina tells us that previously she worked at a company but stopped working there as it went into liquidation. With that money she began her telephone booths since there were none in the area. It was a big hit because it is a tourist area and it is going very well. She begins at 7:00 in the morning and closes at 9:00 in the evening. She also sells telephone cards, telephone card recharges, snacks, clothing, and many supplies, and that means she has many clients. With the money from the loan she will buy more inventory including sheets to sell, towels and comforters. In the future she hopes to buy a display case and a copier in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy telephone cards, clothing, and sheets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 27-year-old business lady.  She is a single mother of one child. She has been selling cereals for the past four years.  She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to cater to her child's basic needs. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

Mercy will use the loan to purchase assorted dry grains to sell.  With the anticipated profit from the business, she will start pig rearing. 

Her hope is to buy a piece of land for farming and educate her child to university level.

loans.use: To purchase assorted dry grains to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 55-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children, who are both studying. Mohammad is the one responsible for paying his family expenses and supporting them. As for his wife, she has been working as a tailor from her home. Mohammad has been selling clothes since 1998, and he’s well-known for his stylish designs. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate his shop in order to increase his sales and therefore enhance his way of living. In the future, he plans to open a new kid’s section.

loans.use: To renovate his shop

loans.name: Peou

texts.en:
Peou, 26, is a married woman who is responsible for two lovely young children. She has been engaged in agricultural business for nearly 10 years. She is proud that she is a farmer because through her farming business she is able to provide basic necessities for the family and ensure the sustainability of her living. She works in this business, along with her spouse, on their inherited farmland; they earn approximately $5 per day.

Now she is asking for a loan of $1,000. She will use this loan to buy lubricant oil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides for farming purpose. She realizes that this loan will have a great impact on making improvements in her business, improving her financial stability and uplifting her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy lubricant oil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides for farming purpose.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 62 years old and widowed with four children.  She practices dairy farming to earn a living.  She started farming after getting her first loan from Faulu Kenya.  She has also improved her business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Rachael hopes to grow her business.  She needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Patria  Nueva Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Patria Nueva   esta integrado por siete mujeres trabajadoras y humildes e indígenas con deseos de mejorar sus negocios.
Son originarias de un pueblo llamado Patria Nueva  donde sus ciudadanos se dedican a la ganadería, agricultura y explotación minera,  sus bailes son las chilenas, celebran la  fiesta de San Martín  que se festeja el día  21 de enero.
Es una localidad rica en fauna y flora.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Josefa  de sesenta y un años de edad, se caracteriza por  su amabilidad.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Isaías un señor trabajador amable quien se dedica a la agricultura.
Dice que se dedica a la venta de  ropa desde hace cinco años, venta de pollos desde hace  tres años y venta de perfumes y cosméticos  desde hace cinco años.
Doña Josefa dice que se va a vender sus  perfumes a localidades vecinas como son nueva esperanza, el santo, el guayabo  el platanillo.
Ella decidió  tener sus  negocios  ya que le gusta mucho trabajar y ser una mujer independiente.
Uno de sus sueños es hacer crecer su negocio, desea vender perfumes por mayoreo para obtener más ganancias.
Una de las experiencias que por  ser una de las mejores vendedoras de perfume se gano una estufa de seis quemadores  y eso es lo que la motiva a seguir vendiendo ya que reconocen su trabajo.
Pidió el crédito para la compra de más  perfumes  para la venta por menudeo.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Hilda- se dedica a la venta de antojitos  mexicanos.
Lucrecia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Josefa- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Ignacia- se dedica a la venta de tacos.
Irma- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Lorenza- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.

Les dan las gracias por ayudarlas para que puedan mejorar sus negocios y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called Patria Nueva and consists of seven hardworking, unassuming, indigenous women who want to improve their businesses. They are natives of a town called Patria Nueva where citizens are dedicated to cattle, agriculture and mining. Their dances are Chilean and they celebrate the festival of San Martín on the 21st of January. This is an area rich in fauna and flora.

One of the members of the group is Sra. Josefa, 71, who is known for her friendliness. She is happily married to Sr. Isaías, a kind, hardworking man, who is a farmer.

Doña Josefa has been selling clothing for five years, chickens for three years and perfumes and cosmetics for five years. She says she sells her perfumes in neighboring towns such as Nueva Esperanza, El Santo, El Guayabo and El Platanillo. She decided to start her businesses because she enjoys working and being an independent woman. One of her dreams is to grow her business. She wants to sell perfumes wholesale to make more profit.

For being one of the best sellers of perfume, she had the experience of winning a six burner stove. That has motivated her to continue selling since they have recognized her work. She requested this loan in order to purchase more perfumes to sell retail.

The other members of the group are: Hilda, who sells Mexican snacks, Lucrecia, who also sells Mexican snacks and Josefa, who sells Mexican snacks, as well; Ignacia, who sells tacos; Irma, who sells soft drinks and Lorenza, who also sells soft drinks. 

They thank you for helping them to improve their businesses and provide their children with a better life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé est une jeune dame  de 27ans. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et revendeuse de produits cosmétiques depuis 2004. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et sa difficulté est la mévente. Elle est à son quatrième crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des produits cosmétiques et des bazins. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, en ayant un salon de coiffure de grande surface. Elle voudrait plus tard avoir des enfants et assurer leurs éducations.
texts.en: Amélé is a young lady, 27 years old. She has been a hairdresser by trade and a retailer of cosmetic products since 2004. She gets her supplies from Lomé, and her problem is a drop in sales. She is on her fourth loan with WAGES and is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics and some damask cloth. Amélé wants to reinvest in her business by having an expansive salon. She would like to have children later and to ensure their education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Mariée à un journaliste, Ami est mère de 03 enfants tous à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier 05 ans. Pour aider son mari, Ami vend des boissons et des produits alimentaires dans une boutique. Elle exerce seule l’activité et achète à Lomé. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut ouvrir d’autres boutiques dans d’autres quartiers et assurer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Married to a journalist, Ami is a mother of three children, all in school. The first child is 12 years old, and the last is 5. To help her husband, Ami sells beverages and grocery items in a store. She operates this business by herself and makes her purchases in Lomé. 

Ami is requesting this initial loan from WAGES to buy more merchandise in order to respond better to customer needs. She wants to open more stores in other districts and to ensure her children's future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and beverages

loans.name: Perreta

texts.fr:
Perreta est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un comptable. Elle a 3 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 20 ans et le dernier a 6 ans.
Perreta travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des produits FAN MILK pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Perreta a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits FAN MILK. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Perreta voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité et ouvrir une seconde boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Perreta is a 42-year-old woman who is married to an accountant. She has three children, who all go to school. The first child is 20, and the last is 6. Perreta has been working as a retailer since 2007. She sells FAN MILK products to any customers in her shop. She purchases the products in Lomé. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is not being able to meet all the demand. 

Perreta has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy FAN MILK products. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the next few years, Perreta would like to expand her business and to open a second shop. With the profits, she says she plans to improve her family's living conditions

loans.use: to buy dairy products

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh habite au Sénégal. C’est un  célibataire de 29 ans qui s’active dans le secteur du commerce plus particulièrement dans la vente de légumes. Il  a pendant quelques temps travaillé pour le compte d’une tierce  personne et actuellement il veut voler de ses propres ailes. Il a une expérience de 8 ans dans cette activité qu’il a choisi dans le but de vouloir subvenir a ses besoins personnels et aider ses parents. Il est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs qui lui permettra d’accroitre son fond de roulement,  de renforcer la cantine qu’il a acquise en produits. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices  pourra l’aider à améliorer ses conditions de vie économique et sociale.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh lives in Senegal. He is a 29-year-old man who is unmarried and active in the commercial sector, especially in selling vegetables. For a while now, he has worked for a third party, and he currently wants to fend for himself. He has eight years of experience in this business, which he chose with the goal of supporting himself and helping his parents. 

Mr. Cheikh has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch office since January 2011. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs that will enable him to increase his working capital and to bolster with more goods his market stall, which he acquired. The growth of his profits will help him to improve his economic and social situation.

loans.use: to buy products to sell for business purposes

loans.name: El Hadji Aly Ndiaye

texts.fr:
El Hadji est un jeune menuisier qui exerce ce métier depuis près de huit ans.Il réinvestit ses bénéfices dans des activités génératrices de revenus et surtout dans l'embouche ovine.Ainsi, il a construit un enclos chez lui et achète fréquemment des moutons qu'il engraisse pendant des mois avant de les revendre.Il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont les deux fréquentent l'école primaire.En plus de sa petite famille, il a en charge ses deux parents ainsi que ses frères et sœurs qui n'ont pas encore d'emplois stables.Afin d'augmenter ses bénéfices et faire ainsi face à ses lourdes charges, El Hadji sollicite un pret de 200 000f pour acheter 5 moutons de race.
Son ambition est de faire plus tard l'embouche bovine.
texts.en:
El Hadji is a young furniture maker who has been in this trade for nearly eight years. He reinvested his profits in revenue-generating businesses and especially in raising sheep. So he built a pen at his house and frequently purchases sheep, which he fattens for a few months and then resells. 

El Hadji is a married father with four children, of whom two are in primary school. In addition to his small family, he supports his two parents, as well as his brothers and sisters, who do not yet have steady jobs. 

To increase his profits and thus to cope with his heavy responsibilities, El Hadji is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy five head of purebred sheep. His ambition is to raise cows.

loans.use: to buy five head of purebred sheep

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old and a married woman from San Jose, Talibon. She and her husband are both farmers. Lolita works hard to keep their farm productive because her family relies on it. She primarily grows rice crops to sell and earns about 5,000 PHP per month.

Lolita needs additional capital for her farm. She plans to purchase seeds and farm fertilizers. Lolita hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She also hopes for her family's standard of living to improve.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and farm fertilizers

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 54-year-old enterprising business lady. She is a widowed with two children.  She has been running a milk bar as a primary business and selling cereals as a secondary business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family members. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Juliet will use the loan to buy milk cans and a freezer. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will buy a dairy cow. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children up to university level and buy a freezer for storing her milk.

loans.use: to buy milk cans and a freezer

loans.name: Grupo La 20 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Grupo La 20 de  esta conformado por  cinco personas humildes e indígenas con deseos de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Las integrantes de  este grupo son originarias de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca  donde  se elaboran los machetes grabados.
Una de sus artesanías  es la elaboración de la ropa típica de la región, es rica en fauna  donde se va lo que es  el higo, aguacatillo, palmaguapinol, caida y ámate.
La mayoría de los ciudadanos hablan  el idioma el idioma mixteco.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la  señora Ana Luisa de veinte dos años de edad, quien esta felizmente casada con el señor  Fredi con quien tiene dos hijas  Sonia y Analiz.
Doña Ana como mejor la conocen se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo desde hace cuatro años, también se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes desde hace un mes, nos cuenta que su tienda todavía no tiene mucha mercancía  ya que apenas empezó con eses negocio, la poca mercancía que tiene la compro de las ganancias de la venta de calzado.
Dice que los prestamos fue así como empezó el negocio de calzado primeramente compro los catálogos, después  fue a casa de sus vecinas a ofrecerle su mercancía  y finalmente  compro el calazo para entregar sus pedidos, se dio cuenta que le dejaba buenas ganancias y se vendía muy  así que decidió comprar calzado extra y venderlos en casa, pero a un sigue vendiendo  con sus vecinas y en  las colonias de su comunidad.
Esta muy contenta porque con sus ganancias  ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la casa  y a sus hijas  en los gastos de la escuela.
Dice que se compro un terreno en pagos   para poder ofrecerles un patrimonio a sus hijas  ya que con el dinero que gana su esposo están pagando el terreno y con sus ganancias ayuda en los gastos del hogar.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas mercancía de abarrotes como es: galletas,cereal,detergente,café,azucar,leche,verduras,refrecos,jugos,dulces,papel higienico,jabon,aceite,frijol y arroz.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
Felipa Nery- se dedica a la venta de masa y molida de nixtamal.
Marbelia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Juvenal Adauto- se dedica a la venta de artículos  domésticos.
Berenice Janeth- se dedica a la venta de venta de masa y molida de nixtamal.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarlos a  que  sus negocios mejoren.
texts.en:
This group is called Grupo La 20 and is composed of 5 unassuming, indigenous people who want to improve their life conditions. The members of this group are natives of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca where machetes are made with etchings related to the culture of the region. Another of their handicrafts is the making of traditional clothing. The area is rich in fauna such as the prickly pear, “aguacatillo”, “palmaguapinol”, “caida” and “ámate”. Most of the citizens speak the Mixtec language.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Ana Luisa, 20, who is happily married to Sr. Fredi, with whom she has two daughters, Sonia and Analiz. Ana, as she is better known, has been selling footwear by catalog for four years. She has also been selling groceries for one month. She tells us that her store still does not have much merchandise because, as soon as she opened the business, the little merchandise she has she bought from the profits of her shoe sales. 

Ana says that loans were how she began her shoe selling business. First she bought the catalogs, then she went door to door among her neighbors to offer her merchandise and then she bought the footwear to fill their orders. She realized that she was making a good profit and was selling so many shoes that she decided to buy extra pairs and sell them from her home but she still continued selling to her neighbors and in districts in her community. She is very happy because her earnings help her husband with household expenses and her daughters with their school expenses.

Ana says they bought a plot of land in installments so that they could provide an inheritance for their daughters because, with her husband’s earnings they are paying off the land, and her earnings help with household expenses.

She requested a loan to purchase more grocery merchandise such as cookies, cereal, detergent, coffee, sugar, milk, vegetables, soft drinks, juices, candy, toilet paper, soap, cooking oil, beans and rice.

The other members of the group are Felipa Nery, who sells dough and ground corn, Marbelia, who sells Mexican snacks, Juvenal Adauto, who sells household articles and Berenice Janeth, who also sells dough and ground corn. They thank the Fundación for helping them improve their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 29-year-old single mother of four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.
She has been in healthcare services for twelve years working as a nurse. Her main goal is to build a permanent commercial house and educate her children at a higher educational institution.
Elizabeth wants a loan to roof her commercial house that she intends to rent.

loans.use: to roof her commercial house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a fifty-five-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals are to build a permanent house and to educate his children. He has been a farmer for the last fifteen years, and his main hardships are price fluctuations, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and seasonal weather. 

However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas and of hiring employees to help him expand his business. John needs a loan to buy fertilizers for his garden in order to boost production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his garden.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
On is 39 years old and married with eight school-age children. Two of her children quit studying and decided to work as garment laborers in Phnom Penh to help support their younger brothers and sisters, who are still attending school and need daily allowances. On aims to improve her family's status of living and provide her children with their basic needs, especially food and education. She engages in rice farming to generate income to satisfy her family's needs. She has been in this business for many years.
 
To improve the business, On is now asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase lubricant oil, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain healthier crops. She says that the loan will enable her to improve her business. She hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase lubricant oil, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain healthier crops.

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a married woman with one child who attends school. For the last 10 years, she has been operating a goat meat business. She sells her products at the market. Her primary customers are people from slaughterhouses. Mesalim owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes death of animals and theft to be a major challenge for her, and food to be her greatest monthly expense. She dreams of opening a butchery in the future.
She intends to use the loan of Ksh.10,000 to purchase goats for sale.

loans.use: to purchase goats for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is progressing well and now requests a new loan to start a new business, selling cereals. Margaret has been running a fruit-juice business for the past six years, and now she wants to sell cereals alongside the fruit juice. She will continue to operate from home and sell to people in her local area. Her biggest challenge is the fluctuation of prices, and her goal for the future is to open a wholesale cereal shop.

Margaret will use the loan to purchase stock for her cereal business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her cereal business.

loans.name: Esperanza Estela

texts.es: Doña Esperanza Estela tiene su negocio que es la venta y elaboración de dulces. Tiene más de 41 años en este negocio, por lo que no es el primer financiamiento que realiza, ya que le han sido de gran ayuda. Inicio este medio de vida, por su propio esfuerzo, ha sido admirable que ha mantenido este negocio a su edad, gracias al apoyo que fundación león 2000 le brinda ha podido  mantener el negocio y el crecimiento de su clientela  solicita  un financiamiento para  poder comprar materia prima como:  azúcar, coco, bolsas, colorantes entre otros productos.
texts.en: Esperanza Estela has a business preparing and selling sweets. She has more than 41 years of experience in this business. This is not the first time she has received financing, and the loans have been a great help to her. Esperanza started her business by herself, so it is admirable that she has been able to maintain her business at her age. Thanks to the support the Fundación León 2000 has provided her, she has been able to maintain her business and increase her customer base. She is requesting a loan to be able to purchase supplies such as sugar, cocoa, bags, and food coloring, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cocoa, bags, and food coloring, among other items.

loans.name: Tehmina

texts.en:
Tehmina continues with her clothes trading business in Vanadzor city. Tehmina’s husband, who is a taxi driver, helps Tehmina with the business, particularly, he drives Tehmina to Yerevan in his car, where she buys merchandise for her business. Tehmina also brings clothes for her business from a neighboring country. 
Her business income allows Tehmina to provide for her family. She used her first Kiva loan to buy spring season clothes for her business. Now she is seeking a 900.000 AMD loan to buy tracksuits and summer season dresses, blouses, shirts, and chemises from a neighboring country to resell.

loans.use: to buy tracksuits and summer season dresses, blouses, shirts, and chemises from a neighboring country to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a fifty-year-old single lady with four children. She sells new clothes and has been in the business for nine years now and gets a monthly income of twenty one thousand shillings. 


This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more new clothes for sale. In the future, she wants to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 11 years to 24 years. She describes herself to be a social and determined woman. She operates a farm where she sells items such as arrowroots, fruits, cabbage, tomatoes, peas etc. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs 2 staff members. Her business is located on fertile soil in a well irrigated area and her primary customers are grocery store retailers. Sometimes, Jane does baking and sells cakes to residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the rainy season as the area floods thereby destroying crops. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy one dairy cow for selling milk. Her business goal is to buy some more dairy cows within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will use the profit to buy a good house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 35-year-old hardworking dress maker and a farmer. She is married to Benson, a causal laborer, and they have three children. She has been operating this business for the past 20 years with an income of KES. 10,000.00 per month used to support her family.  

The objective of this loan is to pay school fees for her three children that are in school. This will enable her to fully concentrate on the business while the children are in school. 

Her dream for the future is to own a large dressmaking shop for school uniforms and corporate wear for companies though currently she is challenged by the school fees.
