loans.use: to pay school fees for her three children that are in school.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Maribel tiene 32 años y es soltera con 4 hijos que son de las edades de  5, 7, 12 y 17, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y también a la venta de cosméticos, ella vive por la zona de Guapuru, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maribel utilizara este préstamo para la compra de cosméticos para su segunda actividad y así incrementar su capital de trabajo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y los precios altos, Maribel sueña  poder construir su casa, la Sra. Maribel es una persona muy trabajadora que sola saca adelante a sus hijos, con la esperanza que un día sean profesionales.
texts.en: Maribel is thirty-two years old and single. She has four children, aged five, seven, twelve, and seventeen. She sells food and cosmetics. She lives in the Guapuru neighborhood. This loan is her first with Emprender. Maribel will use this loan to purchase cosmetics, which is her second business, and in that way increase her working capital. The lack of working capital is the reason she is requesting this loan. Maribel faces challenges in her business such as competition and high prices. She dreams of building her own home. She is a very hardworking person who works to provide for her children by herself. She hopes that one day they will have professional careers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cosmetics for her second business.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
El señor Sebastián tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse al destazo de animales, fue su papá quien le enseño. Esa ha sido su profesión, además de dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado, cerdos y a la agricultura. 

Los animales como vacas, cerdos y bestias, los compra en los tiangues y también en los lugares cercanos.
 
Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar ganado, cerdos y todo lo referente al destazo. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias, tener una mejor calidad de vida, que le permita tener mayor capacidad de adquisición, para una mejor alimentación, un buen ahorro y mejorar hasta su vivienda. 

Sebastián desea instalar una crianza de cerdos para el destazo propio, por que es una actividad rentable según comenta.
texts.en:
Sebastian is 48 years old, he is married and he has two children. He has been making a living slaughtering animals for over 20 years. It was his dad who showed him. This is his profession, and he also makes a living buying and selling livestock, pigs, and in agriculture. 

The animals like the cows, pigs and beasts he purchases in the livestock markets and also in nearby places.

He is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy livestock, pigs and everything related to slaughtering. This investment will help him increase his business and improve his earnings which will allow him to have a better quality of life with a higher capacity for acquisition, for a better diet, good savings and to improve even his housing.  

Sebastian wishes to set up the raising of pigs for his own slaughtering, because according to him it is a profitable activity.

loans.use: to buy livestock, pigs and everything related to slaughtering.

loans.name: Juan Amilcar

texts.es: El señor Juan Amílcar tiene 62 años, es casado y tiene 6 hijos, ya son mayores de edad. El señor se dedica a la apicultura  El señor dio inicio a este negocio hace 10 años, primeramente el trabaja con una empresa que realizaba este negocio y después, con el tiempo y con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro pudo hacerse de su propia actividad que es el que actualmente posee. El señor está solicitando este crédito ya que piensa comprar pinza, combustible, trajes entre otras cosas que son útiles para la producción de miel. El mayor desafió que siempre ha tenido él como empresario ha sido que algunas veces no ha tenido muchas ventas. De allí nace que su mayor sueño siempre ha sido establecer una empresa familiar y que sus hijos puedan trabajar con él.
texts.en: Juan Amílcar is 62 years old, married, and has six adult children. He is a beekeeper. He started his business ten years ago. He started working with a honey production company, and later, with time, lots of effort, and savings, he was able to start his own business, which is the one he currently owns. He is requesting this loan because he would like to purchase a smoker, fuel, and bee suits, among other useful items for honey production. The biggest challenge he has always had as a businessman has been that sometimes he has not had many sales. As a result, his biggest dream has always been to establish a family business so that his children could work with him.

loans.use: to purchase a smoker, fuel, and bee suits, among other useful items for honey production.

loans.name: 06.02.06 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hằng is applying for a loan to purchase materials to make votive objects and sell. She has a business manufacturing votive objects .

Hằng is 47 years old and she is married with 2 children.

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She has 2 dependents.

This is Hằng's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.
Hằng has been involved in this business for 5 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make votive objects for sale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 50-year-old businessman. He is married to Joyce, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been distributing cakes for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Julius will use the loan to buy a bicycle for transporting cakes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle for transporting cakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the operating expenses and labor cost of planting potatoes

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is 27 years old from Nyahururu. She is married to Joseph and they have two children who are both in school.

Mirriam is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings. She is optimistic that her farm will do better using the loan.

She hopes to grow good produce which will enable her to earn a good income.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbaye est un homme de 41 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Il évolue depuis 9 ans dans le commerce de produits de quincaillerie. C’est une activité de commerce qu’il a choisi pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins personnels. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2003. Il sollicite un prêt de 200 000 frs dans le but d’acquérir des articles de quincaillerie qu’il commercialise et renforcer le stock de son local. Avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices il pourra ainsi espérer  a améliorer   ses conditions de vie sociale et économique  pour une meilleure prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Mbaye is a 41-year-old man who lives in Senegal. He has been the business of selling hardware products for 9 years. It’s a business he chose to be able to pay for his personal expenses. He has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch since August 2003. He is seeking a loan of 200,000 frs with the goal of acquiring hardware materials that he sells and to reinforce his local stock. With the increase of his profits, he hopes to be able to improve the social and economic conditions of his life to be better able to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy hardware supplies to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 49 years old. He is married to Lydiah and together they have four children who are all in school. He is a farmer and has been in this business for the past four years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD, after he was introduced to the organisation by his friend, who is also a member. He will use the loan amount to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for planting.

He hopes to be a large-scale farmer in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase seedlings and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Stefanos

texts.en:
Stefanos is 54 years old. He is married to Rosemary and together they have four school-going children. He is a farmer and has been in this business for the past 12 years, with a good income.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to the organisation by his fellow group members who are KADET LTD clients. He will use the loan to purchase potatoes, fertilizer and pesticides for use on his farm.

He hopes to expand and improve his farming business in order to cater for his children's education expenses.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, fertilizer and pesticides for use on his farm.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: Moustapha est est un homme marié. Il est père de trois enfants.Il exerce l'activité d'élevage notamment l'aviculture qu'il pratique depuis 5 ans.Il gère ainsi un grand poulailler dans lequel il élève des poulets de chair et des poules pondeuses.Il vit seul en ville car sa famille est resté au village.Afin d'augmenter ses revenus, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour compléter son capital et acheter une camionnette de transport de ses produits.Il a déjà payé deux prets de 150000f et 200000 f à l'IMCEC. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité au point d'employer ses frères restés au village.
texts.en: Moustapha is a married man. He is the father of three children. He is in the business of livestock farming, notably poultry farming, which he has been doing for 5 years. He runs a large henhouse in which he raises broilers and laying hens. He lives alone in the city, as his family stayed in the village. In order to increase his revenues, he is seeking a loan of 500,000 f to complete his capital and buy a transport van for his products. He has already repaid two loans of 150,000 f and 200,000 f to IMCEC. His ambition is to grow his business to the point of employing his brothers who stayed in the village.

loans.use: to buy a transport van for his products

loans.name: Ndèye Souaré

texts.fr: Ndèye est une femme mariée depuis 27 ans mais qui n'a pas d'enfants. Elle vend des légumes, du poisson frais, du poisson séché et de l'huile de palm au grand marché de sa localité.Elle utilise ses bénéfices pour subvenir à ses besoins mais aussi pour appuyer sa soeur dans la prise en charge des frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Afin d'augmenter son stock de produits, elle sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter du poisson fumé, de l'huile de palm, du poison séché et des légumes.Son ambition est de construire une maison et de la mattre en location.
texts.en: Ndèye is a woman who has been married for 27 years but who doesn’t have children. She sells vegetables, fresh fish, dried fish, and palm oil at the big market in her area. She uses her profits to meet her needs but also to help her sister pay for her children’s education. In order to augment her product stock, she is seeking a loan of 300,000 f to buy smoked fish, palm oil, dried fish, and vegetables. Her ambition is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish, palm oil, dried fish, and vegetables

loans.name: 6.01.12 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Liên has a retail business selling shoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase footwear to sell.

Liên is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children.
She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 06.01.12 Đông Vệ solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She lives with her 2 dependents.

In 2010, Liên joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women in order to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid 3 loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.
Liên has been involved in her business for 6 years.
The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase footwear to sell.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman who has six children. Three of her children are enrolled in school while the other three are still below school age. Nyamvula lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She operates a meat goat business and has been in this business for the last 10 years. Nyamvula aspires to open a butchery in the future.
With the loan of 20000 KES, she will be able to buy more goats for her business.

loans.use: to buy more goats for her business.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma tiene 47 años, está casada con Glicer, con quien tiene 2 hijos; de 17 y 10 años. Ella y su familia viven en una casa alquilada en el distrito de San Pedro de Cajas – Tarma.

Ella es una mujer creativa e ingeniosa. Se dedica a la confección y tejidos; chompas, gorras, chalinas, ponchos, etc. Todo lo que produce lo ofrece a los turistas nacionales e internacionales que llegan a su distrito, para ello cuenta con un puesto de ventas ubicado en el centro de la ciudad. 
Por su parte Glicer, su esposo, trabaja con telares artesanales confeccionando artículos más grandes; como tapices y mantas. Con este trabajo coordinado, Enma puede brindarles a sus hijos una educación decente y una calidad de vida mejor. “Me siento orgullosa porque todo lo que tengo lo obtuve a base de esfuerzo en casi 20 años”, menciona. 
Ahora viaja constantemente hacia la ciudad de Lima, llevando sus productos, al por mayor. Para esto tuvo que contactarse con personas quienes le hacen pedidos en cada campaña.
Una de sus metas es adquirir un local propio donde ofrezca su mercadería sin lidiar con la competencia.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al Futuro” y éste sería su crédito número 5 con MFP, dice que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas como en ocasiones anteriores. Por otro lado se siente cómoda trabajando con las socias de su banco comunal porque comparten los mismos intereses. 
Enma invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales para elaborar sus tejidos; como lana sintética y lana de oveja y alpaca; además de otras artesanías para surtir su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Enma is 47 years old and married to Glicer. They have two children, ages 17 and 10. She and her family live in a rented house in the District of San Pedro de Cajas -- Tarma.

Enma is a creative and clever woman. She sews and knits sweaters, caps, scarves, ponchos, and other items. Everything she produces is offered to domestic and international tourists who come to the district. For this reason, she has a vending post located in the central part of the city. Her husband, Glicer, produces much larger handwoven items, such as tapestries and blankets. They coordinate with one another in their work. Enma is able to provide her children with a decent education and a better quality of life. "I am proud because everything I have is the result of almost 20 years worth of effort," mentions Enma. She now travels constantly to the city of Lima where she can sell her products in bulk. In order to this, she had to contact people who were willing to place orders for each season. One of her goals is to rent a shop of her own where she can offer her merchandise without having to fight against the competition.

Enma is a member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres al Futuro" (Wome of the Future). This will be her fifth loan with MFP. She says that she will be punctual with her payments, just as she was on previous occasions. Enma feels comfortable working with the other members of her Communal Bank because they share the same interests. She will invest the money she requested in the purchase of materials for knitting, such as synthetic wool and sheep and alpaca wool. In addition, she will acquire additional handicrafts so that she can restock her vending post.

loans.use: to buy materials for knitting and to acquire additional handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza, tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años, es dueña de una Bodega donde vende abarrotes. En este tiempo aprendió a ser responsable y puntual, agradece todo el apoyo que le brindaron en los momentos  que mas lo  necesitaba, así como también en la educación de sus hijos, las ganancias que obtiene lo invierte en la educación de su hijo, y también pudo comprar artefactos para su casa. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, arroz, menestras por sacos, leche, fideos.
texts.en:
Violeta is a member of the Communal Bank "Fuerza" (Strength). She is 28 years old and has two children. Violeta has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. During this time, she learned how to be responsible and punctual. She is grateful for all of the support that has been given to her in moments when she needed it the most. In addition, she has been able to provide for her children's education. The profit she earns will be invested in her son's studies and the purchase of furnishings for her home.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, sacks of dried vegetables, milk, and noodles.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, sacks of dried vegetables, milk, and noodles.

loans.name: Oyundelger

texts.en: Oyundelger is a 46-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in Dornogovi province in Southern Mongolia. His children study at the college. He runs a welding business and it has been 14 years since he started the business. He does welding of home stuffs and truck trailers. He has many regular clients not only from the local areas but neighbouring villages. He has his own workplace inside his fence. Oyundelger is a talented man in the field and says,  "I would like to develop the business activities by purchasing some new and necessary materials for the business like saws, saw blades, cutter and irons". The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy necessary materials such as a thick and thin irons, saws and sawtooth for the business.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials such as thick and thin irons, saws and sawtooth for the business

loans.name: 06.02.05 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Loan has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

Loan is 31 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 06.02.05 Đông Vệ solidarity group. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Loan has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Loan hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

loans.name: Justo Leonel

texts.es:
Justo tiene 32 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive en un aldea rural de el municipio de las Vegas Santa Barbará.
Justo se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de café, banano y hortalizas. El desde hace 10 años se dedica a cultivar la tierra ya que este ha sido un  patrimonio familiar. El vende sus cultivos por temporada, el café lo vende a las exportadoras de la comunidad y el banano lo produce cada mes. El esta muy contento con las utilidades que le generan estos productos.
El esta solicitando un préstamo a ODEF de 17,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante, abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos y poder sacar una buena cosecha para la venta.
Su meta es seguir invirtiendo en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos para así obtener una mejor rentabilidad en sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Justo is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a rural neighborhood in the town of Las Vegas Santa Barbará.

Justo is a farmer who grow coffee, bananas, and vegetables. For the past 10 years, he has been cultivating the land that has been part of his family's assets. He sells his crops based on the season. The coffee is sold to exporters in the community and the bananas are produced monthly. Justo is very pleased with the profits that have generated from his products.

He is requesting a loan from ODEF in the amount of 17,000 HNL so that he can buy fertilizers and compost to maintain his crops. This will help him achieve a good harvest that he can sell. His goal is to continue investing in the maintenance of his crops so that he will achieve greater profitability from his harvests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina is a 40-year-old married woman. She has a daughter who is 1 year old. She describes herself to be social and jovial. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services such as plaiting, weaving, blow dry etc. and sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 12 years and employs 3 staff members. Her business is located within a busy and viable town and her primary customers are women. In addition, she also runs a taxi. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy beauty products. Her business goal is to own many more salons within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will use the profits generated to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty cosmetics.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is widowed with 12 children and only six of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a pub business and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda and iron sheets to build more rental rooms. She generates additional income through rental rooms. She works from home and sells to all categories of people but on retail and from her home. Florence works seven days a week and her monthly expenses include rainy season and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she can own a fully stocked pub and educate her children up to university. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because they were giving out timely loans. She lives in a home that she owns and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda and iron sheets to build more rental rooms

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma  is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She has a business selling new clothes. She has applied for a loan of 2000000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of new clothes. She has been in this business for four years. Besides this clothing business she also operates a restaurant. Her major challenges include seasonality, defaulters and ever increasing prices of new clothes. Fatuma aspires to see her business grow big so that she can start importing clothes from China and build her own house. Fatuma decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying utility bills   and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of new clothes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Bancomunal Lucero, tiene 30 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de cebiche y raspadillas, ella está muy feliz porque las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le ayudan a poder mejorar como persona, así como la manera correcta de cómo criar a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de papa, camote y maíz que utiliza en la preparación de las comidas que vende en su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank "Lucero" (Bright Star). She is 30 years old and has two children. Victoria sells "ceviche" (marinated seafood) and "raspadillas" (shaved ice). She is very happy because the training she received from her Communal Bank helped her to improve as a person. It also taught her the correct way to raise her children.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of sacks of potatoes, sweet potatoes, and corn that will be used in the preparation of dishes that she will sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, sweet potatoes, and corn for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Karla Samira

texts.es:
Karla tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 4, 6 y 10 años con los que vive en la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Karla desde hace 7 meses ella inicio un negocio de Club de Nutrición. Esta actividad la desempeña vendiendo productos nutricionales para bajar de peso. Ella obtuvo este negocio afiliándose a la empresa distribuidora de los productos que ofrece, dice que le va muy bien y que tiene muchos clientes, además las ganancias que tiene son favorables que le han ayudado a tener mejor estilo de vida para su familia.
Solicito su primer préstamo con ODEF de 15,000 lempiras para compra productos de nutrición y otra parte para comprar mobiliario que necesita en el negocio. Para darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su plan es prosperar en su negocio, mantenerlo estable  para darle a sus hijos la preparación adecuada y que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Karla is 27 years old, married, and has three children (ages 4, 6, and 10). She lives in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Seven months ago, Karla started a nutritional club. This business involves selling weight loss products. She obtained her business after she affiliated with a distribution company that offers these products. Karla says that she is doing very well and has many customers. In addition, the earnings have been quite favorable since they have helped her family to have a better lifestyle.

Karla is requesting her first loan from ODEF in the amount of 15,000 HNL so that she can buy nutritional products. Part of the loan will be used to buy furnishings that she needs for her business so that she can provide better service to her customers. Her plan is to prosper her business and maintain stability for her children so that they will be adequately prepared and not lack anything.

loans.use: to buy nutritional products and furnishings for her business.

loans.name: Toribia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Toribia esta emprendedora tiene una actividad económica que es la venta de comida corriente de forma ambulante y por encargo se dedica a esta actividad desde hace doce años lo cual cuenta con mucha experiencia  a lo largo de los años ha adquirido muy buena clientela gracias a la buena calidad de su comida, en la actualidad ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos alimenticios para la elaboración de la diferentes platillos de comida que ofrece a su clientela como. Carnes de res y cerdo, pollo, arroz, frijoles, aceites, verduras, sal, en otro productos.
texts.en: Mrs. Toribia is an entrepreneur whose business is selling food on a door-to-door, order basis.  She has been in this activity for 12 years, so she has plenty of experience.  Over the years she has built a good customer base thanks to the high quality of her meals.  Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy food ingredients to make the different dishes she prepares.  These ingredients are beef, pork, chicken, rice, beans, oils, vegetables, salt and other items.

loans.use: To buy beef, pork, chicken, rice, beans, oils, vegetables, salt and other products.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 69 years old. He is married to Veronicah, and they have three children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past thirteen years.

This will be his fourth loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase seedlings and fertilizer, enabling him to expand his farming.

He hopes to purchase another plot of land in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Regina

texts.es: Regina es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza, tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, es dueña de una bodega de abarrotes, le gusta ahorrar porque gracias a ello ha podido amoblar su casa y sigue ahorrando aún más para construir el segundo piso de su casa y así poder cumplir su sueño de tener un restaurante de comida y pueda vivir mejor. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para la bodega como leche, azúcar, arroz, fideos, harina, menestras.
texts.en:
Regina is a member of the Communal Bank "Fuerza" (Strength). She is 28 years old and has two children. Regina is the owner of a grocery store. She enjoys the savings because they helped to furnish her home. Regina continues to save even more because she wants to add a second floor to her house, fulfill her dream of opening a restaurant, and be able to live better.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries for her store such as milk, sugar, rice, noodles, flour, and dried vegetables.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, rice, noodles, flour, and dried vegetables.

loans.name: Mazera

texts.en:
Mazera is taking another loan of 50,000 KES to expand her existing business. With the loan, she will be able to purchase sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice. 

The previous loan increased her monthly income, and since then, her standard of living has improved. Mazera is so grateful to Kiva and Yehu for giving her loans.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela es socia del Bancomunal Lucero, tiene 24 años de edad, es madre de un niño, tiene una bodega de abarrotes. Ella dice que en FINCA Perú  aprendió a ser puntual responsable y a ahorrar y lo seguirá haciendo para que en el futuro pueda abrir un minimarket. Está muy feliz de que sus ahorros están creciendo cada vez más, y así ella puede hacer planes para  usarlo de manera correcta. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su bodega como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite, bebidas.
texts.en: Gabriela is a member of the communal bank "Lucero".  She is 24 years old, has a son, and runs a grocery store.  She says that it was in FINCA Perú where she learned to be responsible and how to save money, which is what she continues to do so she can open a minimarket in the future.  She is very happy about the fact that her savings are growing more and more, so she can make plans to use them correctly.  The loan she is requesting is to buy groceries for her store, such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, oil and beverages.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, oil, beverages.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is still running a women's and children's clothes trading business in Vanadzor. Thanks to her occupation Marine is able to support her family. Recently Marine’s rented stall condition has been improved and Marine says that this positively affects her business. Thanks to the changes, particularly separate entrances to stalls, customers feel more comfortable. 
Marine used her first Kiva loan to develop her clothes assortment. Now she is asking for an 800,000 Armenian drams loan to buy jeans, summer season blouses, skirts, trousers and children's clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy jeans, summer season blouses, skirts, trousers and children's clothes to resell

loans.name: Ruth Estela

texts.es: Ruth empezó su negocio con un capital que le regalo su esposo, quien trabaja en como jefe de importaciones en almacenes Boyacá. Le ha ido tan bien que actualmente ya es mayorista. El negocio lo administra ella sola pero tiene vendedores que ganan un porcentaje de dinero de acuerdo a sus ventas. Sus productos como la ropa, bisutería son de fácil aceptación para los cliente por eso tiene acogida. Como su negocio es el comercio el cual tiene mucha demanda su dificultad es la competencia pero sigue adelante. Su inspiración también son sus hijos quienes estudian en la escuela. Con el préstamo va a adquirir más mercaderías con lo cual desea crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Ruth began her business with money given to her as a gift by her husband who works as head of imports at the Boyacá stores.  Business has gone so well for her that now she is a wholesaler.  She manages the business by herself but has salespeople who earn a commission on sales.  The products she sells are clothing and costume jewelry, which are good selling products among her customers.  Since her trade has a high demand there is a lot of competition, but she continues to get ahead.  She also is inspired by her children who are school-aged.  With the loan she plans to buy merchandise to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is a 67-year-old farmer from Akhmeta District, East Georgia. She is a widow and lives with her 28-year-old son, Zurab. He is a dentist, but is currently unemployed. Elene is a pensioner. She also takes care of a dairy cow and produces dairy products. Half of the products are consumed by her family, and a small surplus is sold in the village. Her family's total average monthly income is 200 Laris. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Elene has requested credit for the setup of a dentist's office for her son. Her loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiatives by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages a provision for business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor. Regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income, the country's rural poor lack access to credit products. 

With the credit, Elene will purchase all the needed equipment to start a dentist's office for her son. The office will serve the population of Akhmeta District. Since Zurab is a good professional, with relevant work experience, he will have many clients. For the first year, Zurab will use the entire profit to cover the loan as well as to reinvest in the business. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve, and the family will, in case of need, have enough income to be able to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for the setup of a dentist's office.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 32 años, está casada con Edwin, con quien tiene 2 hijos (de 13 y 8 años). Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia en el distrito de San Pedro de Cajas- Tarma. 

Se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos artesanales. Lleva en esta actividad más de 14 años, exactamente cuando nació su primer hijo, ya que antes apoyaba a sus padres en actividades agrícolas. Ella tiene gran destreza en los tejidos, desde niña tejía la ropa de sus muñecas, ahora que tiene una responsabilidad familiar convirtió su pasatiempo como su principal medio para adquirir ingresos. En la actualidad cuenta con telares con los que elabora mantas y tapices de diversas lanas. “Es más rentable tejer con lana de alpaca, pero también es arriesgado porque se invierte mucho”, menciona.
A la vez, ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, en la producción de maca, cuyas ventas también le son favorables. Esta pareja se dividen los roles, mientras Silvia está en los tejidos, Edwin en los cultivos, así piensan lograr sus objetivos, uno de ellos es terminar de construir su casa. En el futuro quieren abrir una tienda de ventas en su casa propia, ya que no cuenta con un local propio.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y éste sería su crédito número 3 con MFP, como en anteriores ocasiones, menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Por su parte se siente contenta de compartir su trabajo con personas responsables y solidarias dentro de su banco comunal.
Silvia invertirá el crédito de la siguiente manera: la mitad para comprar materiales para la confección de tejidos (lanas, hilos de colores) y la otra mitad para adquirir semillas para iniciar una siembra de maca.
texts.en:
Silvia is 32 years old and married to Edwin. They have two children, ages 13 and 8. She and her family live in their own home in the District of San Pedro de Cajas -- Tarma.

Silvia produces handwoven crafts. She has been in this business for more than 14 years, which is almost the same age as her first child. Prior to this, Silvia helped her parents with the farm work. She possesses great skill for knitting. As a girl, Silvia made doll clothes. Now that she is responsible for her family, she converted her hobby into her primary source of income. Silvia now has looms that are used for making blankets and tapestries out of different types of wool. "It is more profitable to weave with alpaca wool, but it is also a risk because I have so much invested in it," she says. Right now, Silvia and her husband are busy farming, specifically the cultivation of maca root. Their sales have been favorable. This couple splits up the duties. Silvia spends her time weaving, while Edwin looks after the crops. They plan to accomplish their goals, one of which is to finish the construction of their house. In the future, they also want to open a shop in their home since they do not have a place of their own where they can sell.

Silvia is a member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres al Futuro" (Women of the Future). This will be her third loan with MFP. Just as she was on previous occasions, Silvia says that she will be punctual with her loan payments. She is pleased to be sharing in the work of her Communal Bank with other responsible and supportive people. Silvia will invest her loan in the following manner: half will be used to buy materials for weaving (wool, colored thread) and the other half will be used to buy seeds so that she can start another crop of maca root.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving and seeds for planting maca root.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es: Serafina es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, y es socia de FINCA Perú hace un año. Se dedica a la  crianza y venta de animales domésticos y se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado con su ahorro, está agradecida porque las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le enseñan mucho a trabajar correctamente y  educar  a sus hijos. Su meta es comprar un mototaxi  para que sus hijos puedan trabajar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos para los animales que cría.
texts.en:
Serafina is a member of the Communal Bank "Fuerza" (Strength). She is 40 years old and the mother of five children. Serafina has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year. She raises and sells domesticated animals and is proud of everything she has achieved with her savings. Serafina is grateful because the training she received from her Communal Bank taught her the correct way to work and how to provide her children with an education. Her goal is to buy a motorcycle taxi so that her children will be able to work.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of feed for the animals she raises.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Juana Yolanda

texts.es: Juana es socia del Bancomunal Lucero, tiene 62 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, de zapatillas y ropa para señoritas. Con las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal aprendió a ahorrar y agradece la confianza que le brindaron al otorgarle el préstamo rápido y fácil. Las ganancias que ahora tiene son muchas y puede trazarse mas metas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y zapatillas para su negocio.
texts.en: Juana is a member of the communal bank "Lucero".  She is 62 years old and the mother of six children.  She sells cosmetics by catalogue, and women's clothing and shoes.  With the training received at her communal bank, she learned how to save her money.  She is grateful for the confidence shown in her by giving her such a quick, easy-term loan.  She is now earning quite a profit and setting goals.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothing and shoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Hesret

texts.ru:
Hesret 42 qoda. On jivet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Hesret jenat i imeyet 3 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz okkupirovannix territoriy Karabakh,Fizuli goroda. Hesret uje 6 let kak imeyet svoy magazin gde prodayet moyushiye sredstva a takje razniye kremi shampuni i t.d .
No seychas on nujdayetsya v 1000 AZN chtobi kupit pisheviye produkti dlya rozmesheniya v svoyem magazini dlya prodaji, tak kak yest spros sredi pokupateley na pishiviye produkti. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego starshego brata.
texts.en:
Hesret is 42 years old. He lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family. Hesret is married and has three children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and migrated from the occupied territory Karabakh in the city of Fuzuli.

Herset has owned his store, where he sells cleaning products and also different lotions and shampoos and similar products, for 6 years already. Currently he needs 1000 AZN in order to purchase food products for placement in his store to sell, as there is a demand for food products among his customers. This business he learned from his oldest brother.

loans.use: to buy food products for his store

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана с мужем и дочерью живет в городе Мелитополь. Она продает головные уборы и шарфы на одном из местных рынков. Богатый ассортимент и доступные для среднестатистического покупателя цены дают Светлане хорошее преимущество перед конкурентами. В бизнесе она уже 13 лет. Ее оборотный капитал на данный момент составляет 18 000 гривен. 

Светлана планирует вложить 10 000 гривен в смену ассортимента с осенне-зимнего  на весенне-летний. Она хотела бы закупить кепки, панамки, банданы, летние шифоновые шарфики и парео, которые всегда хорошо расходятся летом в сезон отпусков у украинцев.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Svetlana lives in the city of Melitopol with her husband and her daughter. She sells hats and scarves at one of the local markets. The broad assortment and prices affordable to the average purchaser gives Svetlana an advantage versus the competitors. She has been in this business for 13 years already. Her working capital is currently 18 000 hryvnia. 

Svetlana plans to invest 10 000 hryvnia in changing the assortment from fall/winter products to spring/summer products. She would like to buy caps, panama hats, bandanas, chiffon summer scarves and summer shawls, which always sell well in the summer, in the Ukrainians' holiday season.

loans.use: shift the assortment of hats and scarves from fall/winter products to spring/summer products

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана с супругом и взрослой дочерью живет в Мелитополе. Она торгует женской одеждой, платьями, блузами, кофтами на одном из местных рынков. У Светланы всегда есть хороший выбор товара, что неизменно привлекает к ней все новых и новых покупательниц. Более того, товар она реализует по приемлемым ценам, что еще больше заинтересовывает ее клиенток. Светлана в этом бизнесе уже около 16 лет. Хороший опыт и любовь к своему делу помогли ей достичь оборотного капитала в 40 000 гривен.  


Светлана планирует вложить кредит в 15 000 гривен в то, чтобы закупить дополнительный ассортимент летней одежды для последующей реализации. Она любит свою работу, ей очень по душе работать именно с этой группой товаров. Светлана надеется вложить полученные от бизнеса средства в дальнейшее его развитие.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Svetlana lives in Melitopol with her husband and her grown-up daughter. She sells women's clothing, dresses, blouses and sweaters at one of the local markets. Svetlana always has a great assortment of products, which consistently attracts more and more buyers to her. Furthermore, she sells the products at acceptable prices, which interests her customers even more. 

Svetlana has been in this business for around 16 years already. Her great experience and love for her work helped her to achieve a working capital of 40 000 hryvnia. Svetlana plans to invest the loan of 15 000 hryvnia in purchasing an additional assortment of summer clothes for subsequent sale. She loves her work and she really prefers to work with this type of products. Svetlana hopes to invest the income received from her business in its further development.

loans.use: to purchase an additional assortment of women's summer clothes for sale

loans.name: Guilda Georgina

texts.es: Guilda pertenece al Bancomunal Muyurina, tiene 31 años de edad, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 6 meses. Se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado, se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado en este tiempo como socia en FINCA Perú, está aprendiendo a ahorrar porque antes no lo hacia, le gusta las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal porque le enseñan mucho en el ámbito personal y también en su negocio. Su meta es abrir una tienda de venta de ropa. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en el cultivo de verduras para luego venderlas en el mercado.
texts.en:
Guilda is a member of the Communal Bank "Muyurina". She is 31 years old and has been with FINCA Peru for six months. Guilda sells vegetables at the market. She is proud of everything she has accomplished during the time she has been a member of FINCA Peru. Guilda learned how to save because she had not done so previously. She enjoys the training classes offered by her Communal Bank because they have taught her a great deal in terms of personal issues and her business. Her goal is to open a clothing store.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the cultivation of vegetables that she can later sell at the market.

loans.use: to invest in growing vegetables that she can sell at the market.

loans.name: Yoni Nilda

texts.es: Yoni es socia del Bancomunal Lucero, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, es dueña de unas cabinas de Internet, donde alquila computadoras por hora con acceso a Internet. Nilda es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y se siente feliz es su Bancomunal porque ahí le ayudan a concretar sus metas, su negocio está creciendo así como sus ganancias, de esta manera puede mejorar su estabilidad económica, y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia. Con las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal aprende a ser responsable, solidaria, puntual, esos valores que aprende los inculca en su familia, y así su familia también progresa al igual que ella. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas y golosinas como jugos , gaseosas , como galletas, snacks, chocolates, caramelos, para venderlos a sus clientes que asisten a las cabinas de Internet.
texts.en: Yoni is a member of the communal bank "Lucero".  She is 53 years old, the mother of four children, and runs an Internet cafe where she rents computers by the hour and offers Internet access.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for three years.  She is happy to be in her communal bank because it helps her reach her goals.  The business is growing and so are profits, so this will improve her economic stability and giver her family a better quality of life.    With the training received in her communal bank she learns to be responsible, supportive, punctual which are values she can pass on to her family so they can get ahead like her.  The loan will be used to buy beverages, sweets, juices, sodas, cookies, snacks, chocolates, and caramels to sell to Internet cafe customers.

loans.use: To buy beverages, sweets, sodas, cookies, snacks, chocolates, and caramels.

loans.name: Teyyar

texts.ru: Teyyar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda kotoroye yavlyayetsya seychas okkupirovannimi. Teyyar 38 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Teyyar jivet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi kotorix ochen lubit. U Teyyara yest problema s glazami kotoraya obrazavalas posle voyni v 1992 godu izza poluchennix udarov i travm v golovu, i on dolgoye vremya ne mog ustroitsya na rabotu izza etoy problemu, no uje 5 let kak Starshiy brat Teyyara pomog yemu otkrit etot magazin gde Teyyar sam i rabotayet. I seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye svoyego magazina i razvit svoy bizness dlya uludsheniya mesachnix doxodov.
texts.en:
Teyyar is an IDP (internally displaced person), he migrated from the city of Fuzuli which is currently occupied. Teyyar is 38 years old. He is married and has two children. Teyyar lives in the Fuzuli region together with his wife and children, who he loves very much. 

Teyyar has problems with his eyes, which he got after the war in 1992 from receiving blows and injury to his head. For a long time he could not find a job because of these problems, but 5 years ago Teyyar's older brother helped him open this store, where Teyyar himself works. Currently he needs 2000 AZN in order to increase the space in his store and develop his business, in order to improve his monthly income.

loans.use: to increase the space in his store

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж занимается торговлей топлива. Сама Дилбар занимается шитьем платьев и постельного белья. Этим видом деятельности она занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новой швейной машинки с компьютерной установкой, необходимой мебели и тканей.
texts.en:
Dilbar lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 45 years old and married. She has three children. Her husband works with selling fuel. 

Dilbar works with embroidering dresses and bed linen. She has been engaged in this type of activity for 10 years. She takes a loan for purchasing a digital sewing machine, the required furniture and fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase a digital sewing machine, furniture and fabrics

loans.name: Alberto Ernesto

texts.es: De Portoviejo les presentamos a Alberto. Su profesión desde que tiene memoria a sido Jornalero de la construcción pero como sus trabajos eran esporádicos y por propuesta de un amigo se inicio en la venta de agua. El trabajo lo realiza solo de manera ambulante recorriendo diferentes aéreas de la ciudad en la mañana y tarde. Como es conocido no a tenido mayores problemas. Está casado con Maria Yolanda quien le ayuda con los gastos vendiendo productos por catálogos. Tiene 2 niños de 10 y 16 años que asisten a la escuela fiscal. Con el préstamo Alberto piensa adquirir bidones de agua, legumbres y queso para aumentar sus ventas. Su meta a futuro seria comprar un vehículo con lo cual sería más fácil la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Alberto, who is from Portoviejo, is being presented here. He recalls that his career started as a journeyman in the construction business. However, the jobs were sporadic, so a friend recommended that he start selling water. Alberto works by himself as a traveling vendor, going to different areas of the city from morning to afternoon. He does not face any major problems. Alberto is married to Maria Yolanda, who helps with the expenses by selling merchandise through catalogs. They have two children, ages 10 and 16, who attend a state school.

Alberto will use this loan to acquire containers of water, legumes, and cheese so that he can increase his sales. His goal for the future is to buy a vehicle so that he will have an easier time selling his products.

loans.use: to purchase containers of water, legumes, and cheese to sell.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza, tiene 22 años de edad, tiene un bebé de 1 año de edad, es dueña de una tienda donde vende abarrotes y bebidas. Ella está agradecida con FINCA Perú por el apoyo que le han brindado y porque confiaron en ella al otorgarle el préstamo. Las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le ayudan a tener más autoconfianza para llevar un buen negocio. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para la tienda como leche, azúcar, arroz, fideos, menestras, bebidas.
texts.en:
Marleny is a member of the Communal Bank "Fuerza" (Strength). She is 22 years old and has a baby who is a year old. Marleny is the owner of a store where she sells groceries and beverages. She is grateful to FINCA Peru for the support that has been given to her and for trusting her with a loan. The training she received from her Communal Bank helped her to have more self-confidence so that she can carry out a successful business.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries for her store such as milk, sugar, rice, noodles, dried vegetables, and beverages.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, rice, noodles, dried vegetables, and beverages.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Moron Group

texts.es: La Sra. Irene   es divorciada, tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Morón” grupo  conformado por 6 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Irene trabaja desde hace  3 años en la venta de prendas de vestir y venta de regalos   en una tienda, este negocio surge a raíz de su divorcio,  ya que ella tenía que trabajar para mantener a su hijo y es así que empezó vendiendo ropa en la calle, poco a poco se hizo de un capital, puso su tienda de ropa. Irene nos cuenta que todo lo consiguió con mucho trabajo y perseverancia ya que su motivación eran su hijo y sus deseos de superación eran más grandes que sus problemas,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, su hijo va a una escuela privada, y sobre todo ella y su hijo tienen una mejor calidad de vida, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería (prendas de vestir). Irene  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Irene is divorced and has one school age child.  Currently, she is a member of the communal bank “Virgen del Carmen de Morón,” a group made up of 6 members that work in diverse areas of business.  Irene has worked for 3 years in clothing and gift sales in a store.  This business started because of her divorce, since she had to work to take care of her son and that is how she began selling clothes in the street.  Little by little, she acquired capital and opened a clothing store.  Irene tells us that she has obtained everything with a lot of hard work and perseverance since she is motivated by her son and her desire to overcome is greater than her problems.  Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has achieved a greater income, her son attends a private school, and above all, she and her son have a better quality of life.  With the goal of continuing to grow her business, she has requested a new loan to purchase merchandise (clothing).  Irene will achieve her goals with a lot of hard work and effort and the Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 47 years old. She is married to David and together they have two school-going children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our clients. She will use the loan amount to start up a bookshop in her home area.

She hopes to own a bookshop in her area to diversify in her business.

loans.use: To start up a bookshop.

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Savun (pictured in the photo) is 33 years old and lives with his wife, Vannak, who is 31 years old, in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have been married since 2006 and they have two young sons. 

Savun sells recycling materials, while his wife is s tailor. Because the house where he lives was old, Savun deiced to build a new one. He is now in the process of building his house, but he lacks sufficient funds to pay for the building fees. Therefore, he has to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to pay the fees associated with building a new house.

loans.name: Meliton

texts.en:
Meliton is 59 years old. He lives in a small village of the Akhmeta District. He lives alone. His only source of income was a milk cow. Meliton used to produce dairy products and sold most of them in the village. At the moment, the cow has stopped milking and he is left without any income. According to Credo estimations he belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Meliton requested credit for purchasing calves. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to the country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Meliton will start up a dairy farm. He will purchase 3 calves and grow them. The calves will be placed in an old cattle-shed located in Alex’s yard. After half a year he will start the production of cheese and sell it on the local market to dairy products retailers. His income will increase by 250 - 300 Laris and Meliton will be able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves for the start-up of a dairy farm.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is taking another loan of Ksh 15,000 to expand on her existing business. She plans to use the loan to add stock of maize flour and rice to her shop. Since the previous loan, her monthly income has increased by over forty percent and she dreams of expanding the business further to become a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of maize flour and rice to her shop.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 62 years old and widowed.  She has three sons and a daughter.

Sarah owns a small store selling snacks and food products. It has been a year since she opened it. Working in her store makes her feel happy and productive, that’s why she decided to continue working and expanding the store. For that reason she has applied for this loan in order to bring in more products other than food items.

loans.use: to bring in more products other than food items.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha, 30 years old and a married lady, has four daughters and a son. Her husband is a mechanic who works in a car repair workshop.

Maha is still making her own accessories, and besides the handmade accessories, Maha brings other shapes and types of accessories that she can't make or has not got the materials to make for the present.

Now she has applied for this loan in order to buy more beads and more accessories to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more beads to make accessories.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en: Kassim is a married man who has two girls and a boy, two of whom are in school. He has been operating a food stall for the last two years, which is located at the market center. He also sells coconuts as his side business, and he aspires to open a café in the future. His primary customers are the local residents, and he decided to join Yehu to get funds to boost his business. He intends to use the loan of Ksh 50,000 to purchase wheat flour, rice and sugar for his food stall, and to buy coconuts to sell. He describes food to be his greatest monthly expense. Kassim owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice and sugar for his food stall, and to buy coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is married with four children, and all of her children go to school. She has a business of a restaurant and has been in this business for ten years.  She takes care of additional family members. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, rice and both sweet and Irish potatoes. She generates additional income through selling charcoal and rental rooms.  

She works seven days a week and her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Zaituni is aspiring of seeing her business grow so that she owns a fully stocked restaurant and also to build more rental rooms. She lives in a home that she owns and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, chicken, beef, rice and both sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena has five children, all girls. All of these children are in school. She is married to a businessman who provides support to her livelihood through his earnings. Magdalena operates a clothes selling business, selling her clothes at the market to the general public. She aspires to open a clothes selling wholesale business in the future. Other sources of income include sales from farm produce.

Magdalena owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water, and she describes school fees to be her greatest monthly expense. With the loan of Ksh 10,000, she will be able to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam, 57 years old and a married woman, has three daughters and two sons; one of her daughters got married.

Maryam has been making embroidered traditional dresses for almost 20 years now. She used to make them by order, and now Maryam wants to start making more embroidered items so she can participate in related exhibitions and distribute to shops. For that reason, she has applied for this loan in order to buy more thread and fabric and a sewing machine to accelerate her business.

loans.use: to buy more thread and fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Maren

texts.en:
Maren is 45 years old, married, and supports a family of nine. He is a mixed farmer, specializing in sheep and wheat farming for the last 20 years. His monthly income is about KES 60,000. 

He has applied for his fourth loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD, and he plans to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers and to prepare the land. This will assist getting a higher crop output. 

The anticipated profits will enable him to support his farm. His future dreams are to educate his school-going children and to get wealthy.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers and to prepare the land.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 41 years old. He lives in a small village of the Kakheti Region with his mother, Nelly. Both David and Nelly work as agricultural workers in the village. They are paid on a daily basis. The total average monthly income of the family is 250 Laris. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

David and his mother used to run a dairy farm. They had cows, and the family was producing cheese and selling it. David sold the cows because he needed cash for purchasing a house to live in, as they didn’t have one. Now David has requested credit for restarting the dairy farm. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to the country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit David will start up a small dairy farm. He will purchase two calves and grow them. The calves will be placed in an old cattle-shed located in David’s yard. After half a year he will start the production of cheese and sell it on the local market to dairy products retailers. The income of the family will increase by 250 – 400 Laris, which will mean a 100 – 160% increase. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda, 22 years old and a conservative married lady, asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Ayda is a housewife who has a son and a daughter. Her husband sells coffee in a coffee stall. 

She wants to help her husband to improve their living conditions, so she started to sell home products by buying a few items. Now she has applied for this youth loan to bring more home products to increase her sales.

loans.use: to bring in more home products

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla, 38 years old and widowed, is supporting three children by selling blankets and sheets to neighbors and friends. 

Khawla has applied for this loan to bring more bed covers and sheets for sale to increase her revenue and expand her business in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to bring in more bed covers and sheets

loans.name: Samin

texts.en:
Samin is a married woman with two boys and five girls, three of whom are enrolled in school. She operates a grocery and sells her goods at the market. She has been in this business for the last three years and dreams of opening a retail shop in future. 

Samin lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes high transportation costs to be her major drawback, and school fees to be her greatest monthly expense. With the Ksh 30,000, she plans to purchase vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en: Veronicah is from Nyahururu and is 50 years old. She is married with three children who are in school. She is a farmer and has been doing it for the past six years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy some seedlings and fertilizers. She hopes to expand her business in the future and have a lot of income.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fragdalince

texts.en:
Fragdalince is a 37-year-old woman and married to Mikha, a 38-year-old man. She has 4 children, namely: Intan, 11, Sarce, 10, Yehuda, 7, and Stella, 2. 

Fragdalince assists her husband in meeting the family needs by selling kerosene. She has been running the business for one year. At the moment, the business is not doing well due to the limited capital that she has. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. She would like to buy more kerosene to be sold.

loans.use: to purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a 37-year-old farmer who lives with his mother, Yuni, 60 years old and a widow. Markus plants vegetables such as tomatoes and basil. He learned the farming skills from his father. Every day he goes to the farm on foot. The farm is located approximately 500 meters from his house. His mother and brothers accompany and help him when working at the farm. He often harvests the vegetables every month and his mother sells them at a traditional market. The income from selling vegetables helps him meet his family needs. 

Markus plans to plant more vegetables but he needs more money to buy more seedlings and fertilizer. This situation led him to request a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. Markus is hoping that he can improve the business as well as better meet his family's living costs.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a 42-year-old lady and married. She has been blessed with three children: Andeling, 23; Sonya, 21 and Lian, 8. Andeling is married, Sonya is studying in University, and Lian is attending 3rd grade of Elementary School. 

Naomi assists her husband in producing extra income for the family by selling cakes and sweet ice. She makes this kind of foodstuff herself. She distributes the products in a school canteen and kiosk near her residence. Sometimes the profit generated from the business is not sufficient in meeting her family's needs as well as the educational needs of Sonya and Lian. 

Naomi met with a TLM loan officer who offered a loan product. She then requested a loan of IDR 12,000,000 from TLM. She would like to spend the loan on Sonya’s university costs and for purchasing more ingredients, i.e. wheat flour, frying oil, bananas, etc. for her business; also she would like to help her husband in enlarging his catfish business. She is expecting that the loan will bring more good impact for the business and family life.

loans.use: to pay for her children's educational fees and to buy wheat flour, frying oil, etc

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha has been farming in Olkalau town for the past five years.She plants cash crops such as maize, beans and potatoes. She is 58 years old, married to George who is also a farmer, and they have two children.

This will be her first loan in the amount of Kenya shillings 10,000 and she plans to use it to buy fertilizer, maize and potato seeds for planting in her farm during this planting season.

In the future, Martha hopes to grow her farming business and plant more cash crops hence make more income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 24-year-old single man. He describes himself to be an aggressive man. Earlier on, Joseph was doing farming. He decided to engage in something different, providing transportation,  where he has been for 2 years. His business is located in a busy market  and his primary customers are local residents from villages. 

Joseph describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. His business goal is to own a fleet of motorbikes  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a house.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, age 31, has operated a kiosk business - a small retail store - for the past year. He and his wife Mercy have two children. David gets a monthly income of KES.28000 from his business. 

David has requested his first loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET Ltd. With this loan he intends to purchase stock for his business, especially home products such as toilet soaps and washing powder. David intends to use the anticipated profits to save toward the education of his children.

His dreams and hopes are to improve his business and to own a business premises in the future. He also wants to diversify his sources of income by investing in other businesses, such as dairy farming.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his kiosk business

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent, age 35, is a fish vendor. She started her business 14 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. She and her husband have seven children, ages seven, nine, 12, 14, 16, 18, and 19 years old.

She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 in order to purchase more fish to offer for sale. The profit from her business will help her cater to her family's needs. 

She hopes to educate her children to higher levels of education and to see her business grow. This will be her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is progressing well with her business and family. Her kiosk is situated on the beach, so her customers are mostly beach goers and her greatest challenge is lack of customers in the low season.  Sophia joined Yehu because of its affordability. 

In the future Sophia would like to start a new business to substitute for the other, especially during the low season. For now Sophia will spend her loan buying new stock for her kiosk and also buying plastic chairs for customers to sit on.

loans.use: To purchase new stock for her kiosk and plastic chairs for her customers

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en: Lozi is progressing well and she is now taking out another loan of Ksh. 50,000 to expand her existing business. The loan will help her to purchase bundles of second-hand clothes to sell. Since the last loan, her business is going on well and she aspires to open a clothes shop to sell her clothes from.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 37 years old and is married with four children. He also takes care of two dependents. He sells meat and he has been in this business for three years. His business is open from 7 a.m to 5 p.m every day and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Alphonse has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase large quantities of meat to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, to pay school fees for his children and he will be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of meat to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine, aged 45, is married to Joseph and they are blessed with five children. She runs a retail shop, which she has been doing for the last two years, and earns a monthly income of KES.17,000 from the business. 


This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use the whole loan to purchase stock for her business especially home products like toilet soap and washing powder. 


Josephine intends to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and hopes to own business premises in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock like  toilet soap and washing powder.

loans.name: Francisca Kerly

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos,  4 de ellos mayores de edad y uno de 9 años, los dos menores aun viven en su casa y estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es albañil.
 
Ella aprendió corte y confección en un centro del cantón y ahora con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, aunque reconoce que lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de niñas ya que hay mas diseños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Ella lleva más de 30 años con su negocio y comenta que gracias a Dios casi nunca le falta trabajo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para seguir adelante.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank New Horizons meets every fifteen days in Canton Jipijapa, canton known with the name of the sultana of coffee because of its extensive coffee´s crop, which has a unique taste, for its gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

In this place lives the Francisca, who is 50 years old and lives in free union of which has five children, four of them are adults and one is nine years old. The two youngest sons still live at home and are studying in college and school. The husband is a bricklayer.

She learned cutting and sewing in the canton´s center and now with the purpose of obtaining her own income and taking advantage of her knowledge in cutting and sewing, she put in his house a small sewing workshop. There she makes all kinds of clothing for men, women and children, while recognizing that what she likes most is sewing for women or girls as there are more designs. 

She works based on orders from individuals and in seasons also makes uniforms for institutions and schools in the locality. 

She works every day from 6h00 to 22h00 and sometimes until later when she has orders to be delivered. She has been in business for more than 30 years and, thank God, has hardly ever been without work (to do).

She will use this loan to buy fabrics, yarns, buttons and other materials for sewing. For two years, she has been with the communal bank and likes it for all the help she has received from the loans to get ahead.

Her dreams are to get ahead and have good health.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, yarns, buttons and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Elsa Leonor

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elsa, tiene 62 años de edad, está divorciada pero  de esa relación tienen cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes,  lleva más de 7 años en el Banco 	Comunal y está muy contenta con todo en el grupo, con sus compañeras y con los créditos que le ayudan mucho para salir adelante.

Ella con la intención de ganar su sustento  y con esto poder salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días ya que a veces recorre y también tiene que salir a cobrar sus productos ya que deja a créditos y cobra por semana, cada quince días se va Guayaquil a comprar la mercadería que necesita. Lleva  8  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, gracias a esto puede salir adelante ella sola.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, entre otras prendas.
 
Su sueño es tener muy buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jijijapa canton.  This canton is known as "La Sultana del Café" for its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine, and the warmth of its people.

This is where we meet Elsa, age 62.  She is divorced, but she has four children from this relationship.  The children are grown and independent.  She has been in her communal bank for over seven years.  She is very happy with everything in the group, with her colleagues, and with the loans that help her a lot in order to get ahead.

She sells all types of clothes door-to-door with the intention of earning a living with which she is able to get ahead.  She works every day because at times she travels.  She also has to leave to collect for her products because she leaves them on credit.  She collects weekly.  Every 15 days she goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise that she needs.  She has been doing this business activity for eight years.  It is going very well for her, and thanks to this she is able to get ahead by herself.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise like pants, blouses, and t-shirts, among other garments.
