Currently, Mary has proposed expanding her inventory in regards to her snacks, corn liquor, and the growth and sales of animals, all because it is a very lucrative business in her area. It is for this reason that she is asking for a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of S/.1000 Soles, which will be designated for investment in buying pots, serving spoons, colanders, and nutritionally balanced feed and corral repairs for her animals, which will, in time, allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business and to buy feed for animals.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya and is married with six children, four of whom are still in school. She has been active in farming for more than twenty years and currently produces maize, beans, onions, millet, and sorghum among other products. Her farm is run with the help of two farmhands.

Doris has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and construct a zero grazing unit in her farm. She is optimistic that she will be able to expand her dairy farm and educate her children.

She says the low market prices, especially the ones for milk, are her major challenge, but she remains happy that Juhudi Kilimo has developed a good product for small farms.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit and buy a water tank

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer in Kitale with five years in active farming, producing and selling vegetables, beans, maize, and onions that he sells to the local market. He says farming is his only source of income.

John has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. He is planning to use the income to repay the loan and thereafter venture into dairy farming.

John points at poor infrastructure, pests, and diseases as his major challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 31 and has had three consistent years in farming.  He currently produces maize, poultry, and other horticultural products and sells them to the local market. He is married, but he is not yet blessed with children.

Kennedy has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow for a venture into dairy farming. He hopes to generate milk for the family and to sell in order to meet other basic needs.

He laments the high costs of feed and unreliable rains.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a mother of three children who are all attending school. Her farm is run with the help of one farmhand, and she has been active in farming for eight straight years. She earns some additional income from her second-hand clothing business.

Leah has requested a third loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. She believes this will boost her family's income. She plans to expand the acreage of her farm in the near future.

Leah sees the unreliability of rain and high costs of production as the major challenges in her farming business.

loans.use: To buy poultry for her business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary  is a resident of the Nkubu area in Central Kenya, where she lives with her family and has been practicing mixed farming actively for 15 years. Her farm produces coffee, bananas, and milk, which are sold within the local market to generate income to meet the family's basic needs.

Rosemary has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to start a pig-farming business. She plans to use the income to improve the acreage for her bananas and grocery business, which she runs in the local market.

Rosemary appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services. She says the challenges of high costs of labor and farm inputs remain the major threats to her farming business.

loans.use: To buy piglets.

loans.name: Hanah

texts.en:
Hanah has been in the farming business for twelve years in her rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya.  She produces maize, beans and other horticultural products, which are sold within the local markets. She is married with three children aged between eleven and seven years. She sells second-hand clothes besides engaging in farming.

Hanah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry for a venture into poultry farming as well. She remains hopeful the farming business will be able to meet her family's needs. She hopes to expand her farming business from all fronts and rely on her farming.

She says the fluctuation of market prices for farm products and generally high costs of production are her most prominent challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry for her business

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samuel is the father of 11 children, eight of whom are still in school. He has been in farming for 20 years and currently sells maize and poultry to the local market. He also works as a mason for additional income.

Samuel has requested a loan of 30000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He says poultry farming has become lucrative in the region. He is focusing on expanding his farming business by buying more acres of land.

Samuel says diseases are the worst limitation of farming income, especially with a poultry business, and this calls for proper management. He remains optimistic that the farming business will be better with the availability of Juhudi Kilimo loans.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet has been in the farming business for more than twenty years and currently employs one farmhand.  She sells her milk, maize, beans, and vegetables to the local market. She is 47 years old and married with seven children, who are aged between twenty-five and seven years. She gets some additional income from her low-cost rental houses at the local market.

Violet has made a loan request of 36,400 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. Her focus is to improve the state of her rental houses with her farming income and educate her children, five of whom are still attending school.

Violet says Juhudi Kilimo has empowered many farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en:
Dinh, 39, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a woodworker.

She has been running a shop to sell furniture for 10 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more materials to make furniture to better satisfy her customers.

Dinh hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en:
Lidya is a farmer and a mother of two children aged six years and one year. Her first born is already in school. She runs a retail shop besides her farming business. Her farm currently produces milk, maize, beans, and fruits, which are sold within the local market.

Lidya has made a loan request of 41,600 KES, which she plans to use to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes to acquire an additional two dairy cows in the near future. She is optimistic that she will be able to meet her family's basic needs with much ease.

The high cost of feed remains the major challenge for her.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Thom

texts.en:
Thom, 39, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a bricklayer. 

Thom started a grocery store 18 years ago. She sells potatoes, bitter melons, garlic, tomatoes, chilis, onions, and cabbages. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of vegetables to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Tram

texts.en:
Tram lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 31 years old and is married with a son. Her husband earns money as a worker in a local factory. She has been running a general store and selling many kinds of common medication in front of her door for 3 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her son.

Tram is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more basic products and medications to sell from her store. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more basic products and medications to sell from her store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet tiene 35 años, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 11 años. Viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de Perené- Chanchamayo.

Se dedica a la preparación de comida de todo tipo, típica, de casa, caldos, etc. Ella vende sus deliciosos platos en la feria de su ciudad. “Vendo todos los domingos de 150 a 180 platos en un día, me va muy bien”, comenta. Lo que más vende es el caldo de gallina y patasca (sopa en base a carne de res y menudencias). Pero también tiene un público que prefiere sus guisos y parrillas.
El secreto de su negocio radica en la limpieza de su puesto y la atención que les da a sus clientes, además de la buena sazón. De lunes a viernes también vende comida en la casa donde vive, pero las ganancias son menores en comparación a los domingos de ferias. 
Con esta actividad puede otorgarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Más adelante anhela construir su casa propia.

Éste es su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Por su parte se siente contenta de ser socia del grupo “Las Independientes - 2012”, porque sus compañeras son responsables.
Invertirá el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de las comidas que vende en su negocio.
texts.en:
Janet is 35 years old, single, and has two children, ages 14 and 11. They live in a rented home located in Perené District in Chanchamayo.

Janet prepares all kinds of food, traditional, home-cooked, soups, etc. She sells her delicious meals at the market in her city. “I sell from 150 to 180 meals every Sunday and it is going well.” What she sells most is chicken soup and “caldo patasca” (a soup made of beef and giblets). But she also has a public that prefers her stews and grilled dishes.

The secret to her business success has as much to do with the cleanliness of her stall and the attention to her customers as with the great flavor of her food. From Monday to Friday she also sells food at home where she lives, however she earns less compared to her earnings on Sunday market days. Her business enables her to provide her children a better quality of life. She longs to build her own home in the future.

This is Janet’s first loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. She is happy to be a member of her communal bank, “Las Independientes – 2012,” because her fellow members are responsible.

She will invest the money in the purchase of supplies and ingredients to prepare the food she sells in her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 28 and married with two children aged eight and two years. He has eight years in mixed farming, and his farm currently produces vegetables, milk, and cereals for the local market.

Timothy has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes. He says setting up an irrigation system in the farm will boost his farming income and pay for his children's education. He plans to start fish farming as well.

He laments the high cost of farmhands and farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Chung

texts.en:
Chung is a 42-year-old married woman. She lives with her three daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a driver for hire. For 10 years, she has run a general store to sell household products, personal use items, and beverages to people in her community.

Chung would like a loan to purchase better quality products at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase household products, personal use items, and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 40 years old and is married. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a gardener.

Hang runs a store to sell beverages, coffee, coconuts, and cigarettes. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of beverages in bulk to sell from her store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to use her loan to buy many kinds of beverages in bulk.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 45-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a mechanic. 

Dung has been running a shop selling hair care products for nearly 10 years. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of hair products to meet her customers' demands. She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of hair products.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a resident and a farmer in his rural home in Nkubu, Central Kenya. He is 35 and married with two children aged nine and seven years. Besides farming, he works as a mason to earn additional income.

Samson has made a loan request of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him in venturing into poultry farming.  His current farm produces cereals, bananas and yams for the local market. He plans to consistently increase his farming acreage during the next five years in order to expand his banana farming.

Samson says pests and diseases remain big challenges in his farming, coupled with the high cost of animal feed.

loans.use: To buy poultry for his business

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 44 years old. He is married and has been running a business recycling waste paper since 2008. He and his wife started this business to cover their expenses and raise two children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thao is requesting a loan to be able to expand his business and enable him to purchase, recycle, and resell a greater quantity of waste materials. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes he will be able to expand this business and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of waste materials to recycle and resell.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is single mother with 2 children. She is 28 years old and lives in Tuyabang, Oroquieta City, Philippines.

Selly has a hog fattening business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase piglets, hog grower feed, and pro starter feed.

Selly has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Selly hopes to own a piggery someday.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, hog grower, and pro starter feed.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married with six children. She is 27 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City.

Virginia sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for 27 years. Each month, she earns 5,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy fruits and vegetables.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Virginia hopes to own a house and lot.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a 50-year-old married woman with 3 children ages 15, 20 and 29. She runs a sari-sari store business in Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She sells various items like coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods and toiletries. Florencia helps provide for her family’s basic needs. She also supports her husband, who is a technician and manages a chainsaw repair shop.

Florencia is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, canned goods and toiletries. She plans to use her profit to pay for school expenses and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 39 years-old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Hellen heard about Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kalama

texts.en:
Kalama lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 26 years-old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Kalama heard about Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in Buluk. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 35 years-old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Joice heard about Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fifth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 3000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Justa

texts.en:
Justa lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years-old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Justa heard about Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married with three children. Rosalinda is 43 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

Rosalinda runs a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Levie

texts.en:
Levie is married with 3 children. She is 40 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City.

Levie sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to to purchase apples, papayas, avocados, watermelons, and bananas.

Levie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Levie hopes to expand her business and own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to purchase apples, papayas, avocados, watermelons, and bananas.

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.en:
Adelayda is married with five children. She is 58 years old and lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City.

Adelayda sells coconuts to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more coconuts for her coconut retail business.

Adelayda has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to nearby towns.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for her coconut retail business.

loans.name: Sadita

texts.es:
Sadita tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja, con quien tiene 2 hijos (de 11 y 8 años). Ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de San Ramón- Chanchamayo.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, la que ofrece y reparte a domicilio. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y sí lo considera rentable. “Dos veces al mes viajo a Lima (ciudad capital) para comprar mi mercadería”, menciona. Lo que más vende es ropa para niños y polos. Gracias al contacto directo con clientes ha podido abarcar otro tipo de negocio como es la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, y también le va bien; además de recibir las ganancias y premios por la cantidad de ventas. En este último negocio lleva 7 meses.
Uno de sus principales problemas es la falta de capital para adquirir sus productos, “por eso estamos yendo despacio, porque me gustaría abrir una tienda de ropa, pero no hay presupuesto”, menciona como una de sus más anheladas metas.

Esta es la primera vez que Sadita solicita un crédito de MFP, por lo que da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras” y se siente cómoda de tener como socias a personas solidarias.
Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de ropa, para ello viajará hasta la ciudad de Lima para adquirir los productos al por mayor.
texts.en: Sadita is 29 years old, she lives with her partner, with whom she has 2 children (who are 11 and 8 years old). They live in a rented house located in the district of San Ramón - Chanchamayo. She sells clothes for a living, which she offers and sells house to house. She has been doing this for 3 years and considers it a profitable activity. "Twice a month I travel to Lima (capital city) to purchase my merchandise", she says. The products she sells the most are children clothes and polo shirts. Thanks to the direct contact with customers she has been able to span another type of business, which is the sale beauty products through catalogs, and she also does well in this activity; in addition to making a profit, she received awards because of the amount of sales she makes. She has been doing the latter activity for 7 months. One of her main problems is the lack of capital to purchase her products. "That's why we are taking it slow, because I'd like to open a clothing store but there's no budget to do it", she mentions as one of the goals she yearns for the most. This is the first time Sadita requests MFP for a loan, reason why she promises to be on time with her repayments. She belongs to "Mujeres Trabajadoras" communal bank and feels comfortable having supportive people as partners. She will invest the requested loan money in the purchase of clothes, and in order to get them she will travel to Lima city to buy the products at wholesale.

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Liberita

texts.en:
Liberita is a married woman with four children. She has been in the business of raising hogs for ten years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP with this business. She applied for a loan to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins. This will help increase Liberita’s business profitability.

In the future, Liberita hopes to elevate the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a resident and a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya, where she lives with her family of ten children. She has been farming for twenty years and runs a retail shop besides farming. Her farm produces maize, beans, and milk.

Ester has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy poultry for a venture into poultry farming. She is venturing into poultry farming to spread her farming risks and increase her income to meet her family's basic needs.

She laments the cost of unreliable rain.

loans.use: To buy poultry for her business

loans.name: Ulpiana

texts.en:
Forty-nine-year-old Ulpiana owns and manages a sari-sari (general) store business in Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She is a married woman with six children aged between 11 and 26 years.

Ulpiana sells various items like soft drinks, spices, and canned goods. She also started raising hogs to augment her income. Ulpiana helps provide for her family’s basic needs with her income. It is also her goal to have all her children be given proper education. 

She requested a loan to buy pig feed and more items to sell such as soft drinks, toiletries, and canned goods. This will help increase Ulpiana’s sales.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more items to sell such as soft drinks, toiletries, and canned goods.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Buluk. She sells tea, and has been in business for three years. She is 27 years old, single, and has no children.  

Hellen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and tea leaves. 

She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en: Eleonora earns a living through selling charcoal and coconut vinegar. She also makes rice cakes to earn extra. Eleonora is 40 years-old and a married woman with a  two year-old child. She does her best to take care of her family and help provide for their basic needs. She requested a loan to buy more coconut shells, vinegar and ingredients to make rice cakes. She plans to renovate their house in the future.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells, vinegar and ingredients to make rice cakes.

loans.name: Erabella

texts.en: Erabella is a 41-year-old married woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She has had a sari-sari store business for four years. She sells soft drinks, canned goods, spices and toiletries. Erabella earns 6,000 PHP per month with her business. She requested a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as softdrinks and toiletries. This will help increase Erabella’s sales and profitability. In the future, Erabella hopes to expand her store and sell more kinds of products.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as softdrinks and toiletries.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Dora.  She is married, and has 3 children ages 7, 12 and 15. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the house chores.

In 2007, Dora established her patient drugs business. She began her business after graduating from nursing school to be self reliant. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,423,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Dora requires a new loan in order to improve the shop to a full drugs store. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 469,590. In the future, Dora plans to expand to a drugs store; the loan can increase the stock and maximize the profit.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for medical drugs.

loans.name: Amia

texts.en:
Amia is a 45-year-old married woman with nine children. Her husband works as a welder.

Amia sells firewood, coconut vinegar and wine to her community. She earns 2,500 PHP per month with her business. Amia works hard to improve her earnings and help buy her family’s basic needs. She requested a loan to buy more firewood and coconut wine to sell. She hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes to own a better house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja, con quien tiene un hijo de 6 años. Ella y su familia viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de San Ramón – Chanchamayo.

Se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas, lleva en este negocio cerca de medio año, gracias a los consejos que sus padres le dieron para ponerlo en marcha. “Tenía cierta desconfianza, pero sí es rentable, depende del precio que adquiera las frutas al por mayor”, menciona.
Viviana viaja constantemente hacia las parcelas de cultivos de los agricultores para comprar a menor precio. “Esta temporada es de cítricos y la venta es buena”, añade. 
Ella cuenta con un puesto de ventas en el mercado de su localidad, pero como le va bien piensa llevar su mercadería hacia otras ciudades, para ello deberá invertir más y contactarse con otros compradores, esa es una de sus metas más cercanas. 
Para el futuro, espera consolidar bien su actividad y asegurar un futuro decente para su familia, principalmente para su hijo que aún es pequeño.

Éste es la primera vez que Viviana recibe un préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, se siente a gusto con amigas que a la vez son las socias de su grupo.
Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de varias cajas de frutas (naranjas, mandarinas, piñas y papayas) para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Viviana is 29 years old, she lives with her partner with whom she has a 6 years old child. She lives with her family in a rented house located in the district of San Ramón - Chanchamayo. She sells fruits and vegetables for a living. She has had this business for about half a year, thanks to the advice her parents gave her to get it up and running. "I was a little wary, but it is profitable, it depends on the price at which I get the fruits at wholesale", she says. Viviana is constantly traveling to the farmers' orchards to buy merchandise at a lower price. "This is the season of citrus fruits and it is a good one", she adds. She has a stand at the local market, but since she is doing well she is considering taking her merchandise to other cities, reason why she will have to invest more and contact other customers, this is one of her short-term goals. For the future, she hopes to consolidate her activity properly and to secure a decent future for her family, mainly for her son who is still very young. This is the first time Viviana gets a loan from MFP, which is why she promises to be on time with her monthly repayments. She belongs to "Mujeres Trabajadoras" communal bank, and she feels comfortable with friends who are also her group partners. She will invest the loan money she is requesting in the purchase of several boxes of fruit (oranges, tangerines, pineapples and papayas) to stock up her business.

loans.use: to increase the amount of merchandise

loans.name: Osita

texts.en:
Osita is a 59-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a sari-sari store business. Osita works to provide for herself and her husband. She also desires to support her grandchildren’s studies.

Osita is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as vinegar, soft drinks and canned goods. Osita hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, such as vinegar, soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for provisions and drinks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Mary. She is divorced, and has 2 children aged 12 and 14. She has 2 additional dependents, who live with her to assist a sister. In 2004, Mary established her cooking utensils, shirts, suit cases, jeans, and shoes business. She began her business out of the need to be self reliant after being devastated by the war. 

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Mary requires a new loan in order to add to cooking utensils, shirts, suit cases, jeans, and shoes for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Mary plans to open a shop at the centre of town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for cooking utensils, shirts, suit cases, jeans and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for food and drinks.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 43 años, vive con Miguel, con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero ahora sólo tres de ellos (los de 19, 18 y 12 años) están en su poder. Todos ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de San Ramón – Chanchamayo.

Ella es una mujer que aprovecha cada momento para hacer negocio. Hace un año que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, y en este tiempo captó clientes regulares que le hacen pedidos, por eso actualmente también ofrece ropa, perfumes, joyas, zapatos, artículos de cocina y otros, todo por catálogo y de diferentes marcas. “Me va bien en este negocio y depende de cómo contacte a los clientes para que sea rentable”, comenta. También cuenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de carne de pollo, pero que no le iba tan bien como ahora.
Por otra parte, su esposo se dedica a la atención de una tienda de venta de cemento y recibe un sueldo mensual fijo. Una de sus metas es construir su casa propia y brindarle a su familia mayores comodidades.

Ésta es la primera vez que accede a un crédito de MFP, por eso confía en que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al reciente banco comunal “Mujeres trabajadoras” y espera con ansías colaborar de tal manera que el grupo crezca.
Invertirá el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de zapatos, ya que tiene pedidos urgentes.
texts.en:
Olga, 43, lives with Miguel, with whom she has four children, although only three of them (ages 19, 18, and 12) are currently in her care.  They all live in a rented house located in the district of San Ramón, Chanchamayo.

She is a woman who makes the most of every moment to do business.  Since a year ago she has sold beauty products via catalogue, and in this time she attracted regular customers who order from her.  For this reason she also currently sells clothing, perfume, jewelry, shoes, kitchen items, and other things, all through catalogues and of different brands.

"It is going well for me in this business, and for it to be profitable depends on how I get in touch with the customers," she comments.  She also says that previously she sold chicken but that it did not go as well for her as it does now.

On the other hand, her husband works in a store selling cement and receives a fixed monthly salary.  One of her goals is to build her own house and give her family greater comforts.

This is the first time she has come to MFP for a loan, and this is why she is confident she will make her monthly payments punctually.  She belongs to the recent communal bank Mujeres Trabajadoras and yearns to help in such a way that the group will grow. 

She will invest the money she is requesting now in buying shoes because she has pressing orders.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Giannina

texts.es:
Giannina tiene 29 años, es soltera y madre de dos hijos (de 11 y 8 años). Ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de Perené- Chanchamayo.

Ella es una mujer muy carismática, y  a pesar de los problemas muestra buena actitud hacia los retos que le da la vida.  Se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo; como perfumes, cosméticos, cremas faciales, joyas, y ropa. “Me gusta este trabajo porque converso con mis clientes, que a la vez son mis amigos”, menciona.
Su negocio depende de la cantidad de ventas que realice para obtener un porcentaje de las ganancias, además de obtener premios. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo son las capacitaciones constantes sobre belleza y salud, las que comparte con sus clientes.
Más adelante quisiera abrir un negocio de ropa y cosméticos en un lugar estable, para evitarse caminar demasiado. 

Éste es su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Las Independientes- 2012”y se siente alegre de tener como socias a compañeras solidarias.
Giannina invertirá el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de productos de belleza para venderlos a sus clientes que ya le hicieron pedidos.
texts.en: Giannina is 29 years old, she is single and has two children (who are 11 and 8 years old). They live in a rented house in the district of Perené - Chanchamayo. She is a very charismatic woman, and in spite of the problems that may come up she has a positive attitude to face life's challenges. She sells mail-order products for a living; such as perfumes, cosmetics, face creams, jewelry and clothes. "I like this job because I talk to my customers who are also my friends", she says. Her business depends on the amount of sales she makes, in order to get a percentage of the profits, in addition to getting prizes. What she enjoys about her work are the constant trainings in beauty and health, which she shares with her customers. In the future she would like to open a clothes and cosmetics store in a stable place, to avoid walking too much. This is her first loan with MFP, which is why she commits to be on time with her monthly repayments. She belongs to “Las Independientes - 2012” communal bank and she feels happy to have supportive fellow members as partners. Giannina will invest the money she is requesting in the purchase of beauty products in order to sell them to the customers who have already put in orders.

loans.use: to increase amount of merchandise

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 31 años, vive con Beltrán, el padre de sus 4 hijos, cuyas edades oscilan entre los 11 y 3 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Perené- Chanchamayo.

Ella es una mujer incansable y laboriosa, hace 5 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa en las ferias dominicales de su ciudad en un local que alquila para su negocio. “Me va bien, lo que más vendo son politos y pantalones”, menciona. Además, comenta que se preocupa por traer ropa bonita y a la moda, por eso vende con facilidad.
Marlene viaja constantemente hasta la ciudad de Lima (capital) para adquirir la mercadería necesaria, para ello invierte de 2000 a 3000 soles, pero que al final termina recuperando y ganando.
Y como ella no es conformista, este mes se dedicará a la agricultura en una parcela de terreno que adquirió; sembrará café y plátanos.
Uno de sus objetivos es adquirir un carro para movilizarse con mayor facilidad, ya que sus cultivos se ubican a gran distancia de su hogar.

Esta es la primera vez que Marlene accede a un crédito de MFP, por su parte menciona que pagará puntualmente las cuotas mensuales.
Invertirá todo el dinero que solicita en la compra de mercadería, es decir, ropa de todas las variedades para venderla en su puesto y en las ferias dominicales.
texts.en: Marlene is 31 years old, she lives together with Beltrán, who is the father of their 4 children, whose ages range between 3 and 11 years old. They live in a house of their own located in the district of Perené - Chanchamayo. She is a tireless and hard working woman. She has been selling clothes at her city's Sunday markets for 5 years at a stand she rents for her business. "I'm doing well, polo shirts and pants is what I sell the most", she says. Also, she mentions that she is concerned with offering pretty and fashionable clothes, which is why she sells them so easily. Marlene is constantly traveling to Lima (capital city) to acquire the merchandise she needs, she invests from 2000 to 3000 soles for that, but she ends up getting them back and making a profit. Since she is not a conformist, this month she will work in agriculture in a plot of land she acquired. She will grow coffee and bananas. One of her goals is to get a car to move with more ease, since her crops are located far away from her home. This is the first time Marlene gets an MFP loan. As far as she is concerned, she says she will be on time with her monthly repayments. She will invest all the money she is asking for in the purchase of merchandise, this is, all kinds of clothes to sell at her stand and at Sunday markets.

loans.use: to increase amount of merchandise

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 35 years old and married. She has 4 children ages 1, 6, 9, and 11. Alma’s husband works as a driver.

Alma has been in the business of raising hogs for 12 years. She is hoping to improve her piggery and acquire more piglets to grow. She applied for a loan to purchase piglets, feed, and materials for renovation. 

Alma hopes her business will grow so she can help provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and materials for renovation.

loans.name: Ma. Goretti

texts.en:
Ma. Goretti has been in the business of raising hogs for almost 8 years. She earns 6,000 PHP per month with this business. Ma. Goretti works hard to support her family, which includes her husband and 3 children. 

Ma. Goretti requested a loan to buy additional piglets, feed, and vitamins. She hopes to earn more and be able to save for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old and is married with 5 children. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Maria raises hogs for a living. She earns 4,000 PHP per month with this business. She has applied for a loan to buy pigs and feed. 

She hopes to expand her business in the future and also hopes for her family to have a more stable living.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años, tiene 3 hijos de 21, 20 y 10 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Perené- Chanchamayo.

Ella es una mujer de coraje y persistencia, hace 6 años que se separó del padre de sus hijos y lucha sola por sus 3 hijos. Desde entonces, empezó a trabajar en lo que se le presentaba, es por eso que comenzó a comprar y vender frutas. Como tenía amistades que se dedican a ese negocio se inclinó por esta actividad, y actualmente le va bien. “De lunes a viernes tengo que ir a las chacras para comprar más a menor precio”, menciona esto como uno de los secretos de su negocio.
Ella vende todos los fines de semana en un puesto de ventas en las ferias de su localidad, y ya tiene compradores regulares. 
Una de sus metas es comprarse un carro para que el mayor de sus hijos lo maneje y así pueda trasladarse con facilidad para adquirir sus productos.

Éste es su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Independientes - 2012”, y se siente contenta de tener como socias a amigas responsables.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará frutas, de todas las variedades, para venderlas en su puesto.
texts.en:
María, 40, has three children, ages 21, 20, and 10.  They all live in their own house located in the district of Perené, Chanchamayo.

She is a brave and persistent woman.  Six years ago she separated from the father of her children, and she struggles alone on behalf of her three children.  Since then, she began to work in what came up.  This is how she began to buy and sell fruit.  As she had friends who worked in this business, she opted for this work, and currently it is going well for her.  "From Monday through Friday I have to go to the farms to buy more for less," she mentions as one of the secrets of her business.  She sells every weekend in a sales stall in the markets of her town, and she already has regular customers.

One of her goals is to buy herself a car for her oldest child to drive so she can get around easily to buy her products.

This is her first loan with MFP, for which she promises to be punctual in making her monthly payments.  She belongs to the Las Independientes--2012 communal bank, and she is happy to have responsible friends as members.

With the money she is requesting now she will buy all varieties of fruit to sell in her stall.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is a 28-year-old married man with 1 child. He is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He also grows seaweed to sell. 

Alejandro works hard to provide for his family and save for his child’s future education. He applied for a loan to purchase fishing nets and repair his fishing boat. Aside from sending his child to college, Alejandro hopes to elevate his family’s standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and repair his fishing boat.

loans.name: Josè Fausto

texts.es:
José  es un hombre que tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, sin hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con sus padres. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. José vive en  el caserío Tranca Sasape del distrito de Túcume y departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica José es la crianza/venta de ganado ovinos, caprinos  y aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad José cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo también esta dedicado a la agricultura donde tiene instalado 1.0 ha. De cultivo de arroz donde   le permite tener otro ingresos
Actualmente José se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.4000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados  y pago de jornales de su cultivo instalado; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
José is a gentleman who is 35 years old, single, and has no dependent children. He lives in his own home with his parents. It should be mentioned that the quality of life in his community is subsistent. Most of the residents are independent workers who engage in trade and the breeding of small animals. Some of them also engage in agriculture. José lives in the village of Tranca Sasape in the District of Túcume, Department of Lambayeque. The only basic service available in this area is electricity and the drinking water comes from an artesian well. All of the families that reside here must live under these conditions.

José has a business that involves raising and selling sheep, goats, and poultry. The animals are kept in pens just outside of his home. José has four years of experience in this business and has been able to maintain an established customer base. He sells the animals to wholesale traders in the area. José also engages in agriculture. He has one hectare of land on which he grows corn so that he can generate additional income.

At the moment, José proposes to expand his inventory in terms of raising and selling animals since this type of business is very profitable in this area. Under these circumstances, he is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 4,000 PEN so that he can invest in the purchase of balanced feed and the payment of workers who manage his crop. Over time, this will help him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, dentro de zona urbana, localizada cerca a la capital del País. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, siempre obtiene muy buenas cosechas gracias a que ya tiene varios años de experiencia en el ámbito de la agricultura, últimamente se ha hecho de más clientela pues todo lo que cultiva y comercia Mariano es de primera calidad y todo lo vende a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es excelente; él es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo y a su familia, por eso entrega todo su esfuerzo en salir adelante, piensa que la motivación es el mejor amigo del hombre, porque ella le lleva a realizar los anhelos más profundos de su corazón, desea poder realizar esos  anhelos, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar Semilla de frijol y maíz, controles de plaga y maleza, además de renovar algunas de sus herramientas de trabajo como la cuma y azadon. Mariano perdío gran parte de su cosecha del año pasado, es por ello que ahora no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para poder continuar con su acostumbrado trabajo y espera que con el apoyo de ésta institución su deseo de regalarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida no se verá frustrado.
texts.en:
Mariano, 47 years old, lives with his life companion and their children in his own house within an urban zone located near the national capital. He cultivates corn and beans and [usually] gets good harvests, thanks to his various years of experience in agriculture. 

Lately, Mariano has gained more clientèle because everything he grows and sells is of the best quality and he sells it all at very accessible prices. In addition, his service is excellent. Mariano is a man who is dedicated to work and family. That's why he devotes all his efforts to getting ahead. He believes that motivation is a man's best friend since it helps him realize his dreams. 

For that reason, Mariano is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to purchase bean and corn seeds, and disease and weed controls, and to replace some of his manual farming tools. Last year, Mariano lost a good deal of his harvest and, for that reason, he currently lacks the necessary resources to continue with his accustomed labors. He hopes that with this institution's help, the desire to provide his family with the best quality of life will not be frustrated.

loans.use: buy bean and corn seeds, disease and weed controls, and to replace some of his farming implements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: insumos agrícolas, semillas de maíz y maicillo

loans.name: Idalia Beatriz

texts.es: Idalia Beatriz de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos hijos en casa propia en zona urbana cerca a la capital del país; ella posee un comedor en el lugar de su residencia donde vende variedad de platillos exquisitos pollo, arroz, ensaladas, sopas, entre otros, principalmente a la hora del almuerzo. Últimamente ha aumentado la demanda del negocio pues todo lo que comercia es elaborado con material de primera calidad, el lugar es muy higiénico y sobre todo los precios son muy accesibles, además el servicio es excelente atienden a las personas con mucha rapidez y siempre con una sonrisa en el rostro, la localización del mismo además ha resultado muy conveniente, pues hay muchos empleados alrededor; Idalia es una mujer muy positiva, con una moral de pago excelente, las personas dan muy buena referencia de ella, dedicada a su labor, responsable y humilde, siempre está luchando por aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que es verdaderamente exitoso aquel que desea solamente lo que es capaz de realizar y que hace lo que le agrada, con este pensamiento se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar carnes, granos básicos, verduras, condimentos, bebidas, etc y mejorar la variedad de sus comidas a fin de que sus clientes siempre esten agragados y lleguen nuevos. Idalia Beatriz tiene la confianza que así logrará darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Idalia Beatriz is thirty-nine years old and lives with her life partner and three children in her own house in an urban area near the capital of her country.  She owns a small restaurant in her home where she sells a variety of exquisite dishes like chicken, rice, salads, soups, and others, mostly at lunchtime.

Lately the demand for her business has increased because all her items are made with top quality ingredients, the space is very clean, and above all at very reasonable prices; additionally, the service is excellent, she serves people very quickly and always with a smile on her face.  The location also has proven to be quite convenient, as there are many workers all around her location.

Idalia is a very positive woman, with an exceptional sense of fairness about payments.  People give very good reports of her, that she is dedicated to her work, responsible, and humble, and she always works to take advantage of opportunities when they present themselves to her.  She thinks that she's been very successful, and what she wants is just the capacity to create, and to be able to do what makes her happy.  This thought is what decided her on soliciting a loan from INTEGRAL which would permit her to buy meats, beans and grains, vegetables, condiments, drinks, etc. and improve the variety of her menu with the end result being that her current customers would continue to appreciate her food and that new customers would arrive.  

Idalia Beatriz is confident that she will have success and give her family a life of plenty.

loans.use: to buy meats, basic grains and beans, vegetables, condiments, and drinks.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: Agripina es socia del Bancomunal  Alondras, tiene 59 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos y socia de FINCA Perú hace 16 años. Se dedica a la venta de cereales y tubérculos como maíz y papa, también vende papas rellenas. Se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado con sus ahorros  y está agradecida con la institución por todos los servicios que le brinda como es el seguro de vida, le gusta mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales y tubérculos como papa, camote, yuca, maíz, trigo para venderlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Agripina is a member of the Communal Bank "Alondras" (Larks). She is 59 years old and the mother of four children. Agripina has been with FINCA Peru for 16 years. She sells grains and tubers, including corn and potatoes. In addition, she sells stuffed potatoes. Agripina is proud of everything she has accomplished with her savings. She is grateful for all of the services FINCA has provided, such as life insurance. She greatly enjoys the training offered by her Communal Bank.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of grains and tubers. These include potatoes, sweet potatoes, cassava, corn, and wheat that she will sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy grains and tubers.

loans.name: Batmakul

texts.ru: Батмакул – лидер группы «Аалымухамбет», объединяющей еще двух женщин – участниц. Батмакул 48 лет, замужем,  имеет 5 детей. Батмакул работает сортировщицей фасоли и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для семьи,  занимается полеводством.  Начатое в 1992 году со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Батмакул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и минеральных удобрений. Доходы Батмакул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en:
Batmakul is the leader of the group "Aalymukhambet", which also comprises two other female members. Batmakul is 48 years old, married, and has five children. Batmakul works with sorting beans and as an additional source of income for her family, she is engaged in field cultivation. Having started in 1992 with a starting sum of 15,000 som (KGS), the farm now brings in around 4,000 som (KGS) per month. 

In order to further develop her business, Batmakul turned to the company "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers. Batmakul plans to invest the income in further developing her farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Djily

texts.fr: Monsieur Djily est un jeune  commerçant de 29ans qui vit dans une localité sénégalaise. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 5 ans. Il s’active dans le commerce et la vente de portables, de matériels électroniques, d’accessoires de téléphone mobiles. Il gère un local dans son quartier d’habitation, un endroit très fréquenté de la banlieue, ce qui justifie l’évolution de son activité de commerce. Il capitalise une expérience de plus de 8 ans. Il a choisi cette activité par nécessité,  dans le but de subvenir a ses besoins familiaux  et d’aider ses parents. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2011. Il sollicite un prêt de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’accessoires d’appareils portables qui seront destinés  à la vente. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité commerciale  au niveau du marché de la zone. Ainsi l’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie économique et sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Monsieur Djily is a young storekeeper, 29 years old, who lives in a Senegalese town. He is married and father of two children, whose ages vary between two and five years. He is active in business and sales of cellphones, electronics, and cellphone accessories. He runs a place in the area he lives in, a busy area of the suburbs, which justifies the evolution of his business. He takes advantage of his experience of more than eight years. He chose this business out of necessity, with the goal of providing for his family's needs and to help his parents. He has been a member of an UIMCEC branch since March 2011. He is asking for a loan of 500,000 francs, intended for the purchase of cellphone accessories which will be intended for resale. His objective is to strengthen his business in terms of his area's market. In this way, the growth of his profits will allow his to improve the economic and social conditions of his family's life.

loans.use: to buy cellphone accessories to resell.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина –участница группы «Аалымухамбет». Зарине 34 года, замужем, воспитывает 5 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, Зарина занимается животноводством.  Имея в хозяйстве 2 дойные коровы, Зарина имеет ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зарина обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы Зарина планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en:
Zarina is a member of the group "Aalymukhambet". Zarina is 34 years old, married and raising five children. As a source of income for her family, Zarina is engaged in animal husbandry. Having 2 dairy cows at the farm, Zarina gets a profit in the amount of 3,000 som (KGS) every month. 

In order to further develop her business, Zarina turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of dairy cows. Zarina plans to invest the income in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Jimmy Juvencio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

Aquí conocimos Al Señor Jimmy, tiene 42 años de edad, está  soltero, pero tiene dos hijas las mismas que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido mejorar su negocio.

Él para ganarse la vida y con esto poder salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, tiene  un pequeño puesto el mismo que instala en una de las calles de la ciudad donde muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos, trabaja allí todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 18h00, vende al contado y a veces a crédito pero solo a clientes que son muy conocidos y confiables. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene ya 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es tener un buen local en un lugar seguro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Nuevos Horizontes" (New Horizons) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

It is here that one can meet Sr. Jimmy. He is 42 years old, single, and has two grown daughters who are independent. He participated in four loan cycles with his Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because the loans have helped to improve his business.

In order to earn a living so that he can move forward, Jimmy sells clothing of all types. He has a small stand set up along one of the streets of the city where several merchants offer their products. Jimmy works every day from 8am to 6pm. He sells for cash and occasionally extends credit, but only to his most well-known and trustworthy customers. His merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil every 15 days or on a monthly basis according to what he needs. Jimmy already has 12 years of experience in this business and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing. His dream is to have a successful shop in a safe location.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Qurbonoy

texts.ru: Курбоной проживает в районе Шахринав. Ей 60 лет. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Она имеет среднее образование. Курбоной предоставляет услугу. Он уже четыре года как открыла столовую (курутобхона), где в меню национальные блюда. Кредит берет для ремонта столовой, приобретения новой посуды, столов и стульев.
texts.en:
Qurbonoy lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 60 years old and married. She has one child. She has secondary education. Qurbonoy offers a service, she opened a cafeteria four years ago, where national dishes are on the menu. 

She takes a loan for the repair of the cafeteria, purchasing new dishes, tables and chairs.

loans.use: to repair her cafeteria, purchasing new dishes, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale, thread, elastic, and needles, and to perform maintenance on her machines.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Fatou est âgée  de 35na et habite au Sénégal. Elle pratique depuis 10 ans l’activité de commerce et vend des tissus. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi pour subvenir à ses besoins personnels et aussi aider ses parents. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2012. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 qui lui permettra d’acheter des  tissus qui seront  destinés a renforcer son stock. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer son niveau de vie économique et social.
texts.en: Mademoiselle Fatou is 35 years old and lives in Senegal. She has practiced the business of fabric sales for ten years. It is a business that she chose to meet her personal needs and also to help her parents. She has been a member of an UIMCEC branch since March 2012. She is seeking a loan of 400,000 francs, which will allow her to buy fabric that will be used to reinforce her stock. The increase of her profits will allow her to increase her standard of living economically and socially.

loans.use: to buy fabric to resell.

loans.name: Ana Delmi

texts.es: Ana Delmi de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y dos hijas en casa propia dentro de zona urbana a pocos kilómetros de la capital del país. Ella se dedica a la venta de huevos, pollo y embutidos desde hace varios años, negocio que logra abastecer con el apoyo de su esposo dado que trabaja en una de las avícolas principales del país; además posee en su misma casa una salón de belleza y prepara pasteles por encargo, realmente es una mujer que disfruta estar ocupada, ser útil a la sociedad, todos sus negocios van muy bien, pues una mujer con una enorme capacidad de administrar y ha logrado que aumenten sus ventas en todos ellos; ahora desea instalar una venta de paletas de sabores heladas y sorbetes y para ello necesita un freezer o congelador, además de paletas, sorbetes y mercadería que no posea,  es por ellos que se encuentra solicitando el apoyo de INTEGRAL a fin de continuar dando esos pequeños pasos que espera en el futuro la hagan coronar todas sus grandes aspiraciones que estan inspiradas en su familia
texts.en:
Ana Delmi is 42 and lives with her domestic partner and her two girls in their own house in an urban area a few kilometers from the capital. For several years, she has sold eggs, chicken, and sausages, a business she stocks with the help of her husband, who works at one of the country's largest poultry farms. She also has a beauty shop in her home and makes pastries to order. She loves to be busy and a useful member of the community. 

All of her businesses are doing well and have seen sales increases because she has great management skills. Now she wishes to sell ice-pops and sherbets and needs a freezer, in addition to these products. She is asking for help from INTEGRAL so that she can keep taking those small steps that she hopes will culminate in the fulfillment of her family's big dreams.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, ice-pops, sherbets, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr:
Ablaye est un homme marié. Il est père de six enfants dont les trois fréquentent l'école.Depuis son jeune âge,il pratique l'agriculture. Il emmener souvent aussi les vaches dans la brousse , à la recherche de pâturage.
Il cultive dans son village des terres et produit chaque année du mil et de l'arachide dont une bonne partie est destinée à la consommation.Pour avoir des ressources financières, il achète des bœufs qu'il engraisse et revend au bout de quelques mois.Ces deux activités lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins d'entretien de sa famille et à ses propres besoins. Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter deux bœufs. Son ambition est de se lancer dans les cultures maraîchères et fruitières.
texts.en:
Ablaye is a married man. He is the father of six children, three of whom attend school. Since he was young he has worked in agriculture. He often also brings cows into the bush, looking for somewhere for them to graze.
In his village he cultivates land and each year grows millet and groundnuts, a good part of which are destined for consumption. To have financial resources, he buys cows which he fattens and resells after a few months. These two businesses allow him to provide for his needs and those of his family. Today, he is seeking a loan of 400,000 francs to buy two cows. His ambition is to get starting in truck farming and fruit farming.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Marthline

texts.en: Marthline  lives in Sinkor.  She is 32 years old and  single with one child, age 4 that lives at home and is in school. Marthline has been running  a table in the market where she sells rice, peppers, bitter ball, (an eggplant-like vegetable), vita (a drink like coca-cola) and others items. She started this business with the help from her father and learned this way of selling from him. She likes her business because it gives her profits and is popular. Marthline is requesting a loan to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, vita, and others items for her business. She want to get more money to build her house since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, vita, and others items for her business

loans.name: Kholé

texts.fr: Kholé est un jeune, marié et père de trois filles.Depuis qu'il a arrêté ses études, il se consacre à l'agriculture et l'élevage.Il cultive le mil, le haricot qui sont destinés à la consommation. Il pratique aussi des cultures destinées à la vente comme l'arachide, l'oseille et le melon.En saison sèche, dés le mois de janvier, il démarre ses activités d'élevage en achetant des bœufs qu'il engraisse et revend.Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettent de payer les frais de scolarités de ses enfants et de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Afin de renforcer ses capacités, il sollicite un pret de 450000f pour acheter 1 bœuf et 4 moutons.Son ambition est de construire une ferme pour y pratiquer son activité d'élevage.
texts.en: Kholé is a young man, married and father of three daughters. Ever since he stopped his studies, he has devoted himself to agriculture and livestock rearing. He cultivates millet and beans, destined for consumption. He also cultivates other crops to be sold, such as groundnuts, sorrel, and melons. During the dry season, beginning in the month of January, he starts his livestock business by buying cows which he fattens and resells. The profits from this business allow him to pay his children's school fees and to take care of the household expenses. In order to strengthen his capabilities, he is seeking a loan of 450,000 francs to buy one cow and four sheep. His ambition is to build a farm on which to run his livestock business.

loans.use: to buy one cow and four sheep.

loans.name: Massa J.

texts.en: Massa lives in Sinkor.  She is 29 years old , single and has a child, age 13 who is in school and lives at home. Massa is a high school  graduate.  She has been selling charcoal in the local market and is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to expand her business since she has more customers.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Rakie N.

texts.en: Rakie  is 30 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is a high school graduate, and single. For three years she been selling charcoal in her community. She faces some problems in the rainy season because she doesn’t have a good storeroom for the charcoal.  Rakie  is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.  Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es socia del Bancomunal Alondras, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años. Se dedica a la venta de artesanía como tejidos y bordados, ella se siente orgullosa con todo lo que ha logrado con sus ahorros, le gusta mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal porque ahí aprendió  a invertir de manera correcta su dinero y a practicar los valores. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para elaborar artesanías como los hilos de tejido y tintes.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Communal Bank "Alondras" (Larks). She is 36 years old and the mother of two children. Vilma has been with FINCA Peru for two years. She sells handicrafts, such as woven goods and embroideries. Vilma is proud of everything she has accomplished with her savings. She greatly enjoys the training classes offered by her Communal Bank because they have taught her how to invest her money properly and how to put her values into practice.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of materials for making handicrafts, such as thread for weaving and dyes.

loans.use: to buy thread and dyes.

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en:
Arcadia is a food vendor from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 59 years old, married and has 7 children. Her husband is a farmer.

Arcadia mostly makes rice cakes to sell to her community. She said she prepares her ingredients at night and wakes up very early to make rice cakes. Arcadia does her best to support her family. She requested a loan to buy more ingredients and containers. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and containers

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a 47-year-old married woman with 3 children ages 16, 18 and 20. Her husband is a farmer.

Bibiana buys and sells bananas and yams in her community. She earns 2,000 PHP per month. She hopes for her income to improve so she could help more with her children’s education. She requested a loan to buy more bananas and yams to sell. This will help increase her sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and yams to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motor for his bus.

loans.name: Muzuri Group

texts.fr:
Henry fait partie du groupe Muzuri et habite à Rumonge, commune sous la supervision de la branche de Bujumbura. Il  a 34 ans et est marié à Claudine, une enseignante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants, âgés de 2  à 3 ans.
Il  prend soin de  ses 3 petits  frères, dont l’un étudie.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (savons, sel, haricot,..) depuis  3 ans. 

C’est  son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter des  articles de sa boutiques (savons, sel, haricot,..,) et des poissons(ndagara)à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait faire le commerce d’importation des habits et des chaussures.
texts.en:
Henry is part of the Muzuri group and lives in Rumonge, a commune under the supervision of Bujumbura. He is 34 years old and is married to Claudine, a teacher. Together they have two children, two and three years old.
He takes care of his three little brothers, one of whom is studying.
He has run a store, selling soap, salt, and beans, for three years.
This is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that he receives, he will increase his capital and buy items for his store (soap, salt, and beans) and ndagara fish to resell to earn more.
In the coming years, he would like to do business importing clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to increase his capital and to buy store items (soaps, salt, beans) and ndagara fish to resell to earn more.

loans.name: Bonna

texts.en:
Bonna is 30 years old and is a married woman with a 3-year-old child. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Bonna started her sari-sari (convenience) store business a year ago. She sells items like snacks and detergent soap. Bonna hopes to expand her store.  She requested a loan to purchase wood and more items to sell. Bonna hopes for her business to grow, and for her to save for her child’s future education.

loans.use: to purchase wood and more items to sell

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a married woman with 4 adult children. Her husband is a farmer. Dioscora owns and manages a sari-sari (convenience) store in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells soft drinks, snacks and canned foods.

Dioscora works hard to help sustain her family and improve their living. She requested a loan to buy more soft drinks and canned foods. Dioscora hopes to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and canned foods

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 50 years old and is a married woman with 7 children aged between 13 and 32 years. Her husband is a fisherman.

Esterlita has a sari-sari (convenience) store business. She sells various items like spices, powdered milk and juice, and snacks. Esterlita earns 6,000 PHP per month with her business.

She requested this loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, feed and salt. Esterlita hopes for her family to have a more stable living.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, feed and salt

loans.name: Wupa

texts.en:
Wupa is a 45-year-old mother of four. She is a licensed educator who worked as a substitute teacher. Since there were no permanent teaching positions available in her area, Wupa decided to open a home-based childcare center. She is expanding the center to provide after-school care as well. Wupa wants to offer pickup and drop off service for the children and to add a sandbox and play area to her backyard.

Wupa needed this loan to purchase material for the backyard and upgrade her car to be able to transport children.

Wupa wants to continue to provide top quality care and double the number of children in her childcare business.

loans.use: To purchase material for the backyard and upgrade her car

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara is a single mother from northern Israel. She decided to earn a decent living for her family and develop a profession she loves. Zahara took training and certification courses in hair styling and makeup artistry. After opening a business activity, gaining experience, developing a strong customer base and reputation, Zahara has decided to expand her enterprise.

Zahara needed this loan to purchase mirrors, a hair styling station, a closet, shelving and hair styling supplies.

Zahara is continuing to take professional courses and receive business consultation. She wants one day to expand her business and specialize into a bridal salon.

loans.use: To purchase mirrors, a hair styling station, a closet, shelving and hair styling supplies.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 37-year-old mother of five from Yafiya, near Nazareth. Manal is a determined, dedicated woman who works to ensure her family has a strong future. Last year, she began cutting and styling hair and with the help of her husband, her business activity has expanded and grown. In order to expand and develop her business into a steady income, Manal is renovating an area and upgrading her services.

She needed this loan to assist with paying for renovations & remodeling of her salon, bathroom fixtures and upgrades, an air conditioner, a solar water heater, flooring, cosmetic supplies & treatments.

Manal wants to see her business serve women from her village and the surrounding area. She wants to continue to invest her time and energy into the development of a successful salon.

loans.use: To pay for renovations & remodeling of her salon, bathroom fixtures and upgrades, an air conditioner, a solar water heater, flooring, cosmetic supplies & treatments.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn has had a sari-sari store business for almost four years. She sells items like sugar, salt, vinegar and toiletries. Jenilyn’s income goes to her family’s basic needs. She finds difficulty in replenishing her merchandise rapidly and hopes to have more capital for her business.

Jenilyn has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as gasoline and canned foods. She hopes for her business to be progressive.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as gasoline and canned foods

loans.name: Josefa
