Con mucho entusiasmo Katherine trabajo en su negocio de alquiler de mototaxi, ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 4 horas al día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Katherine está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su mototaxi, con esta mejora ella podrá tener un vehículo en buen estado y mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena calidad de vida a su hijo y una buena educación”.
texts.en:
Katherine is a hardworking and happy woman. She is a single mother of a three-month-old infant. The infant’s father separated from her. Katherine works really hard in order to progress and have a good and happy life. She lives in the Parcona district. The Parcona district is known for its agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, and for the generosity of its people. When Katherine has free time she likes to watch television and play with her baby. She also likes to make one of her favorite dishes, which is the delicious dish called “Tallarine Rojos” (Red Casserolle). She was only able to finish fifth grade but would really like to be a nurse.
Katherine, with much enthusiasm, is a chauffer of a mototaxi. She works at this business four hours a day. She thinks that her business is going well. She is very friendly with her customers.
Katherine is very grateful for the loans from KIVA. Thanks to the assistance, she is able to maintain her mototaxi. She can keep the mototaxi in good working order and increase her earnings. She is able to continue to work in order to achieve her dreams of giving a good quality of life and a good education to her son.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Miriam Aguedita

texts.es:
Miriam   es una mujer que tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Miriam vive en  el distrito de Cayalti, departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuentan con  todos los  servicio  básico;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Miriam es la crianza/venta de  aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Miriam cuenta con 11 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge  le apoyan en esta actividad.
Actualmente Miriam se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/ 1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la  compra de alimentos balanceados y arreglo de corrales, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam is 43 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children in her charge. She lives in her own house with her husband and her children. She says that the quality of life in her community is that of subsistence. The majority of the residents are independent workers that sell and raise small animals and some of them also work in agriculture. Miriam lives in the district of Cayaltí, in the department of Lambayeque. She has all of the basic utility services. All of the families in the area live with these conditions. 

The commercial activity that Miriam works in is raising and selling domestic fowl. She raises them in corrals outside her house. Miriam has had 11 years of experience, which has allowed her to maintain her established clients in this business. She sells her animals to the wholesalers in the area. Her husband helps her in her business.

Miriam is currently proposing to increase the number of animals she raises and sells because this is a very profitable business in the area. This is why she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 nuevos soles (PEN), which will be used to buy feed and fix her corrals. Over time, this will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed for fattening her animals and to fix her corrals

loans.name: Gillem

texts.en:
Gillem is 44 years old and married with four children.

Gillem works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa (woven palm mats) retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Gillem has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa (woven palm mats) retail business for eight years and also earns an income from fish pond operations.

Gillem aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell for her nipa (woven palm mats) business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 48 años, vive junto a Silvestre, su esposo. Tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con uno de ellos, Edwin, al que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Pampa Blanca. 

La actividad que más le agrada es la ganadería, cuenta con 6 vacas, y todas las mañanas su principal actividad es la venta de la leche que producen a los pobladores de su localidad. Sus clientes ya conocen del exquisito sabor que tiene esa leche, por ello obtiene buenas ganancias diarias que le ayudan a sustentar las necesidades de su familia. 
Así también, siembra papa, olluco, habas y otros productos. Sus parcelas se encuentran en la parte alta de la comunidad, por ello tiene que viajar muchas horas en burro para poder llegar hasta allá. A pesar de ello, le gusta trabajar, por eso obtiene excelentes cosechas, como ella dice “lo que resulta de mucho esfuerzo, es mucho mejor”. Ahora se encuentra cosechando maíz, y asegura ya tiene comprador, pues es una mujer con mucho empuje y coraje. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pampa Blanca” y éste es el crédito número 8 que tiene con MFP, donde se siente feliz, ya que tiene muchos años trabajando con su grupos, donde todos son personas que se ayudan unos a otros.
Martha invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de maíz, que dentro de unos días sembrará.
texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old. She has five children, but only one of them, Edwin, lives with her. She owns her own house, which is located in a place called Pampa Blanca.
She has six milk cows. Every morning she sells their milk to the people in her area. Her customers are appreciative of the delicious flavor of her milk. For this she gets a good daily income that helps her meet the daily necessities for her family.
She also grows potatoes, beans and other products. She has her agricultural land in the higher parts of the community. She has to travel many hours on a donkey to reach these fields. In spite of this, she likes the work. She has good harvests. She says, “Better products come from hard work.” Now she is growing corn and she will surely have buyers for her crop. She is a hardworking and courageous woman.
Martha belongs to the “Pampa Blanca” (White Grass) Community Bank. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She is happy for this, as she has been working many years with groups where one person helps another.
Martha will use the money for this loan to buy natural fertilizers to disperse between her corn crops, which she will plant in a few days.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 53 years old and married with 13 children. With six children in school, Melba works very hard to provide for them.

Melba runs a business buying and selling pigs in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more pigs to sell.  She has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Melba would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to sell.

loans.name: Mera

texts.en:
Mera is 56 years old and married with one child.

Mera works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa (woven palm mats) retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Mera has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa (woven palm mats) retail business for eight years and also earns an income from farming nipa.

Mera aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda is 62 years old and married.

Daylinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Daylinda has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for 10 years and also earns an income from charcoal retail.

Daylinda aspires to save money and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Aida has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from charcoal retail.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Betty requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish for her business.

She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Betty would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Delyn

texts.en:
Delyn is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Delyn is 31 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Delyn has a business buying and selling of fish in the Philippines. Delyn requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Delyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children. 

To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as sugar, bread, soap, shampoo, noodles, juice packs, and sardines in the local community. She has had her business for 12 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from this activity. 

In 2009, Sophia joined GDMPC. Sophia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and widowed with 3 children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa (woven palm mats) retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the nipa (woven palm mats) business for 15 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Josephine aspires to save enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell in her vegetables vending business.

Gloria has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from farming vegetables and selling spices.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 35 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Sabino, con quien tiene 2 hijos pequeños que cuida y educa con mucho amor.  

Desde que ere muy pequeña fue adquiriendo todos los conocimientos que haría que en la actualidad se dedique a ser agricultora. Cuenta muy contenta, que pasa la mayor parte de su día en el campo, entre cerros, praderas y ríos. Gusta del aire del campo y del trabajo que realiza, sus principales sembríos constan de maíz, papa, trigo y otros tubérculos. Los comercializa en sus mismos terrenos agrícolas, pues ya tiene clientes que siempre llagan en la temporada de cosecha. Pero como es una mujer muy inteligente, también se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacas, ovejas y cerdos; “al engordar los animales, puedes venderlos a un mayor precio en cualquier momento”, comenta. De esa manera posee ingresos constantes para su hogar y no pasa por apuros económicos. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pampa Blanca” y éste es el crédito número 5 con MFP, donde se siente feliz, ya que tiene muchos años trabajando con su grupo, pues los integrantes son personas con muchas ganas de ayudarse entre ellos.
Yolanda invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de un becerro pequeño de raza para que pueda mejorar su ganado.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 35 years old. She lives in her own house, along wither husband, Sabino. They have 2 small children, who they care for and raise with much love. 

From the time she was very young she learned the skills she would need for her present life as a farmer. She says that she is very content and that she spends most of the day in the countryside, among hills, prairies, and rivers. She likes the air in the countryside and the work that she does. Her main crops are corn, potatoes, wheat, and other tuber crops. She sells them from her own land because she has customers who always come at harvest time. Because she is a very intelligent woman, she also raises animals such as cows, sheep, and pigs. “When the animals are fattened, you can sell them at any time for a good price,” she explains. In this way, she has consistent income for her household and they don’t have economically difficult times.

She belongs to the “Pampa Blanca” communal bank and this is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She feels happy because she has been working with her group for several years and the members are people who always want to help each other out.

Yolanda will use the requested money to buy a young purebred ram so that she can improve her herd.

loans.use: to buy a ram

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is a 49-year-old widow with one child who is in school.  Rema works very hard to provide for her family.

Rema runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, snack foods, etc. 

In the future Rema would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buying and selling banana business in the Philippines.

Isabelita has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Isabelita has been in this business for the past thirty years.

In the future, Isabelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married with 8 children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. Elizabeth manages a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years and every month she earns 3,630 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,800 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service. Elizabeth has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to be able to provide for her children to finish their studies and double her business income.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Ma. Marina

texts.en:
Ma. Marina is thirty-seven years old and married with four children.

Ma. Marina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Ma. Marina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for the past two years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Ma. Marina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Almakan

texts.ru: Алмакан –участница группы «Аалымухамбет». Алмакан 61 год, вдова, воспитала 6 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, Алмакан занимается животноводством.  Имея в хозяйстве 1 дойную корову, Алмакан имеет ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 1,800 сом (KGS) с продажи молока. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алмакан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы Алмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Almakan is a member of the Aalymukhambet group. Almakan is 61 years old. She is a widow and has brought up six children. In order to support her family, Almakan raises livestock. She has one dairy cow, and earns a monthly income of 1800 from selling milk. In order to develop her business further, Almakan applied to “Bai Tushum & Partner”s for a loan of 50,000 KGS for the purchase of a dairy cow. Almakan plans to invest her revenues in a further expansion of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Jhohans Hervert

texts.es:
Jhohans es un joven muy trabajador, vive en el distrito de Parcona, el distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón y por la generosidad de sus pobladores. Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigo y vecinos de su barrio, también le gusta comer y sobre todo su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería de sistemas.

Con mucho entusiasmo Jhohans trabaja en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, el se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy coqueto, amable y sobre todo respetuoso con los clientes.

Jhohans está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento y reparación a su vehículo, así el tendrá un vehículo en buen estado y manejara con mas seguridad, así el podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una mejor calidad de Vida”.
texts.en:
Jhohans is a hardworking young man and lives in the district of Parcona. Parcona is characterized by agriculture, particularly cotton cultivation, and by the generosity of its people. When he has a little time off, he likes to play football with his friends and neighbors in his neighborhood, also likes to eat - his favorite dish is the delicious "Arroz con Pato" (duck rice). He only has a secondary school education, but he would have liked to study systems engineering.

Jhohans enthusiastically working on his business as a motorcycle taxi drive. He works about 10 hours a day and can serve up to 40 clients per day. He believes that his business is doing well because he is charming, friendly and above all he respects his customers.

Jhohans is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to their help he will be able to carry out maintenance and repairs to his vehicle, improving its condition and security, so that he can keep working and fighting to achieve his greatest dream: "To have a better quality of life."

loans.use: to maintain and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Salomòn

texts.es:
Salomón  es un hombre que tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con tres hijos a su cargo, vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Salomón vive en  el caserío San Miguel Alto, distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuentan con el  servicio  básico de luz eléctrica, el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de una pileta comunal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Salomón es la crianza/venta de ovinos, porcinos y  aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Salomón cuenta con 6 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge  le apoyan en esta actividad.
Actualmente Salomón se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/ 1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la  compra de animales, alimentos balanceados y arreglo de corrales, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Salomón, 31, lives with his partner and their three dependent children in their own house. The economy in their community is based on subsistence agriculture. Most residents are self-employed, as traders or working with small animal husbandry. Some are also involved in agriculture. 
Salomón lives in the village of San Miguel Alto, Tambogrande district, in the administrative division of Piura. He has basic electricity services, and collects consumable water from a communal well. All of the families who live there live in these conditions.

Salomón breeds and sells sheep, pigs and poultry. He breeds these animals in pens outside his home. He has 6 years experience in this trade, which has allowed him to keep his established clientele. He sells his animals to wholesalers in the area. His partner also supports him in his business.

Salomón is currently proposing to expand his inventory, as raising and selling animals is a very profitable activity in the area. Therefore, he is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount 1,500 soles which will be used to buy animals and feed, and to fix up the pens. In time this will allow him to continue to improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase animals and animal feed, and to maintain their pens

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 35 años, vive en compañía de Feliciano, su esposo, desde hace 20 años. Tienen 4 hijos pequeños, a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Pampa Blanca.  

En la temporada de siembra y cosecha pasa sus días en la localidad de Andamarca, donde tiene sus propios terrenos agrícolas, en ese tiempo se interna en el campo, pues ahí comenzará a preparar los frutos que venderá dentro de 9 meses aproximadamente. Pero como el lugar es muy lejano, también alquila otros terrenos cercanos a su casa para sembrar; “de esa manera tengo mayor facilidad de cuidarlos y comercializarlos”, afirma. 
La otra actividad de Rosa es la compra y venta de alimentos, su trabajo consiste en la compra de  los productos de otros agricultores, los traslada al mercado mayorista de la ciudad y los vende a un precio mayor entre los minoristas. Con ello obtiene buenas ganancias, siendo su principal actividad económica y espera ahorrar lo necesario para poder obtener mayor capital para negociar. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pampa Blanca” y éste es el crédito número 8 que tiene con MFP, donde se siente feliz, ya que tiene muchos años trabajando con su grupo. Sus compañeros son personas con muchas ganas de ayudarse entre ellos.
Rosa invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias cosechas de maíz para comercializarlas en el mercado de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old. She lives with her husband of twenty years, Feliciano. She has four small children who she cares for in their own house located in the town of Pampa Blanca (White Grass). 
In the time of planting and harvesting she spends her days in the Andamarca area, where she has her agricultural lands. During this time they stay near the fields, where they prepare the fruits that they will sell in nine months. Since these fields are far away, they also rent other fields close to their house. This is how they can easily grow their crops and sell them. 
Rosa also buys and sells food items. She buys food products from other farmers and takes them to the market in the city. She sells the items at wholesale prices among the retail items. She makes a good income doing this. This is her primary economic activity. With this activity she hopes to save the most money to use for her working capital.
She belongs to the “Pampa Blanca” Community Bank. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She is happy for this opportunity and she has been working with this group for many years. Her companions are people with a great desire to help others. Rosa will invest the money she requests in order to buy corn to sell in the market of her city.

loans.use: to increase the merchandise that she sells.

loans.name: Diome

texts.fr:
Diome est un homme d'un âge assez avancé.Il est marié à deux épouses avec lesquelles il a eu neufs enfants.Malgré son âge , il reste encore actif et pratique l'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine. Il achète à l'intérieur du pays des bœufs à bon prix et les revend après les avoir engraissé  pendant 4 mois.Cette activité lui permet de soutenir ses enfants et ses petits fils et aussi de subvenir à certains de ses besoins.
Afin de réaliser une nouvelle opération d'embouche , il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter 2 boeufs.Il compte transférer les connaissances acquises dans cette activité à l'un de ses petits fils qui s'y intéresse beaucoup.
texts.en:
Diome is an older man. He is married to two wives, with whom he has nine children. In spite of his age, he remains active and raises livestock,  particularly cattle. He buys  bulls in the interior parts of the country, at a good price, fattens them for four months and then resells. This business activity allows him to support his children and grand children and also provide for some personal needs.

In order to start a new cattle cycle, he is seeking a loan of 30,000 West African Francs in order to buy two bulls. He plans to teach his trade to one of his grandchildren, who has a lot of interest in this work.

loans.use: to buy two bulls.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Helen has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from a sari-sari store.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is forty years old and married with three children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Lilia has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income raising pigs.

Lilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina works hard to support her family. Marlina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marlina is borrowing PHP 4,100 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Marlina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 50 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Romana is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Romana has been buying and selling livestock for 4 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy farmland for farming sugarcane.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie is 37 years old and married with 5 children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Vangie is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Vangie has been buying and selling livestock for 4 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
Jose es un joven muy trabajador, vive en el distrito de Parcona, el distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón y por la generosidad de sus pobladores. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear para distraerse y sobre todo para despejar el mal humor, asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es “Arroz Chaufa”. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Derecho.

Día a día Jose sale a trabajar en su negocio como chofer de taxi, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo que hay mucha necesidad de movilizarse en su barrio.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo y asimismo comprar llantas y sobre todo reparar el motor de su vehículo, con esta mejora tendrá un vehículo más seguro y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, así el seguirá luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una agencia de transporte”.
texts.en:
Jose is a hardworking young man and lives in the district of Parcona. Parcona is characterized by agriculture, particularly cotton cultivation, and the generosity of its people. When he has some spare time he enjoys going for a walk to distract himself, and especially to clear any bad moods. He also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes which is “Arroz Chaufa”  (fried rice). He has only had a secondary education, but he would have liked to study law.

Every day, Jose works in his business as a taxi driver. He works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 30 clients per day. He believes that his business is doing well because he is very friendly, and above all there is a great need for transportation in his neighborhood.

Jose is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to their help he can carry out general maintenance on his vehicle and also purchase tires and repair his vehicle's engine. With this upgrade, he will have a safer vehicle and can improve his income. He will continue every day to fulfill his greatest dream: "Having my own transport agency."

loans.use: to maintain his vehical, purchase tires and repair the engine.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es:
Zacarías   es un hombre que tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con tres hijos a su cargo, vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Zacarías  vive en  el caserío Caracucho, distrito de Mòrrope,  departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuentan con el  servicio  básico de luz eléctrica, el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de una pileta comunal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Salomón es la crianza/venta de ovinos, porcinos y  aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Salomón cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; el vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge  le apoyan en esta actividad.
Actualmente Zacarías se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/ 3000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la  compra de AGROQUÌMICOS, esto debido a que tambien conoce del negocio, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Zacarias is a 37 year old man. He is married with three dependent children. He lives in a house that he owns with his wife and children. The people in his community live at a subsistence level. The majority of the residents are independent workers who raise and sell young animals or work in agriculture. Zacarias lives in the Caracucho neighborhood, in the Morrope District, in the Lambayeque Department. He has electric lights. He gets his water from a community well. All the families in his community live under these conditions.
Zacarias works raising and selling sheep, pigs and poultry. He raises them in pens outside of his house. He has been doing this for the past four years. He has been able to maintain his customer base. He sells his animals to commercial wholesalers in the area. His wife helps him with his work.
Actually, Zacarias would like to increase the number of animals that he raises and sells. His business is very profitable in his area. This is why he is requesting this new loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3000 new soles. He will use this loan to buy agricultural chemicals. This will help his business, which will permit him to raise the standard of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Maria Miguelina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Miguelina esta soltera, tiene 21 años de edad, cursó su educación universitaria, se dedica al comercio de perfume por catalogo, inicio este negocio por iniciativa propia y lleva 5 años de experiencia. 

Solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de perfumes, y tener un negocio con mas productos y mas surtido, espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Miguelina is single, 21 years old and is studying at the university. She sells perfume from a catalogue. She started this business on her own initiative and has been doing this for the past five years.
She is requesting this loan in order to buy perfume and to have a business with a greater variety of products. She hopes to have a larger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Pilar Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Sultana se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Pilar, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad que  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella para ganar algo de dinero y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio al igual que el esposo,  se dedican a la venta de ropa, ella tiene  un pequeño puesto en una de las calles de la ciudad conocida como La Bahía, lugar donde muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos, allí instala un pequeño puesto donde ofrece sus productos en su mayoría ropa interior que es lo que más vende, allí trabaja  todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 18h00. Ella con su esposo viajan hasta Guayaquil a surtirse de mercadería o si no también les llevan ciertos comerciantes al por mayor. Tiene ya 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior de todo tipo y genero. Lleva más de 13 años en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de pagos del grupo y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un local más grande para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The village bank La Sultana meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, a place known as the Sultan of Coffee for the extensive coffee crop with an incomparable taste, and also recognized for the cuisine and the warmth of the people.

Here we meet Pilar, 37, who is married and has two children, ages 4 and 8, both of whom are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

To earn money and help her husband with the household expenses she also is a merchant, selling clothing. She has a small stall on one of the streets in the city called La Bahia, where many merchants offer their goods. There she offers her products, mostly lingerie, which is her best selling item. She works there every day from 8am to 6pm. She and her husband travel to Guayaquil to stock up on merchandise, and also have some vendors who come to them with wholesale products. She has been in this business for 6 years and it's going very well.

This loan will be used to buy all types of undergarments/lingerie for men and women. She has been in the village bank for 13 years, and is the treasurer of the group. She likes it because of the help that the loans give her.

Her dream is to have a bigger store to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy lingerie.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama est un agriculteur qui pratique aussi l'élevage.Il a hérité des terres de son père et les exploite avec ses cinq enfants.La production est surtout destinée à la consommation. Pour avoir des ressources financières, Adama pratique en même temps l'embouche bovine bovine qui consiste à acheter des bœufs, à les engraisser pendant quelques mois et à les revendre. Afin de faire une nouvelle opération d'embouche, il sollicite un pret de 250 000f pour acheter 2 bœufs. Son ambition est de toujours augmenter le nombre d'unités d'embouche.
texts.en: Adama is a farmer who also raises livestock.  He has inherited his land from his father and works on it with his five children.  His agricultural output essentially goes to consumption.  In order to make more money, Adama also fattens up cattle: he buys oxen, fattens them up for a few months and then resells them.  As he would like to start fattening cattle again, Adama is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs for the purchase of two oxen.  His ambition is to keep on increasing his number of cattle for fattening up.

loans.use: to buy two oxen.

loans.name: Jacinta Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta Tomasa esta casada, tiene 52 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduria de fajas tipicas, inicio este negocio por iniciativa propia y hasta el momento lleva 35 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Solicita un prestamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y clases, para mejorar su produccion, espera seguir prosperando en el negocio que realiza.
texts.en:
52-year-old Jacinta Tomasa is married with two children, one of whom is studying. She completed 3 years of primary education. Jacinta Tomasa has a business weaving traditional belts. She started this business on her own initiative and so far has 35 years of experience. She has the support of her husband, who is a trader.

She is applying for a loan which she will use to purchase yarns of different colors and types, to improve her production. She hopes to continue to prosper in her business.

loans.use: to purchase threads for weaving traditional belts

loans.name: Bertha Cleotilde

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Sultana se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bertha, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 20, 10 y 5 años de edad, los tres estudian en universidad y escuela los menores, su hija mayor ya está comprometida y ya es independiente. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad hace varios años y en la actualidad tiene un pequeño bazar y taller de costura en su casa, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa y vender sus productos de bazar, además también los fines de semana prepara comida para fiestas o recepciones que se organizan en la ciudad y que la buscan ya que ella cocina delicioso ya que también tiene un titulo de chef profesional, nos cuenta que todos los fines de semana tiene contratos para fiestas, además también en ocasiones cuando no tiene muchas costuras ella se desplaza a otras ciudades a vender artículos de bazar, nos cuenta que ella realiza muchas actividades para salir adelante y que en esto último su esposo le ayuda ya que se van en el carro del esposo a recorrer estos lugares, lleva más de 12 años dedicada a sus actividades comerciales.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, materiales para la costura, víveres y  artículos de bazar. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es comprarse un carro para ella.
texts.en:
La Sultana Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the town of Jipijapa, a place known for its extensive cultivation of coffee beans. The coffee beans have an incomparable taste. The town is also known for its food and the warmth of its people. Here lives Bertha, 40 years old, married, with three children ages 20, 10 and 5. The oldest child studies at the university and the younger ones at primary school. Her oldest daughter is independent and engaged. Bertha’s husband is a chauffer.
Bertha learned sewing and tailoring at a local academy many years ago. She has a small dress and tailor shop in her house.  Here she sews all types of clothes and she sells her products in the store. On the weekends she makes food for parties or receptions that they organize in the city. Her clients say that what she makes is delicious as she is also a professional chef. Every weekend she has contracts to make food for parties. Also, when she doesn’t have much sewing work, she goes to neighboring cities to sell her products at the bazaar. She does a lot of activities in order to progress. Her husband helps her as he takes her to her destinations in his car. She has been doing these activities for the past twelve years.
This new loan will be used to buy fabric, materials needed for dressmaking, fresh food and items for the bazaar. She has been a member of the community bank since it began and she likes it because she began her business with her first loan from this institution.
Her dream is to buy her own car.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sewing materials, fresh food and items for the bazaar.

loans.name: Mane

texts.fr: Mane est un femme mariée. Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont deux fréquentent l'école primaire.Depuis son mariage, il y a 15 ans, elle s'occupe des travaux ménagers et de l'entretien des enfants.Avec les difficultés économiques que vit son mari ces dernières années, elle a commencé à mener des activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce de denrées alimentaires, pour le soutenir.Elle achète ainsi en gros et revend ses produits en détails aux femmes du village.Cela lui rapporte des bénéfices qui servent surtout à améliorer l'alimentation de la famille. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter du riz, de l'huile et du sucre. Son ambition est de construire une boutique au marché de sa localité.
texts.en:
Mane is a married woman.  She is the mother of four children, two of whom are attending elementary school.  

Since she got married 15 years ago, Mane has been a homemaker, taking care of the household and children.  However, her husband has been experiencing economic difficulties in recent years and she has started to help him by getting involved in income-generating activities such as retail food business.  She buys food products wholesale and resells them for retail to women in her village.  This activity brings profits which mainly allow Mane to improve her family's diet.

In order to boost her business, Mane is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs for the purchase of rice, oil and sugar.  Her ambition is to build a shop at her local market.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: This time, Violeta is borrowing 10,000 PHP to fund her general store business. Her business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA, and it continues to provide Violeta with income that is improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en:
Mryna is 49 years old and married with 11 children. She is from Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Mryna used her last loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer such as manure. Her business has grown and become successful. 

She is now taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: This time, for her 8th cycle loan, Wilma is borrowing PHP 19000 to continue funding for her general store business. Violeta's business was previously funded through KIVA partner and NWTF to continue to provide her, and her family, with income to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Rodelita

texts.en:
Rodelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a banana retail business in the Philippines. Rodelita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Rodelita would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Annalisa

texts.en:
Annalisa is 31 years old and single. She has an electronic reloading business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 4100 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Annalisa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is married and has 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Azucena is 58 years old and has one child who is in school.

Azucena has a ready to wear business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. Azucena has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Azucena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sugarcane farming business in the Philippines.

Basilisa is borrowing PHP 4100 through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Basilisa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money. She will be helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet's group is comprised of 3 hard-working women. Annet is 22 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with one of them currently in school. For the past year, Annet has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells bricks. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to pay her workers and buy firewood to burn the bricks. This will help Annet to generate greater profits and pay her half of the school fees for her child. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to start another business that sells fresh food. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Annet's future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay her workers and buy firewood to burn the bricks

loans.name: Ines Marisol

texts.es:
Ines es una mujer muy trabajadora, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, paprika entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Ines le gusta salir a pasear sobre todo para despejarse un poco y olvidarse de la preocupaciones cotidianas y del mal humor; Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios , pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Administración de empresas.

Con mucho entusiasmo Ines trabaja en su negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 4 horas diarias, es muy dedicada se levanta muy temprano para alimentar a los cerdos y limpiar el lugar donde los cría; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque alimenta muy bien a los cerdos y por ello los clientes siempre van a su negocio porque saben que son criados de buena manera.

Ines está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar un mejoramiento de los corrales donde cría a los cerdos, con esta mejora habrá un mejor espacio para los cerdos y podrá criar mas cerditos y mejorar sus ingresos, para así seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande y tener una vida feliz”.
texts.en:
Ines is a hardworking woman. Her home is located in the city of Ica, which is known for having warm weather throughout the year. In addition this city has developed its agriculture, especially its cotton, asparagus, and pepper crops, among others. Whenever she has free time available, Ines enjoys going for walks so that she can unwind a bit, forget about her everyday worries, and get out of a bad mood. Since her parents had limited financial resources, Ines only has a high school education. She would have liked to have studied Business Administration.

Ines works with great enthusiasm in her business of raising and selling pigs. She works approximately four hours a day and is very dedicated. Ines wakes up very early so that she can feed the pigs and clean the area where they are raised. She believes she is doing well in her business because the pigs are well-fed and her customers always purchase from her because they know the pigs have been raised in a fine manner.

Ines is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance that will be given to her, she will be able to make improvements to the animals pens where the pigs are kept. These improvements will provide more space for the pigs and she will be able to raise more piglets and improve her income. Ines continues to strive each day to accomplish her greatest dream of having a larger business and a happy life.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to her pig pens.

loans.name: Nelson Benjamin

texts.es:
El señor Nelson Benjamin está casado, tiene 57 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 6 hijos, se dedica al tricotado de hilos y tejido de cortes y servilletas, lleva 40 años de experiencia realizando este trabajo, inició con sus padres, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos y tintes, y así poder ampliar su producción, espera seguir prosperando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelson Benjamin, 57, is married and has six children.  He finished six years of primary education.  He works knitting yarn and hand-woven fabrics and napkins.  He has 40 years of experience doing this work.  He started with his parents.  He has the help of his wife, who does domestic work.

He is requesting a loan that he will use to buy yarn and dye, and so be able to expand his production.  He hopes to continue to prosper in his business.

loans.use: to buy yarn for knitting.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso  es un hombre que tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con dos  hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cònyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Narciso vive en  el caserío Fanupe Barrio Nuevo del distrito de Mòrrope y departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Narciso es la crianza/venta de ganado vacuno, ovinos, caprinos  y aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Narciso cuenta con 8 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo también esta dedicado a la agricultura donde tiene instalado 1.5ha. De cultivo de arroz donde   le permite tener otro ingresos. Su cònyuge tambièn le apoya en estas actividades y mantiene una buena relacion familiar.
Actualmente Narciso se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.3000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados, vitaminas para sus animales, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Narciso is a 55-year-old gentleman who is married and has two dependent children. He and his wife live in their own home. It should be mentioned that the quality of life in his community is subsistent. Most of the residents are independent workers who engage in trade and the breeding of small animals. Some of them also engage in agriculture. Narciso lives in the village of Fanupe Barrio Nuevo in the District of Mòrrope, Department of Lambayeque. The only basic service available in this area is electricity and the drinking water comes from an artesian well. All of the families that reside here must live under these conditions.

Narciso's business involves raising selling cattle, sheep, goats, and poultry. The animals are kept in pens just outside of his home. Narciso has eight years of experience in this business and has been able to maintain an established customer base. He sells the animals to wholesale traders in the area. Narciso is also a farmer and has 1.5 hectares of rice that he is cultivating in order to generate additional income. His wife also helps him with these business activities and they maintain a good family relationship.

At the moment, Narciso plans to expand his inventory in terms of raising and selling animals since this type of business is very profitable in this area. Under these circumstances, he is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3,000 PEN so that he can invest in the purchase of balanced feed and vitamins for his animals. Over time, this will help to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 62 years old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dolores runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, noodles, curls, soft drinks, eggs and sugar. 

In the future, Dolores would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 55 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy stocks to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, noodles, canned goods and spices. 

In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mbap

texts.fr: Mbap pratique l'agriculture depuis bientôt 40 ans. Il a hérité des terres de son père et y cultive du petit milet, de l'arachide et des haricots. Il mène parallèlement à cette activité un élevage de boeufs.Il les achète à des prix moyens , les engraisse puis les revend dans les grandes villes à de bons prix. Les bénéfices tirés de cette activité économiques lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins d'entretien de sa famille et à ses propres besoins. Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter 2 boeufs. Son ambition est de clôturer son champs pour en faire une ferme d'élevage.
texts.en: Mbap has been a farmer for close to 40 years.  He inherited his land from his father and grows pear millet, groundnuts and beans.  Meanwhile, he also raises oxen.  He buys oxen at average prices, fattens them up and then resells them in big cities for good prices.  The profits from this economic activity allow him to take care of his family's needs and to provide for himself.  He is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy two oxen.  His ambition is to enclose his field and turn it into a cattle farm.

loans.use: to buy two oxen.

loans.name: Nancy Relida

texts.es: Nancy es socia del Bancomunal Alondras, tiene 31 años de edad, es  madre de 1 hijo, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años. Se dedica a la venta de palos de leña. Se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado con sus ahorros, ella dice que las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal son excelentes ya que gracias a ellas aprendió a valorarse y a saber invertir su dinero. Su meta es tener una tienda de abarrotes. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de palos de leña para su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank "Alondras" (Larks). She is 31 years old and the mother of one child. Nancy has been with FINCA Peru for three years. She sells wooden logs. Nancy is proud of everything she has accomplished with her savings. She says the training classes offered by her Communal Bank are excellent. They have taught her how to value herself and how to invest her money. Her goal is to open a grocery store.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wooden logs for her business.

loans.use: to purchase wooden logs.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 59 years old and married with 7 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Florentina has a general store business in the Philippines. Florentina has requested a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like shampoo and groceries, in her general store.

Florentina has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Silvia Karina

texts.es:
Silvia  es una mujer que tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Silvia vive en  el  caserío Wiracocha ,distrito de Tambogrande y departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Silvia es la crianza/venta de ganado ovinos  y aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Silvia cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge cuenta con 0.5 has de limòn instalada, donde presenta buen desarrollo vegetativo, donde le permite tener ingresos adicionales.Actualmente Silvia se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/ 1000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la de compra de Fertilizantes, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 23 year-old woman who is in a domestic partnership and has two children. She lives in her own house with her partner and children. She mentions that the quality of life in her community is one of subsistence. The majority of residents are independent workers in commerce or animal husbandry, with some others working in agriculture. Silvia lives in the hamlet of Wiracocha in Tambogrande district and Piura department, where there is only basic electricity service and water is pumped from a traditional well. Every family that lives there lives under these conditions.

Silvia's commercial activity is raising and selling sheep and poultry. She raises the animals in pens outside her house. Silvia has five years of experience with this work, which has helped her to maintain her business' established clientele. She sells her animals to the wholesale merchants in the area. Furthermore, her partner has 0.5 hectares of lemon trees planted, where crop development is going well. This brings in additional income.

Currently, Silvia has proposed to increase the inventory of animals that she is raising and selling because it is a very profitable business in the area. These are the circumstances under which she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1,000 nuevos soles. The purpose is to buy fertilizer that, with time, will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Ángela Justina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Sultana se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

La señora  Ángela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar su situación económica. Tiene 74  años de edad,  hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda con 4 hijos los mismos que ya  son mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ella.

Ella para salir adelante junto a su familia, y mucho mas después de la muerte de su esposo, siguió con el negocio que él tenia en vida, ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados, ya que todos sus hijos trabajan. Nos cuenta que ya tiene más de 20 años con su negocio y que por esto pudo salir adelante sola con sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Sultana” meets every fifteen days in the canton of Jipijapa, a canton known as “La Sultana del Café” because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine, and for the warmth of its people. 

Angela is a founding member of the communal bank and she enjoys being a member because the loans have helped her business get head and improve her financial situation.  She is 74 years old.  Many years ago her husband passed away and she became a widow with four children who are all adults, three of whom still live with her. 

In order to get ahead with her family, after the death of her husband, she continued the business her husband had in life.  She has a grocery store in her house and there she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, legumes, vegetables, and fruits.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Her children help her with her work when they can and aren't busy since all of her children work.  She tell us that she has had her business for over 20 years and because of this she has been able to get ahead on her own with her children. 

She will use this loan to better stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic staple products. 

Her dream is to have good health so as to continue getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic staple products.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, es padre soltero, tiene un hijo con el cual vive en la casa de sus padres  ocupa solo una habitación y la casa esta ubicada en la zona Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz.
El hijo de José, estudia en la Universidad es por eso que el crédito lo necesita para pagar los estudios universitarios ya que no cuenta con muchos ingresos por que se dedica a la venta de arroz  más de diez horas al día y lo hace de forma ambulante ya que no tiene  un puesto fijo de venta  y con eso solventa los gastos familiares, y médicos ya que  tampoco cuenta con un seguro medico.
El sueño de José, es poder tener una casa para darle más comodidad y seguridad a su hijo ya que esta en etapa de adolescencia y necesita su propio espacio.
Es la segunda vez que José trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
Los recursos financieros con los que cuentan los clientes de Impro normalmente no les alcanzan para la educación de sus hijos; por esto es que muchas veces solicitan créditos durante la época de inicio de clases de sus hijos que van a escuelas primarias y/o secundarias, para pago de matrículas, compra de útiles escolares y uniformes, como también para sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
José is a single father. He and his son occupy a room at his parents' house, which is located in the District of Achachicala in the city of La Paz.

José's son is studying at a university. For this reason, he needs a loan to pay for his university studies since he does not have much income. José sells rice and works more than 10 hours a day as a street vendor. He does not have an established location where he conducts his sales. With the income he earns, José is able to cover the family expenses and pay for visits to the doctor since he does not have medical insurance. José dreams of owning a house where he can provide greater comfort and security for his son at this stage in his life since young people need their own space.

This is the second time José has worked with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

The financial resources at the dispoal of IMPRO clients are normally not enough to provide for their children's education. For this reason, loans are often requested at the beginning of the school year in order to pay for primary or secondary school tuition, purchase school supplies and uniforms, as well as to pay for college.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university studies.

loans.name: Liz Nelly

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Sultana se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Liz, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad, pero uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo y a sus hijos en sus gastos de estudios se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y más que todo ropa interior, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, de tres a cuatro  días a la semana sale a recorrer con sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y  cobra cada 8 días, la mercadería la va a comprar cada quince días a Guayaquil o cuando  necesita. Lleva  5  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas entre otras prendas.  Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito emprendió su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
La Sultana Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as La Sultana del Café because of its extensive fields of incomparable tasting coffee, its cuisine, and the warmth of its people. 

Here we met Liz.  She is 42 years old and married, and from this relationship she has two adult children, one of whom still lives in her house.  Her husband is a driver.

With the goal of earning something on her own to be able to help her husband and her children with educational expenses, she works selling all types of clothing, especially underwear.  She sells door to door.  Three or four days a week she goes out with her products, which she leaves on credit and collects for every week.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy the merchandise every two weeks or whenever she needs to.  She has been doing this work for five years and it is going very well for her.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and other clothing.  She has been in the communal bank for five years and she likes it because she started her business with her first loan.

Her dream is to have a car to make her trips.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and other garments.
